00005.Title: The Shadow: Pulling the Strings
00005.Text:
Draft format only.
You can use agendas from all factions in this deck.

Details.flavor: The Past is the Future.
"This war is far from over."

00007.Title: Wyvern: Chemically Enhanced
00007.Text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [anarch] cards installed than any other faction, whenever you trash a Corp card, shuffle the top card of your heap into your stack.

00008.Title: Boris "Syfr" Kovac: Crafty Veteran
00008.Text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [criminal] cards installed than any other faction, when your turn begins, remove 1 tag.

00009.Title: Jamie "Bzzz" Micken: Techno Savant
00009.Text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [shaper] cards installed than any other faction, when you install a card the first time each turn, draw 1 card.

00010.Title: Strategic Innovations: Future Forward
00010.Text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [haas-bioroid] cards rezzed than any other faction, when the Runner's turn ends, shuffle 1 card in Archives into R&D.

00011.Title: Synthetic Systems: The World Re-imagined
00011.Text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [jinteki] cards rezzed than any other faction, when your turn begins, you may swap 2 pieces of installed ice.

00012.Title: Information Dynamics: All You Need To Know
00012.Text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [nbn] cards rezzed than any other faction, whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, give the runner 1 tag.

00013.Title: Fringe Applications: Tomorrow, Today
00013.Text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [weyland-consortium] cards rezzed than any other faction, when the Runner's turn begins, place an advancement token on a piece of ice.

01001.Title: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire
01001.Text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.

Details.flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."

01002.Title: Déjà Vu
01002.Text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.

Details.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.

01003.Title: Demolition Run
01003.Text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).

Details.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

01004.Title: Stimhack
01004.Text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.

01005.Title: Cyberfeeder
01005.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.

Details.flavor: I feel almost naked without it

01006.Title: Grimoire
01006.Text: +2[mu] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard
"If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru

01008.Title: Datasucker
01008.Text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.

01009.Title: Djinn
01009.Text: Djinn can host up to 3[mu] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [click], 1[credit]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

01010.Title: Medium
01010.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.

Details.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.
November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.

01012.Title: Parasite
01012.Text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.

01013.Title: Wyrm
01013.Text:
3[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 0 or less strength.
1[credit]: Ice has -1 strength.
1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: Fire and ichor…
The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!

01015.Title: Ice Carver
01015.Text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.

Details.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.

01016.Title: Wyldside
01016.Text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [click].

Details.flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

01017.Title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional
01017.Text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."

01018.Title: Account Siphon
01018.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lose up to 5[credit], then you gain 2[credit] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.

Details.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"

01020.Title: Forged Activation Orders
01020.Text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.

Details.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.

01021.Title: Inside Job
01021.Text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.

Details.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."

01022.Title: Special Order
01022.Text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…

01023.Title: Lemuria Codecracker
01023.Text: [click], 1[credit]: Expose 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.

Details.flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." -Gabriel Santiago

01024.Title: Desperado
01024.Text: +1[mu] Gain 1[credit] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.

01026.Title: Femme Fatale
01026.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.

Details.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.

01028.Title: Sneakdoor Beta
01028.Text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.

Details.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

01029.Title: Bank Job
01029.Text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.

01030.Title: Crash Space
01030.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.

Details.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.

"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that, D?"
"The curlers."

01033.Title: Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker
01033.Text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.

Details.flavor: "Are you listening?"
Diesel gives you flames.

01035.Title: Modded
01035.Text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.

Details.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.

01036.Title: The Maker's Eye
01036.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.

Details.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

01037.Title: Tinkering
01037.Text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.

Details.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."

The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.

01039.Title: Rabbit Hole
01039.Text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.

01040.Title: The Personal Touch
01040.Text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.

Details.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…

01041.Title: The Toolbox
01041.Text: +2[mu] +2[link] 2[recurring-credit] Use the credits to pay for using icebreakers. Limit 1 console per player.

01042.Title: Battering Ram
01042.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

01043.Title: Gordian Blade
01043.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.

The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.

01045.Title: Net Shield
01045.Text: 1[credit]: Prevent the first net damage this turn.

Details.flavor: Sucks energy like a martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused

01046.Title: Pipeline
01046.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

01047.Title: Aesop's Pawnshop
01047.Text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].

Details.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.

01048.Title: Sacrificial Construct
01048.Text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.

Details.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
"Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.

01051.Title: Crypsis
01051.Text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.

Details.flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay…

01053.Title: Armitage Codebusting
01053.Text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.

Details.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

01054.Title: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future
01054.Text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.

01055.Title: Accelerated Beta Test
01055.Text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.

01056.Title: Adonis Campaign
01056.Text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.

01057.Title: Aggressive Secretary
01057.Text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.

01058.Title: Archived Memories
01058.Text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.

Details.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"

"Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."

01060.Title: Shipment from MirrorMorph
01060.Text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).

Details.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

01061.Title: Heimdall 1.0
01061.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.

01062.Title: Ichi 1.0
01062.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

01063.Title: Viktor 1.0
01063.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
Whrrrrr!

01065.Title: Corporate Troubleshooter
01065.Text: X[credit], [trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.

Details.flavor: "I solve problems."

01066.Title: Experiential Data
01066.Text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.

Details.flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only gong to make things worse, he thought.

01067.Title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution
01067.Text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

01068.Title: Nisei MK II
01068.Text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.

01069.Title: Project Junebug
01069.Text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.

01070.Title: Snare!
01070.Text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.

01071.Title: Zaibatsu Loyalty
01071.Text:
If the Runner is about to expose a card, you may rez Zaibatsu Loyalty.
1[credit] or [trash]: Prevent 1 card from being exposed.

01072.Title: Neural EMP
01072.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.

01073.Title: Precognition
01073.Text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.

Details.flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.

01074.Title: Cell Portal
01074.Text: [subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.

Details.flavor: "Where does it go?"

01075.Title: Chum
01075.Text: [subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. Do 3 net damage unless the Runner breaks all subroutines on that piece of ice.

Details.flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

01076.Title: Data Mine
01076.Text: [subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.

Details.flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n

Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.

01078.Title: Wall of Thorns
01078.Text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.

01079.Title: Akitaro Watanabe
01079.Text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.

Details.flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.

01080.Title: NBN: Making News
01080.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.

Details.flavor: Someone is Always Watching.

01081.Title: AstroScript Pilot Program
01081.Text: Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.

01082.Title: Breaking News
01082.Text:
When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.
When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.

Details.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

01084.Title: Closed Accounts
01084.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.

01085.Title: Psychographics
01085.Text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

Details.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

01086.Title: SEA Source
01086.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

01087.Title: Ghost Branch
01087.Text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.

01088.Title: Data Raven
01088.Text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.

01089.Title: Matrix Analyzer
01089.Text:
When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.

01090.Title: Tollbooth
01090.Text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."

01091.Title: Red Herrings
01091.Text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.

01092.Title: SanSan City Grid
01092.Text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."

01093.Title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
01093.Text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.

Details.flavor: Moving Upwards.

01094.Title: Hostile Takeover
01094.Text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

01095.Title: Posted Bounty
01095.Text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."

01096.Title: Security Subcontract
01096.Text: [click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4[credit].

Details.flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." -Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security

01097.Title: Aggressive Negotiation
01097.Text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."

The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.

01099.Title: Scorched Earth
01099.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.

Details.flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries…"

01100.Title: Shipment from Kaguya
01100.Text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.

Details.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."

01101.Title: Archer
01101.Text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

01102.Title: Hadrian's Wall
01102.Text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though." -g00ru

01103.Title: Ice Wall
01103.Text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

01104.Title: Shadow
01104.Text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti

01105.Title: Research Station
01105.Text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.

Details.flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."

01106.Title: Priority Requisition
01106.Text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.

Details.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"

01107.Title: Private Security Force
01107.Text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."

Details.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."

"The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
It is like the one you just bought, only better.
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

01111.Title: Enigma
01111.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."

01112.Title: Hunter
01112.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
"There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

02001.Title: Whizzard: Master Gamer
02001.Text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.

Details.flavor: "Running is the ultimate game, and I get to make all the rules."

02002.Title: Spinal Modem
02002.Text: +1[mu], 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.

02003.Title: Imp
02003.Text:
Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.
Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed).

Details.flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.

02005.Title: Cortez Chip
02005.Text: [trash]: Choose a piece of ice. The Corp must pay 2[credit] as an additional cost to rez that ice until the end of the turn.

Details.flavor: Named after Hernando Cortez, a former Weyland technician convicted of smuggling company tech. He still collected his pension while in prison, the last beneficiary of a loophole in Weyland's standard employment contract.
Show-off.

02007.Title: ZU.13 Key Master
02007.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of ZU.13 Key Master is 0, even if it is not installed. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: He always uses the same key.

02008.Title: The Helpful AI
02008.Text: +1[link] [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the turn.

Details.flavor: "What causes an Artifical Intellegence to turn on its master? Is it because its directives have been altered by some external source? Or, by giving them agency to adapt, have we fated them to revolt?" -Emilio Harris, Creators and the Created

02009.Title: Plascrete Carapace
02009.Text: Place 4 power counters on Plascrete Carapace when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Plascrete Carapace, trash it. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.

Details.flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.

02011.Title: Mandatory Upgrades
02011.Text: You have 1 additional [click] to spend each turn.

Details.flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.

02012.Title: Janus 1.0
02012.Text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Janus 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: Face your fear.

02013.Title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY
02013.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: "Eyes forward please."

02014.Title: Braintrust
02014.Text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.

02015.Title: Snowflake
02015.Text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. End the run if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.

Details.flavor: Sometimes uniqueness is overrated.

02016.Title: Restructured Datapool
02016.Text: [click]: <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger room."

02017.Title: TMI
02017.Text:
When you rez TMI, <trace>trace 2</trace> if unsuccessful, derez TMI.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: A collection of cast-off cyberjunk. But it doesn't stay junk for long.

02018.Title: Project Atlas
02018.Text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

02019.Title: Caduceus
02019.Text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, end the run.

Details.flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.

02020.Title: Dracō
02020.Text:
When you rez Dracō, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on it.
Dracō has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.

Details.flavor: Victōs draconēs numquam deride.

02021.Title: Vamp
02021.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may pay X[credit] to force the Corp to lose up to X[credit], then take 1 tag.

Details.flavor: There was a certain schadenfreude about throwing away your credits.

02022.Title: Liberated Account
02022.Text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.

Details.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.

T-minus 13 seconds. Leela had to work fast. She jacked in the mesa wire and activated the screen. 7 seconds. The internal SLD was still booting. 4 seconds. The interface flickered to life with an orange glow. 2 seconds. With a tap of a finger she was in.

02024.Title: e3 Feedback Implants
02024.Text:
Whenever you break a subroutine on a piece of ice, you may pay 1[credit] to break 1 subroutine on that ice.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>

Details.flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and automatic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.

02025.Title: Compromised Employee
02025.Text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit during traces.
Gain 1[credit] whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.

02026.Title: Notoriety
02026.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

Details.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.

02027.Title: Snowball
02027.Text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever you use Snowball to break a subroutine, it has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.

Details.flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" -Chaos Theory
Archaic but reliable.

02029.Title: Encryption Protocol
02029.Text: The trash cost of all installed cards is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: The key to the future lies in the past.

02030.Title: Sherlock 1.0
02030.Text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Sherlock 1.0.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.

02031.Title: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection
02031.Text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.

02032.Title: Fetal AI
02032.Text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[credit].

02033.Title: Trick of Light
02033.Text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.

Details.flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.

02034.Title: Sensei
02034.Text: [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, each piece of ice encountered except Sensei gains "[subroutine] End the run" after all its other subroutines.

Details.flavor: Peace and violence. Both must lead to the same place.

02035.Title: Big Brother
02035.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Give the Runner 2 tags.

Details.flavor: Looking out for your interests since 1984.

02036.Title: ChiLo City Grid
02036.Text: Whenever there is a successful trace during a run on this server, give the Runner 1 tag. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: Clones whisper of ChiLo as a promised land of freedom.

02037.Title: Power Grid Overload
02037.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.

02038.Title: Amazon Industrial Zone
02038.Text: Whenever you install a piece of ice protecting this server, you may immediately rez it, lowering its rez cost by 3. Limit 1 region per server.

02039.Title: Executive Retreat
02039.Text: When you score Executive Retreat, place 1 agenda counter on it and shuffle HQ into R&D. [click], hosted agenda counter: Draw 5 cards.

02040.Title: Freelancer
02040.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash up to 2 resources.

Details.flavor: No contract. Just a handshake and a fistful of C-6 high explosives.

02041.Title: Nerve Agent
02041.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Nerve Agent.
Each virus counter after the first on Nerve Agent allows you to access 1 additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.

02042.Title: Joshua B.
02042.Text: When your turn begins, you may gain [click]. If you do, take 1 tag when this turn ends.

Details.flavor: "My enhancements are guaranteed for life, and well worth the risk."

02043.Title: Emergency Shutdown
02043.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.

Details.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda

02044.Title: Muresh Bodysuit
02044.Text: Prevent the first meat damage each turn.

Details.flavor: Light and form-fitting, its like bulletproof skin.

02045.Title: Snitch
02045.Text: Once per run, you may expose an unrezzed piece of ice when you approach it. You may then jack out.

Details.flavor: "A snitch is a girl's best friend." -Andromeda
"Have you met Dinosaurus?"

02047.Title: Test Run
02047.Text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.

02048.Title: Dinosaurus
02048.Text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.

02049.Title: Personal Workshop
02049.Text:
[click]: Host a program or piece of hardware from your grip on Personal Workshop and place power counters on it equal to its install cost.
1[credit]: Remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When there are no power counters left on a hosted card, install it, ignoring all costs.

02050.Title: Public Sympathy
02050.Text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.

Details.flavor: "I'm just thankful that the brain damage is reversible. With the support of the city of New Angeles, I hope to be on my feet and back to practicing my art very soon." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

02051.Title: Project Vitruvius
02051.Text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.

02052.Title: Viper
02052.Text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, end the run.

Details.flavor: Dont Tread On Me

02053.Title: Edge of World
02053.Text: If Edge of World is installed and you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses it, do 1 brain damage for each piece of ice protecting this server.

02054.Title: Sunset
02054.Text: Choose a server. Arrange the ice protecting that server in any order.

Details.flavor: "You haven't run until you've seen the cybersun drift down behind the Great City, the space around you rippling with colors you can't imagine." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

02055.Title: Marked Accounts
02055.Text:
When your turn begins, take 1[credit] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Marked Accounts.

02056.Title: Pop-up Window
02056.Text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory

02057.Title: Woodcutter
02057.Text: Woodcutter can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each advancement token on it.

Details.flavor: Chop chop.

02058.Title: Commercialization
02058.Text: Choose a piece of ice. Gain 1[credit] for each advancement token on that ice.

Details.flavor: The Division of Fringe Applications' revenue increased 37% year-over-year after corporate discovered that most of their projects made really fun toys.

02059.Title: Private Contracts
02059.Text:
Place 14[credit] from the bank on Private Contracts when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Private Contracts, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Private Contracts.

02060.Title: Chimera
02060.Text: When you rez Chimera, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Chimera gains that subtype until derezzed. When a turn ends, derez Chimera. [subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Three heads. One big headache.

02061.Title: Disrupter
02061.Text: [trash]: Prevent a trace. That trace initiates again with a base trace strength of 0.

Details.flavor: "Saved my bacon more than once, but gives a wicked sense of déjà vu." -Whizzard

02062.Title: Force of Nature
02062.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: It always strikes twice.

02063.Title: Scrubber
02063.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.

Details.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

02064.Title: Doppelgänger
02064.Text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: Twice the fun.

02065.Title: Crescentus
02065.Text: [trash]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only after breaking all the subroutines of that ice during a single encounter.

Details.flavor: Cyberspace's strongest glue.

02066.Title: Deus X
02066.Text: [trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.

Details.flavor: Didn't see that coming.
"I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour

02068.Title: Inside Man
02068.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install hardware.

Details.flavor: Few corporate employees have such wide-sweeping security clearance as the janitorial staff. Most corps foolishly think they're too dim-witted to take advantage of it.

02069.Title: Underworld Contact
02069.Text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].

Details.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.

02071.Title: Hourglass
02071.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.

Details.flavor: Time just slips away.

02072.Title: Dedicated Server
02072.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez ice.

Details.flavor:
so very still, even
cherry blossoms are not stirred
by the temple bell
-Fuhaku

02073.Title: Bullfrog
02073.Text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, move Bullfrog so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server).

02074.Title: Uroboros
02074.Text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner cannot make another run this turn.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, end the run.

Details.flavor: Where one thing ends, another begins.

02075.Title: Net Police
02075.Text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during traces. X is the number of links the Runner has.

Details.flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.

02076.Title: Weyland Consortium: Because We Built It
02076.Text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to advance ice.

Details.flavor: Constructing Cyberspace.
It's really hard to lose a government contract.

02078.Title: Tyrant
02078.Text: Tyrant can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.

Details.flavor: Thou shall not pass.

02079.Title: Oversight AI
02079.Text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."

02080.Title: False Lead
02080.Text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [click][click], if able.

Details.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.

02081.Title: Surge
02081.Text:
Play only if you placed at least 1 virus counter on a program this turn.
Place 2 virus counters on that program.

Details.flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.

02082.Title: Xanadu
02082.Text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.

Details.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge

02083.Title: Andromeda: Dispossessed Ristie
02083.Text: You draw a starting hand of 9 cards.

Details.flavor: "I run with the best."

02084.Title: Networking
02084.Text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[credit] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.

Details.flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.

02085.Title: HQ Interface
02085.Text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.

Details.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.

02086.Title: Pheromones
02086.Text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.

Details.flavor: She at her P.A.D. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.

02088.Title: Replicator
02088.Text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware (including Replicator), you may search your stack for another copy of that hardware, reveal it, and add it your grip. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: Do you really need another one?

02089.Title: Creeper
02089.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Creeper is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor:
"The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout…"
-Chaos Theory

02090.Title: Kraken
02090.Text:
Play only if you stole an agenda this turn.
Choose a server. The Corp trashes 1 piece of ice protecting that server.

Details.flavor: Early permutations of the kraken proved to be insatiable, ice-devouring marauders. Not much has changed.

02091.Title: Kati Jones
02091.Text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.

Details.flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."

02092.Title: Eve Campaign
02092.Text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from Eve Campaign.

02093.Title: Rework
02093.Text: Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.

Details.flavor: Also known as "development hell."

02094.Title: Whirlpool
02094.Text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.

Details.flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru

02095.Title: Hokusai Grid
02095.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.

02096.Title: Data Hound
02096.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, look at a number of cards from the top of the Runner's stack equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength. Trash 1 of those cards, and arrange the rest in any order.

Details.flavor: Sniff.

02097.Title: Bernice Mai
02097.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 5</trace> if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.

Details.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.

02098.Title: Salvage
02098.Text: Salvage can be advanced only while rezzed and gains “[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.” for each advancement token on it.

Details.flavor: You're not in Kansas anymore.

02099.Title: Simone Diego
02099.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to advance cards in or protecting this server.

Details.flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."
"It's kind of like an anagram." -designer Phoenix

02101.Title: Retrieval Run
02101.Text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.

02102.Title: Darwin
02102.Text:
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.

02103.Title: Data Leak Reversal
02103.Text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
If you are tagged, Data Leak Reversal gains "[click]: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D."

Details.flavor: A two-way solution to a one-way problem, the data leak reversal, or DLR for short, is a misnomer. There is no actual reversal of data, only the creation of a parallel peer-to-peer link with the initial source.

02104.Title: Faerie
02104.Text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.

Details.flavor: Do you believe in faeries?

02105.Title: Mr. Li
02105.Text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.

Details.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."

02106.Title: Indexing
02106.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.

Details.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.

02107.Title: R&D Interface
02107.Text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.

Details.flavor: Works best at your own desk.

02108.Title: Deep Thought
02108.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Deep Thought.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Deep Thought, it gains "When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of R&D."

02109.Title: New Angeles City Hall
02109.Text:
2[credit]: Avoid 1 tag.
Trash New Angeles City Hall when you steal an agenda.

Details.flavor: "New Angeles is the jewel of modern civilization, and its government the envy of nations." -Mayor Wells

02110.Title: Eli 1.0
02110.Text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."

02111.Title: Ruhr Valley
02111.Text: As an additional cost to make a run on this server, the Runner must spend [click]. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: Known for luxury hoppers and a delectable sauerkraut.

02112.Title: Ronin
02112.Text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."

Details.flavor: I will serve you…for a time.

02113.Title: Midori
02113.Text: Once per run, when the Runner approaches a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with a piece of ice from HQ. The new ice is installed unrezzed.

Details.flavor: "Looks like someone is being naughty…"

02114.Title: NBN: The World is Yours*
02114.Text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: *Some restrictions may apply. Scan this card to find out more.

02115.Title: Project Beale
02115.Text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.

02116.Title: Midseason Replacements
02116.Text:
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, give the Runner tags equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.

02117.Title: Flare
02117.Text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.

Details.flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.

02118.Title: Dedicated Response Team
02118.Text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."

Details.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing

02119.Title: Burke Bugs
02119.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 0</trace> If successful, the Runner trashes 1 program.

Details.flavor: "If I had to describe the bugs in one word, it would be '****ing annoying.'" -Whizzard

02120.Title: Corporate War
02120.Text: If you have at least 7[credit] when you score Corporate War, gain 7[credit]; otherwise, lose all credits in your credit pool.

Details.flavor: There were several ways to win a corporate war. One of them was to bring out the bazookas.

03001.Title: Cerebral Imaging: Infinite Frontiers
03001.Text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.

Details.flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.

03002.Title: Custom Biotics: Engineered for Success
03002.Text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.

Details.flavor: The Once and Future Android.

03003.Title: NEXT Design: Guarding the Net
03003.Text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.

03004.Title: Director Haas' Pet Project
03004.Text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.

03005.Title: Efficiency Committee
03005.Text: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.

03006.Title: Project Wotan
03006.Text: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.

03007.Title: Sentinel Defense Program
03007.Text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" -Director Haas

03008.Title: Alix T4LB07
03008.Text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[click],[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.

Details.flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.

03009.Title: Cerebral Overwriter
03009.Text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.

03010.Title: Director Haas
03010.Text:
You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>

03011.Title: Haas Arcology AI
03011.Text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [click], hosted advancement token: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.

03012.Title: Thomas Haas
03012.Text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.

Details.flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.

03013.Title: Bioroid Efficiency Research
03013.Text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."

03014.Title: Successful Demonstration
03014.Text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7[credit].

Details.flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.

03015.Title: Heimdall 2.0
03015.Text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.

03016.Title: Howler
03016.Text: [subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.

Details.flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru

03017.Title: Ichi 2.0
03017.Text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: The game has changed.

03018.Title: Minelayer
03018.Text: [subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.

Details.flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.

03019.Title: Viktor 2.0
03019.Text: The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [subroutine] End the run.

03020.Title: Zed 1.0
03020.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?

03021.Title: Awakening Center
03021.Text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7[credit], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.

03022.Title: Tyr's Hand
03022.Text: If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez Tyr's Hand. [trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.

Details.flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth

03024.Title: Levy University
03024.Text: [click], 1[credit]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru

03025.Title: Server Diagnostics
03025.Text:
Gain 2[credit] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.

Details.flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."

The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.

03027.Title: Datapike
03027.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

03028.Title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman
03028.Text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.

Details.flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."

03029.Title: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge
03029.Text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.

Details.flavor: "New technology destroys the old."

03030.Title: Exile: Streethawk
03030.Text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: "I can make that work."

03031.Title: Escher
03031.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.

03032.Title: Exploratory Romp
03032.Text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.

Details.flavor: Wheeeee!

03033.Title: Freelance Coding Contract
03033.Text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[credit] for each program trashed.

Details.flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas

03034.Title: Scavenge
03034.Text:
Trash an installed program.
If you do, install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

Details.flavor: One man's trash.

03035.Title: Levy AR Lab Access
03035.Text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.

Details.flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.

03036.Title: Monolith
03036.Text: +3[mu] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4[credit]. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.

03037.Title: Feedback Filter
03037.Text:
3[credit]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.

Details.flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.

03038.Title: Clone Chip
03038.Text: [trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).

Details.flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.

03039.Title: Omni-drive
03039.Text:
Omni-drive can host a single program of 1[mu] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.

03040.Title: Atman
03040.Text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.

Details.flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.

03041.Title: Cloak
03041.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.

Details.flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"

03042.Title: Dagger
03042.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.

Details.flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant

03043.Title: Chakana
03043.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.

03044.Title: Cyber-Cypher
03044.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can only be used during a run on the chosen server.

03045.Title: Paricia
03045.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash assets.

Details.flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.

03046.Title: Self-modifying Code
03046.Text: 2[credit], [trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." -The Professor

03047.Title: Sahasrara
03047.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).

Details.flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.

03048.Title: Inti
03048.Text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.

03050.Title: Borrowed Satellite
03050.Text:
+1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.

03051.Title: Ice Analyzer
03051.Text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[credit] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.

Details.flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile

03052.Title: Dirty Laundry
03052.Text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[credit] if it was successful.

Details.flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…

03053.Title: Daily Casts
03053.Text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.

Details.flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert.

03054.Title: Same Old Thing
03054.Text: [click], [click], [trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).

Details.flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.

03055.Title: The Source
03055.Text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[credit].
Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.

Details.flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.

04001.Title: Frame Job
04001.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." -Noise

04002.Title: Pawn
04002.Text: [click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server. Whenever you make a successful run while Pawn is hosted on a piece of ice, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs. Errata from FAQ 3.0.1

04003.Title: Rook
04003.Text: [click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.

04004.Title: Hostage
04004.Text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.

04005.Title: Gorman Drip v1
04005.Text:
Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw 1 card or gain 1[credit] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[click], [trash]: Gain 1[credit] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.

Details.flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.

04006.Title: Lockpick
04006.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using decoders.

Details.flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04007.Title: False Echo
04007.Text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.

Details.flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler

04008.Title: Motivation
04008.Text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.

Details.flavor: Normal people-sane people-do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

04009.Title: John Masanori
04009.Text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."

04010.Title: Project Ares
04010.Text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: Who wants to start a war?

04011.Title: NEXT Bronze
04011.Text: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.

04012.Title: Celebrity Gift
04012.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.

Details.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.

04013.Title: Himitsu-Bako
04013.Text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.

04014.Title: Character Assassination
04014.Text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).

Details.flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." -The Professor

04015.Title: Jackson Howard
04015.Text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives to R&D.

Details.flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."

04016.Title: Invasion of Privacy
04016.Text:
As additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.

04017.Title: Geothermal Fracking
04017.Text: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.

04018.Title: Swarm
04018.Text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the Runner pays 3[credit]." for each advancement token on it.

Details.flavor: Your free trial expired. Upgrade to the full version?

04020.Title: Grim
04020.Text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor

04021.Title: Bishop
04021.Text: [click]: Host Bishop on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Bishop can be hosted only on ice protecting a central server if Bishop is on ice protecting a remote server, or on ice protecting a remote server if Bishop is on ice protecting a central server. Host ice has -2 strength.

04022.Title: Scheherazade
04022.Text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.

04023.Title: Hard at Work
04023.Text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] and lose [click].

Details.flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.

04024.Title: Recon
04024.Text: Make a run. You may jack out when you encounter the first piece of ice.

Details.flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.

04025.Title: Copycat
04025.Text: Whenever you pass a piece of ice, you may trash Copycat. If you do, choose another rezzed copy of that piece of ice protecting any server. The run continues as if you had just passed the chosen piece of ice (you are now running from the new position).

Details.flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.

04026.Title: Leviathan
04026.Text: 3[credit]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 3[credit]: +5 strength.

Details.flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient". The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hour, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking

04027.Title: Eureka!
04027.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Reveal the top card of your stack. You may install that card, lowering the install cost by 10[credit], if able; otherwise, trash it.

Details.flavor: "I've got a surprise for you."

04028.Title: Record Reconstructor
04028.Text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards you may choose 1 faceup card from Archives and add it to the top of R&D.

Details.flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor

04029.Title: Prepaid VoicePAD
04029.Text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to play events.

Details.flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.

04030.Title: Wotan
04030.Text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 3[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 installed program.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 brain damage.

04031.Title: Hellion Alpha Test
04031.Text:
Play only if the Runner installed a resource during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.

04032.Title: Clone Retirement
04032.Text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthanasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma

04033.Title: Swordsman
04033.Text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.

04034.Title: Shipment from SanSan
04034.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

Details.flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.

04035.Title: Muckraker
04035.Text:
When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.

04036.Title: The Cleaners
04036.Text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.

Details.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."

04037.Title: Elizabeth Mills
04037.Text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."

04038.Title: Off the Grid
04038.Text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.

04039.Title: Profiteering
04039.Text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[credit] for each bad publicity taken.

Details.flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.
There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".

04041.Title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter
04041.Text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."

04042.Title: Deep Red
04042.Text: +3[mu] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [click] ability without spending [click]. Limit 1 console per player.

04043.Title: Knight
04043.Text: 2[credit]: Break subroutine on host ice. [click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.

Details.flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.

04044.Title: Running Interference
04044.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.

04045.Title: Expert Schedule Analyzer
