04045.Text: [click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.

Details.flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.

04046.Title: Grifter
04046.Text: When your turn ends, gain 1[credit] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.

Details.flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.

The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.

04048.Title: Woman in the Red Dress
04048.Text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.

Details.flavor: Looks can be deceiving.

04049.Title: Raymond Flint
04049.Text:
Whenever the Corp takes at least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ.
[trash]: Expose 1 card.

Details.flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.

04050.Title: Isabel McGuire
04050.Text: [click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.

Details.flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"

04051.Title: Hudson 1.0
04051.Text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.

Details.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.

04052.Title: Accelerated Diagnostics
04052.Text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.

Details.flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"

04053.Title: Unorthodox Predictions
04053.Text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.

04054.Title: Sundew
04054.Text: The first time the Runner spends at least 1[click] on his or her turn, gain 2[credit] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.

Details.flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.

04055.Title: City Surveillance
04055.Text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.

04056.Title: Snoop
04056.Text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.

04057.Title: Ireress
04057.Text: Ireress gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit]" for each bad publicity you have.

Details.flavor: Say it really fast.

04058.Title: Power Shutdown
04058.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less. X is equal to or less than the highest install cost among all installed programs and pieces of hardware.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

04059.Title: Paper Wall
04059.Text:
If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: It folds under pressure.

04060.Title: Interns
04060.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.

Details.flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."

04061.Title: Keyhole
04061.Text: [click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and the Corp shuffles R&D.

Details.flavor: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.

04062.Title: Activist Support
04062.Text:
When the Corp turn begins, take 1 tag if you have no tags.
When your turn begins, give the Corp 1 bad publicity if he or she has no bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja

04063.Title: Lawyer Up
04063.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Remove up to 2 tags and draw 3 cards.

Details.flavor: Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.

04064.Title: Leverage
04064.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "Care to have a look?"

The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.

04066.Title: LLDS Processor
04066.Text: Whenever you install an icebreaker, that icebreaker has +1 strength until the end of the turn.

Details.flavor: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"

04067.Title: Sharpshooter
04067.Text: [trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[credit]: +2 strength.

Details.flavor: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor

04068.Title: Capstone
04068.Text: [click]: Trash any number of cards from your grip. For each trashed card of which you have another copy installed, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor

04069.Title: Starlight Crusade Funding
04069.Text: When your turn begins, lose [click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.

Details.flavor: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls…Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."

04070.Title: Rex Campaign
04070.Text:
Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5[credit].
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.

04071.Title: Fenris
04071.Text:
When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.

04072.Title: Panic Button
04072.Text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
1[credit]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.

Details.flavor: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.

04073.Title: Shock!
04073.Text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.

04074.Title: Tsurugi
04074.Text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru

04075.Title: TGTBT
04075.Text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."

04076.Title: Sweeps Week
04076.Text: Gain 1[credit] for each card in the Runner's grip.

Details.flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."

04077.Title: RSVP
04077.Text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.

04078.Title: Curtain Wall
04078.Text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor:
[subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.

04079.Title: Punitive Counterstrike
04079.Text:
<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>

Details.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

04080.Title: Veterans Program
04080.Text: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.

04081.Title: Quest Completed
04081.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).

Details.flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?

04082.Title: Hemorrhage
04082.Text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.

Details.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.

04083.Title: Tallie Perrault
04083.Text: Whenever a gray ops or black ops operation is trashed after resolving, you may give the Corp 1 bad publicity and take 1 tag. [trash]: Draw 1 card for each bad publicity the Corp has.

Details.flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.

04084.Title: Executive Wiretaps
04084.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Reveal all cards in HQ.

Details.flavor: "When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette

04085.Title: Blackguard
04085.Text: +2[mu] Whenever you expose a card, the Corp must rez it by paying its rez cost, if able. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.

"CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04087.Title: Alpha
04087.Text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Alpha only on the outermost piece of ice protecting a server.

Details.flavor: The beginning…

04088.Title: Omega
04088.Text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Omega only on the innermost piece of ice protecting a server.

Details.flavor: …and the end?

04089.Title: Blackmail
04089.Text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.

04090.Title: Blue Level Clearance
04090.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.

Details.flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.

04091.Title: Strongbox
04091.Text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.

04092.Title: Toshiyuki Sakai
04092.Text:
Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.

04093.Title: Yagura
04093.Text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

04094.Title: Restoring Face
04094.Text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.

04095.Title: Market Research
04095.Text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.

04096.Title: Wraparound
04096.Text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise

04097.Title: GRNDL: Power Unleashed
04097.Text: You start the game with 10[credit] and 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories

04098.Title: Vulcan Coverup
04098.Text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."

04099.Title: GRNDL Refinery
04099.Text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.

Details.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.

04100.Title: Subliminal Messaging
04100.Text:
Gain 1[credit]. Gain [click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.

04101.Title: Singularity
04101.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).

04102.Title: Queen's Gambit
04102.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.

04103.Title: Dyson Fractal Generator
04103.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using fracters.

Details.flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori

04104.Title: Silencer
04104.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using killers.

Details.flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage

04105.Title: Savoir-faire
04105.Text:
You cannot use Savoir-faire more than once each turn.
2[credit]: Install a program from your grip, paying the install cost.

Details.flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago

04106.Title: Fall Guy
04106.Text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.

04107.Title: Power Nap
04107.Text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Gain 2[credit]. Gain an additional 1[credit] for each double event in your heap.

Details.flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory

04108.Title: Paintbrush
04108.Text: [click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.

Details.flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04109.Title: Lucky Find
04109.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Gain 9[credit].

Details.flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.

04110.Title: Gyri Labyrinth
04110.Text: [subroutine] The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the beginning of the Corp's next turn.

Details.flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.

04111.Title: Reclamation Order
04111.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.

04112.Title: Broadcast Square
04112.Text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, <trace>trace 3</trace> if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.

Details.flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.

04113.Title: Corporate Shuffle
04113.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.

Details.flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Being replaced by an android.

04114.Title: Caprice Nisei
04114.Text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.

Details.flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.

04115.Title: Shinobi
04115.Text:
When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.

04116.Title: Marker
04116.Text: [subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04117.Title: Hive
04117.Text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

04118.Title: Witness Tampering
04118.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."

04119.Title: NAPD Contract
04119.Text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[credit].

Details.flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.

05001.Title: Harmony Medtech: Biomedical Pioneer
05001.Text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.

Details.flavor: Evolving a Better You.

05002.Title: Nisei Division: The Next Generation
05002.Text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.

05003.Title: Tennin Institute: The Secrets Within
05003.Text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.

05004.Title: House of Knives
05004.Text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.

05005.Title: Medical Breakthrough
05005.Text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.

Details.flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."

05006.Title: Philotic Entanglement
05006.Text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.

05007.Title: The Future Perfect
05007.Text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.

05008.Title: Chairman Hiro
05008.Text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

05009.Title: Mental Health Clinic
05009.Text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.

05010.Title: Psychic Field
05010.Text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.

05011.Title: Shi.Kyū
05011.Text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[credit]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.

Details.flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.

05013.Title: Cerebral Cast
05013.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."

05015.Title: Mushin No Shin
05015.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.

05016.Title: Inazuma
05016.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.

Details.flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.

05017.Title: Komainu
05017.Text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.

05018.Title: Pup
05018.Text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Yip Yip!

05019.Title: Shiro
05019.Text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[credit].

Details.flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.

05020.Title: Susanoo-no-Mikoto
05020.Text: [subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-no-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.

Details.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.

05021.Title: NeoTokyo Grid
05021.Text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.

05022.Title: Tori Hanzō
05022.Text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[credit] to do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.

05023.Title: Plan B
05023.Text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.

05024.Title: Guard
05024.Text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…

The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.

05026.Title: Diversified Portfolio
05026.Text: Gain 1[credit] for each remote server with a card installed in it.

Details.flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.

05027.Title: Fast Track
05027.Text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.

05028.Title: Iain Stirling: Retired Spook
05028.Text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.

Details.flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."

05029.Title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone
05029.Text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "Try to keep up."

05030.Title: Silhouette: Stealth Operative
05030.Text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.

Details.flavor: "Don't waste my time."
A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.

05032.Title: Early Bird
05032.Text:
Play only as your first click.
Make a run and gain [click].

Details.flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.

05033.Title: Express Delivery
05033.Text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.

05034.Title: Feint
05034.Text: Make a run on HQ. Bypass the first 2 pieces of ice encountered during this run. If successful, you cannot access any cards.

Details.flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.

05035.Title: Legwork
05035.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.

Details.flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette

05036.Title: Planned Assault
05036.Text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.

05037.Title: Logos
05037.Text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.

05038.Title: Public Terminal
05038.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to play run events.

Details.flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.

05039.Title: Unregistered S&W '35
05039.Text: Use Unregistered S&W '35 only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [click], [click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in a server without paying its trash cost.

05040.Title: Window
05040.Text: [click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.

Details.flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.

05041.Title: Alias
05041.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength. Alias cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.

Details.flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.

05042.Title: Breach
05042.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.

05043.Title: Bug
05043.Text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[credit] to reveal that card.

Details.flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
Catch me if you can!

05045.Title: Grappling Hook
05045.Text: [trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.

Details.flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.

05046.Title: Passport
05046.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. Passport cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.

Details.flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.

05047.Title: Push Your Luck
05047.Text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.

05048.Title: Security Testing
05048.Text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

Details.flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.

05049.Title: Theophilius Bagbiter
05049.Text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.

Details.flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"

05050.Title: Tri-maf Contact
05050.Text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.

Details.flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?

05051.Title: Mass Install
05051.Text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).

Details.flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say-oops, too late, here we go!"

05052.Title: Q-Coherence Chip
05052.Text:
+1[mu]
Trash Q-Coherence Chip when an installed program is trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>

Details.flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.

05053.Title: Overmind
05053.Text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

05054.Title: Oracle May
05054.Text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[credit]. Otherwise, trash it.

Details.flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"

05055.Title: Donut Taganes
05055.Text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.

06001.Title: Domestic Sleepers
06001.Text:
[click],[click],[click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers.
Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.

06002.Title: NEXT Silver
06002.Text: NEXT Silver gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.

Details.flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.

06003.Title: Lotus Field
06003.Text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe

06004.Title: Mutate
06004.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.

06005.Title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center
06005.Text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: Only the News You Need.
Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.

06007.Title: Midway Station Grid
06007.Text: The Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine during a run on this server. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.

06008.Title: The Root
06008.Text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.

Details.flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.

06009.Title: Taurus
06009.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 piece of hardware.

Details.flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.

06010.Title: Mother Goddess
06010.Text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios

06011.Title: Galahad
06011.Text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.

06012.Title: Bad Times
06012.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner's memory limit is reduced by 2 until the end of the turn.

Details.flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."

06013.Title: Cyber Threat
06013.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose a server. The Corp can rez a piece of ice protecting this server. If he or she does not, make a run on that server, during which the Corp cannot rez ice.

06014.Title: Lamprey
06014.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[credit].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.

06015.Title: Paper Tripping
06015.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
Remove all tags.

Details.flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.

06016.Title: Power Tap
06016.Text: Gain 1[credit] whenever a trace is initiated.

Details.flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines-there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago

06017.Title: Nasir Meidan: Cyber Explorer
06017.Text: Whenever you encounter a piece of ice that was just rezzed, lose all credits in your credit pool. Gain credits equal to the rez cost of that ice.

06018.Title: Social Engineering
06018.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. If the Corp rezzes that piece of ice this turn, gain credits equal to its rez cost.

06019.Title: Leprechaun
06019.Text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.

Details.flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

06020.Title: Eden Shard
06020.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may install Eden Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp draws 2 cards.
Limit 1 per deck.

06021.Title: The Foundry: Refining the Process
06021.Text: The first time you rez a piece of ice each turn, you may search R&D for another copy of that ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

06022.Title: Enhanced Login Protocol
06022.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [click].

06023.Title: Heinlein Grid
06023.Text: If the Runner loses or spends a click during a run on this server, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass

06024.Title: Encrypted Portals
06024.Text: All code gate ice have +1 strength. When you score Encrypted Portals, gain 1[credit] for each rezzed code gate.

Details.flavor: "Binary computing  is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher

06025.Title: Cerebral Static
06025.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.

Details.flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.

06026.Title: Targeted Marketing
06026.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Name a card. Gain 10[credit] whenever the Runner plays or installs a copy of that card.

06027.Title: Information Overload
06027.Text:
When the Runner encounters Information Overload, <trace>trace 1</trace> if the trace is successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
Information Overload gains "[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards." for each tag the Runner has.

Details.flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.

06028.Title: Paywall Implementation
06028.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[credit] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.

06029.Title: Sealed Vault
06029.Text:
1[credit]: Move any number of credits from your credit pool to Sealed Vault.
[click] or [trash]: Move any number of credits from Sealed Vault to your credit pool.

Details.flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.

06030.Title: Eden Fragment
06030.Text:
Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.

06031.Title: Lag Time
06031.Text: This operation is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. All ice have +1 strength.

Details.flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel

06032.Title: Will-o'-the-Wisp
06032.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.

06033.Title: D4v1d
06033.Text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.

Details.flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.

06034.Title: Scrubbed
06034.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.

06035.Title: Three Steps Ahead
06035.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
When this turn ends, gain 2[credit] for each successful run you made during it.

Details.flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.

06036.Title: Unscheduled Maintenance
06036.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.

Details.flavor: What goes up must always go down.

06037.Title: Cache
06037.Text: Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette

06038.Title: Net Celebrity
06038.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit during a run.

Details.flavor: Fifteen seconds of fame.

06039.Title: LLDS Energy Regulator
06039.Text: 3[credit] or [trash]: Prevent an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.

Details.flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.

06040.Title: Ghost Runner
06040.Text:
Place 3[credit] on Ghost Runner when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Ghost Runner, trash it.
You can use the credits on Ghost Runner during a run.

Details.flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?

06041.Title: IQ
06041.Text:
The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ.
IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited beither by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.

06042.Title: Eliza's Toybox
06042.Text: [click],[click],[click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.

Details.flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.

06043.Title: Kitsune
06043.Text: [subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ.  The Runner accesses that card.  If he or she does, trash Kitsune.

Details.flavor: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise.  And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret...

06044.Title: Port Anson Grid
06044.Text: The Runner cannot jack out while running on this server unless he or she trashes 1 installed program. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.

"There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya.  The NAPD is offering a reward for anyone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here.  He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."

06046.Title: Manhunt
06046.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace 2 if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

06047.Title: Wendigo
06047.Text: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of this run.

06048.Title: Crisium Grid
06048.Text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gargarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.

06049.Title: Chronos Project
06049.Text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.

Details.flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.

06050.Title: Shattered Remains
06050.Text:
Shattered Remains can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.

06051.Title: Lancelot
06051.Text: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
"Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"

06053.Title: BlacKat
06053.Text: 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[credit]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).

Details.flavor: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.

Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for-if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.

06055.Title: Box-E
06055.Text: +2[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.

06056.Title: The Supplier
06056.Text:
[click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.

Details.flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."

06057.Title: Refractor
06057.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.

Details.flavor: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours.  Or years.  It's only when you don't fit in that things start to go wrong." -Exile

06058.Title: Order of Sol
06058.Text: The first time you have no credits in your credit pool each turn, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: There have been several attempts to create a "world church," uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole.  The irony, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.

06059.Title: Hades Shard
06059.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: Access all cards in Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.

06060.Title: Rachel Beckman
06060.Text:
You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>

Details.flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."

06061.Title: Architect
06061.Text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).

Details.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn</champion>

06062.Title: Peak Efficiency
06062.Text: Gain 1[credit] for each rezzed piece of ice.

Details.flavor: "Servers fully-armed and operational."

06063.Title: Labyrinthine Servers
06063.Text: Place 2 power counters on Labyrinthine Servers when you score it. Hosted power counter: Prevent the Runner from jacking out. The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run.

06064.Title: Ashigaru
06064.Text: Ashigaru gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.

Details.flavor: The way past is to go a different way.

06065.Title: Mamba
06065.Text: Hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 power counter on Mamba.

06066.Title: Reversed Accounts
06066.Text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.

Details.flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.

06067.Title: Universal Connectivity Fee
06067.Text: [subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit] unless the Runner is tagged. If the Runner is tagged, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool and the Corp trashes Universal Connectivity Fee.

Details.flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."

06068.Title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future
06068.Text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ and gain credits equal to its rez cost.

Details.flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.

06069.Title: Changeling
06069.Text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [subroutine] End the run.

06070.Title: Reuse
06070.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Trash any number of cards from HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card trashed.

Details.flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.

06071.Title: Hades Fragment
06071.Text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.

06072.Title: Docklands Crackdown
06072.Text:
[click], [click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.

06073.Title: Inject
06073.Text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[credit] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.

Details.flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal

06074.Title: Origami
06074.Text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each copy of Origami installed.

Details.flavor: The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.

06075.Title: Fester
06075.Text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, he or she loses 2[credit], if able.

Details.flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal

06076.Title: Autoscripter
06076.Text:
The first time you install a program from your grip during your turn, gain [click].
Trash Autoscripter if you make an unsuccessful run.

Details.flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.

06077.Title: Switchblade
06077.Text: 1[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[credit]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.

Details.flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.

06078.Title: Trade-In
06078.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

06079.Title: Astrolabe
06079.Text: +1[mu] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan

06080.Title: Angel Arena
06080.Text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.

Details.flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel

06081.Title: Bifrost Array
06081.Text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.

Details.flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas

06082.Title: Sagittarius
06082.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 program. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: Sagittarius promised foresight, but brought only regret.

06083.Title: Hostile Infrastructure
06083.Text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: "If thou only knowest what it is to conquer, and knowest not what it is to be defeated; woe unto thee…" -Tokugawa Ieyasu

06084.Title: Gemini
06084.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: Gemini promised pleasure, but dealt only pain.

06085.Title: License Acquisition
06085.Text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.

Details.flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the licence agreement."

06086.Title: Daily Business Show
06086.Text: The first time you draw a card each turn, draw 1 additional card. Add 1 of the drawn cards to the bottom of R&D.

Details.flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"

06087.Title: Superior Cyberwalls
06087.Text: All barrier ice have +1 strength. When you score Superior Cyberwalls, gain 1[credit] for each rezzed barrier.

Details.flavor: "Our new barriers will be built on the rubble of our enemies".

06088.Title: Executive Boot Camp
06088.Text:
When your turn begins, you may rez a card, lowering the rez cost by 1[credit].
1[credit],[trash]: Search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: "Do it again, but this time I want to see you to enunciate less. Maybe let some spittle fly."

06089.Title: Lycan
06089.Text: Lycan can be advanced. While Lycan has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains code gate and loses sentry. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: "It's weird. I hit the server again and it was like a totally different piece of ice was waiting for me. Lost my root daemon. I shouldn't have nested them seven deep."

06090.Title: Snatch and Grab
06090.Text: Trace 3 If successful, trash 1 connection. The Runner can take 1 tag to prevent this.

Details.flavor: The last thing he saw was the tattoo of a strange beast on his captor's neck. It had a goat's head, the body of a lion, and the tail of a serpent. Then the bag was yanked over his head, and there was only darkness.

06091.Title: Merlin
06091.Text: When the Runner encounters Merlin, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Merlin gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage.

Details.flavor: He who holds the staff of wisdom.

06092.Title: Shell Corporation
06092.Text:
You cannot use Shell Corporation more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] on Shell Corporation.
[click]: Take all credits from Shell Corporation.

06093.Title: Ekomind
06093.Text: Your memory limit is equal to the number of cards in your grip. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "Sometimes you just need a brain in a jar" -g00ru

06094.Title: Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3
06094.Text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: "He only likes to eat live meat." -MaxX

06095.Title: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist
06095.Text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.

Details.flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."

06096.Title: Cerberus "Rex" H2
06096.Text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Rex" H2 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: "Useful for fetching all sorts of things…but you better have a treat ready if he likes it." -Iain Stirling

06097.Title: Zona Sul Shipping
06097.Text:
Place 1[credit] on Zona Sul Shipping when your turn begins.
[click]: Take all credits from Zona Sul Shipping.
Trash Zona Sul Shipping if you are tagged.

Details.flavor: "They'll deliver anything to anywhere. Make sure to request air holes if you're shipping someone important, though."

06098.Title: Cybsoft MacroDrive
06098.Text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to install programs.

Details.flavor: Cybsoft started by designing games. Eventually they just redesigned the same game each year, and to combat piracy created a dedicated machine to play it. Profits grew ten-fold.

06099.Title: Cerberus "Lady" H1
06099.Text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Lady" H1 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: "Its bytes are definitely worse than its bark." -Chaos Theory

06100.Title: Utopia Shard
06100.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, instead of accessing cards, you may install Utopia Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp discards 2 cards from HQ at random.
Limit 1 per deck.

06101.Title: Helium-3 Deposit
06101.Text: When you score Helium-3 Deposit, place up to 2 power counters on a card with at least 1 power counter on it.

Details.flavor: It takes power to create power.

06102.Title: Errand Boy
06102.Text:
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.

Details.flavor: Recycling the energy entering the system via a run is both responsible and economical.

06103.Title: IT Department
06103.Text: [click]: Place 1 power counter on IT Department. Hosted power counter: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice has +1 strength until the end of the turn for each power counter (including the one spent) on IT Department.

06104.Title: Markus 1.0
06104.Text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Markus 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: The forge must never run cold.

06105.Title: Industrial Genomics: Growing Solutions
06105.Text: The trash cost of each card is increased by 1 for each facedown card in Archives.

Details.flavor: Achieve the Impossible.

06106.Title: Turtlebacks
06106.Text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you create a server.

Details.flavor: A masterpiece of cloning and hardware technology, Jinteki created homo vacuo operae, commonly called "turtlebacks", to operate for long periods of time within a vacuum.

06107.Title: Shoot the Moon
06107.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Rez 1 piece of ice for each tag the Runner has, ignoring all costs.

06108.Title: Troll
06108.Text: When the Runner encounters Troll, <trace>trace 2</trace> if successful, the Runner must lose [click] or end the run.

Details.flavor: You gotta pay the troll toll to get in.

06109.Title: Virgo
06109.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: Virgo promised love, but offered only jealousy.

06110.Title: Utopia Fragment
06110.Text:
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[credit] for each advancement token on that agenda.
Limit 1 per deck.

06111.Title: Excalibur
06111.Text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot make another run this turn.

Details.flavor:
There drew he forth the brand Excalibur,
And o'er him, drawing it, the winter moon,
Brightening the skirts of a long cloud, ran forth
And sparkled keen with frost against the hilt:
For all the haft twinkled with diamonds sparks,
Myriads of topaz-lights, and jacinth work
Of subtlest jewellery. -Lord Tennyson

06112.Title: Self-destruct
06112.Text:
Install only in a remote server.
[trash]: Trash all cards installed in or protecting this server and <trace>trace X</trace> if successful, do 3 net damage. X is the number of cards trashed. Use this ability only during a run on this server.

06113.Title: Incubator
06113.Text: When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Incubator. [click], [trash]: Move all virus counters from Incubator to another installed virus program.

Details.flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare

06114.Title: Ixodidae
06114.Text:
Whenever the Corp loses at least 1[credit], gain 1[credit].
Trash Ixodidae if the Corp purges virus counters.

Details.flavor: Digs in deeper than its Alabama counterpart.

06115.Title: Code Siphon
06115.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may search your stack for a program and install it, lowering the install cost by 3 for each piece of ice protecting R&D, and then take 1 tag. Shuffle your stack.

06116.Title: Collective Consciousness
06116.Text: Draw 1 card whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.

Details.flavor: "All programs are connected. The data that runs through one runs through all." -Rielle "Kit" Peddler

06117.Title: Sage
06117.Text: Sage has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break code gate or barrier subroutine.

Details.flavor: δὶς ἐς τὸν αὐτὸν ποταμὸν οὐκ ἂν ἐμβαίης

06118.Title: Bribery
06118.Text: Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez the first unrezzed piece of ice approached.

Details.flavor: "Sometimes it's helpful to remember that you're not the only one who loves money." -Gabriel Santiago

The datastream slipped away, and it felt like being born for a second time, if only you could remember the first. A rush of air fills the lungs to bursting, and you gasp it out, coughing and choking as the dim lights of the room shine with the brilliance of a thousand suns.

06120.Title: Earthrise Hotel
06120.Text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.

07001.Title: Argus Security: Protection Guaranteed
07001.Text: Whenever the Runner steals an agenda, he or she must either take 1 tag or suffer 2 meat damage.

Details.flavor: We Never Sleep.

07002.Title: Gagarin Deep Space: Expanding the Horizon
07002.Text: As an additional cost to access a card in a remote server, the Runner must pay 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Sic Itur Ad Astra.

07003.Title: Titan Transnational: Investing In Your Future
07003.Text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may place 1 agenda counter on it.

Details.flavor: The Way Forward.

07004.Title: Firmware Updates
07004.Text: Place 3 agenda counters on Firmware Updates when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice that can be advanced. Use this ability only once per turn.

07005.Title: Glenn Station
07005.Text:
Glenn Station can host a single card.
[click]: Host a card from HQ facedown on Glenn Station.
[click]: Add a card on Glenn Station to HQ.

07006.Title: Government Takeover
07006.Text:
[click]: Gain 3[credit].
Limit 1 Government Takeover per deck.

Details.flavor: It is essential to liberate a populace from tyranny before that tyranny takes root.

07007.Title: High-Risk Investment
07007.Text: Place 1 agenda counter on High-Risk Investment when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 1[credit] for each credit in the Runner's credit pool.

Details.flavor: "Trust me. I know what I'm doing."

07008.Title: Constellation Protocol
07008.Text: When your turn begins, you may move an advancement token from a piece of ice to an installed piece of ice that can be advanced.

Details.flavor: "With distributed systems, assets can be realigned with no loss of efficiency." -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage

07009.Title: Mark Yale
07009.Text: Whenever you spend an agenda counter, gain 1[credit]. [trash] or any agenda counter: Gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor: "This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity…"

07010.Title: Space Camp
07010.Text:
If Space Camp is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Space Camp, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.

Details.flavor: Future leaders start here.

07011.Title: The Board
07011.Text:
Each agenda in the Runner's score area is worth 1 fewer agenda point.
If The Board is trashed while being accessed, add it to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

Details.flavor: No one on the board knows everyone on it.

07012.Title: Asteroid Belt
07012.Text:
Asteroid Belt can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: His belt of stone did shake and shatter.

07013.Title: Wormhole
07013.Text:
Wormhole can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.

Details.flavor: As through the door of light he came.

07014.Title: Nebula
07014.Text:
Nebula can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: He bent his bow of stellar matter.

07015.Title: Orion
07015.Text:
Orion can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: And seeking prey he then took aim.

07016.Title: Builder
07016.Text:
[click]: Move this piece of ice to the outermost position protecting any server.
[subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.
[subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.

07017.Title: Checkpoint
07017.Text:
When you rez Checkpoint, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do 3 meat damage when this run is successful.

Details.flavor: "I passed right through one once. It didn't seem to do anything at first. It wasn't until I jacked out that I realized they were busting down the door of my apartment." -Valencia Estevez

07018.Title: Fire Wall
07018.Text:
Fire Wall can be advanced and gains +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "Definitely a literalist." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

07019.Title: Searchlight
07019.Text:
Searchlight can be advanced. X is the number of advancement tokens on Searchlight.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

07020.Title: Housekeeping
07020.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner installs a card each turn, he or she must trash 1 card from his or her grip.

07021.Title: Patch
07021.Text: Install Patch on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice has +2 strength."

Details.flavor:
Update 1.1:
-Fixes some stability issues. //maybe

07022.Title: Traffic Accident
07022.Text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
Do 2 meat damage.

Details.flavor: "Traffic was murder."

07023.Title: Satellite Grid
07023.Text: Each piece of ice protecting this server is considered to have 1 additional advancement token on it. Limit 1 region per server.

07024.Title: The Twins
07024.Text: Whenever the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you may reveal and trash another copy of that ice from HQ to force the Runner to encounter the piece of ice just passed again.

Details.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.

07025.Title: Sub Boost
07025.Text: Install Sub Boost on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice gains barrier and '[subroutine] End the run.' after all its other subroutines."

Details.flavor: "It's fun watching them derez after hitting Enigma." -Grace Lamarr, Freelance Security Expert

07026.Title: Dedicated Technician Team
07026.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install ice protecting this server.

07027.Title: Cyberdex Virus Suite
07027.Text:
If Cyberdex Virus Suite is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Cyberdex Virus Suite, you may purge virus counters.
[trash]: Purge virus counters.

07028.Title: Edward Kim: Humanity's Hammer
07028.Text: Trash the first operation you access each turn at no cost.

Details.flavor: "My only regret is that androids cannot feel my hate."

07029.Title: MaxX: Maximum Punk Rock
07029.Text: When your turn begins, trash the top 2 cards of your stack. Draw 1 card.

07030.Title: Valencia Estevez: The Angel of Cayambe
07030.Text: The Corp starts the game with 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "Everyone deserves a chance. Everyone."

07031.Title: Amped Up
07031.Text: Gain [click][click][click] and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented).

Details.flavor: "The human brain only uses like a quarter of its capacity anyway, right?" -MaxX

07032.Title: I've Had Worse
07032.Text:
Draw 3 cards.
Whenever I've Had Worse is trashed by taking net or meat damage, draw 3 cards.

07033.Title: Itinerant Protesters
07033.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1 for each bad publicity he or she has.

Details.flavor: No one knows what they want-least of all them.

07034.Title: Showing Off
07034.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards from the top of R&D, access cards from the bottom of R&D (starting with the bottom card and working your way up).

07035.Title: Wanton Destruction
07035.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may spend any number of [click] to force the Corp to trash an equal number of cards from HQ at random.

07036.Title: Day Job
07036.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click][click][click].
Gain 10[credit].

Details.flavor: "Hello thank you for vidding MegaBuy I'm Carol how can I help you."

07037.Title: Forked
07037.Text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a sentry during this run, trash that sentry.

07038.Title: Knifed
07038.Text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a barrier during this run, trash that barrier.

07039.Title: Spooned
07039.Text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a code gate during this run, trash that code gate.

07040.Title: Eater
07040.Text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine. You cannot access more than 0 cards for the remainder of this run.
1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: Nom nom nom.

07041.Title: Gravedigger
07041.Text: Whenever an installed Corp card is trashed, place 1 virus counter on Gravedigger. [click], hosted virus counter: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D.

Details.flavor: "Once your sniffer finds the protocols the server uses to trash its own data, you can spoof those same protocols. It's quite the show." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

07042.Title: Hivemind
07042.Text: Place 1 virus counter on Hivemind when it is installed. Virus counters on Hivemind are considered to be hosted on all other virus programs for the purposes of card effects (and can be spent as if on them).

Details.flavor: "We built the network. But then the network evolved. Can we be sure that it is not alive?" -g00ru

07043.Title: Progenitor
07043.Text: You may host a single virus program on Progenitor. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. Whenever virus counters are purged, instead of removing all virus counters from the hosted card, remove all but 1 virus counter from the hosted card. Errata from FAQ 4.0

07044.Title: Archives Interface
07044.Text: Whenever you access cards in Archives, you may remove 1 card in Archives from the game, instead of accessing it.

Details.flavor: A black box that makes data disappear forever.

07045.Title: Chop Bot 3000
07045.Text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards. If you do, draw 1 card or remove 1 tag.

Details.flavor: There was a sickly smell coming from his closet. He hoped it was only a mouse this time.

07046.Title: MemStrips
07046.Text: +3[mu] Use the MU on MemStrips only for virus programs.

Details.flavor: "The trick is remembering which virus you loaded onto which strip. That's why I draw emoji on 'em. Then I just have to remember which emoji stands for which virus." -Princess Space Kitten

07047.Title: Vigil
07047.Text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card if the Corp has cards in HQ equal to his or her maximum hand size. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "Show me your faith without deeds, if you can."

07048.Title: Human First
07048.Text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain credits equal to the agenda points on that agenda.

Details.flavor: "They showed me that I wasn't broken. I am still a whole human, no matter how many limbs I lose. The golems are our enemy, as well as anyone who values efficiency and profit more than a human life." -Edward Kim

07049.Title: Investigative Journalism
07049.Text:
Install only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
[click],[click],[click],[click],[trash]: Give the Corp 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: Her heart beat faster as her reader illuminated the records. It was all there. The pod had not been reprogrammed since the 14th, which meant that this was a case of gross negligence.

07050.Title: Sacrificial Clone
07050.Text: [trash]: Prevent all damage. Trash all installed hardware, all installed non-virtual resources, and all cards in your grip. Lose all credits in your credit pool. Remove all tags.

Details.flavor: "Don't worry, me. You won't have to vertical park." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

07051.Title: Stim Dealer
07051.Text: When your turn begins, if there are 2 or more power counters on Stim Dealer, remove all power counters from it and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented); otherwise, place 1 power counter on Stim Dealer and gain [click].

Details.flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.

07052.Title: Virus Breeding Ground
07052.Text:
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground.
[click]: Move 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground to another card with at least 1 virus counter on it.

Details.flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assemble, mutates. Evolves.

07053.Title: Uninstall
07053.Text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip.

Details.flavor: Runner software is notoriously scratch-built and under-tested, and the shadow net has no tech support. It works, mostly, but sometimes a fresh install is just the ticket.

07054.Title: Qianju PT
07054.Text: When your turn begins, you may lose [click]. If you do, avoid the first tag you take until the beginning of your next turn.

07055.Title: Data Folding
07055.Text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have 2 or more unused MU.
