Details.flavor: "Sometimes I like to make origami cranes out of old newsrag. It helps me think, putting it back on the subconscious. I figure it's the same principle for my rig - keep it busy and it makes me a few creds for my trouble." -Quetzal

08001.Title: Clot
08001.Text:
The Corp cannot score an agenda on the same turn he or she installed it.
Trash Clot if the Corp purges virus counters.

08002.Title: Paige Piper
08002.Text: The first time you install a card each turn (including Paige Piper), you may search your stack for any number of copies of that card and add them to your heap. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: "The Valley is littered with good ideas. You need the discipline to execute if you want to stay in my incubator."

08003.Title: Adjusted Chronotype
08003.Text: The first time you lose [click] each turn, gain [click].

Details.flavor: Turns a night owl into an early bird!

08004.Title: Spike
08004.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Spike is 0, even if it is not installed. Spike has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines.

08005.Title: Enhanced Vision
08005.Text: The first time you make a successful run each turn, the Corp reveals 1 card at random from HQ.

08006.Title: Gene Conditioning Shoppe
08006.Text: Genetics also trigger the second time each turn their trigger condition is met.

08007.Title: Synthetic Blood
08007.Text: The first time you take damage each turn, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: Your heart deserves the best.

08008.Title: Traffic Jam
08008.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The advancement requirement of each agenda is increased by 1 for each copy of that agenda in the Corp's score area.

08009.Title: Symmetrical Visage
08009.Text: The first time you spend [click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability) each turn, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Born for success!

08010.Title: Brain-Taping Warehouse
08010.Text: The rez cost of bioroid ice is lowered by 1 for each unspent click the Runner has.

Details.flavor: In the vast universe of memories, consciousness slumbers...

08011.Title: NEXT Gold
08011.Text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [subroutine] Do X net damage. [subroutine] Trash X programs.

Details.flavor: "God in Heinlein. What's next, NEXT Platinum?" -John Masanori

08012.Title: Jinteki Biotech: Life Imagined
08012.Text:
Before taking your first turn, you may swap this card with any copy of Jinteki Biotech.
[click],[click],[click]: Flip this identity.
The Brewery: When you flip this identity, do 2 net damage.
The Tank: When you flip this identity, shuffle Archives into R&D.
The Greenhouse: When you flip this identity, place 4 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

08013.Title: Genetic Resequencing
08013.Text: When you score Genetic Resequencing, you may place 1 agenda counter on an agenda in your score area.

08014.Title: Cortex Lock
08014.Text: [subroutine] Do 1 net damage for each unused MU the Runner has.

Details.flavor: The more power a spike process can use, the harder it can hit. The really clever ones borrow the runner's own memory to iterate locally.

08015.Title: Valley Grid
08015.Text: Whenever the Runner breaks all subroutines on a piece of ice protecting this server, his or her maximum hand size is reduced by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. Limit 1 region per server.

08016.Title: Bandwidth
08016.Text: [subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. If this run is successful, the Runner removes 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "It tracks you and logs you. If you get in you can just delete the log. But first you have to get in." -Gabriel Santiago

08017.Title: Predictive Algorithm
08017.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[credit].

Details.flavor: Give a man money, and he is rich for a day. Teach a man how to invest, and he is rich for life.

08019.Title: Negotiator
08019.Text:
The Runner can pay 2[credit] to break any subroutine on Negotiator.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: "Negotiation is an art, so never negotiate when you can intimidate instead." -Thiago Reyes, VP Strategic Operations

08020.Title: Tech Startup
08020.Text: When your turn begins, you may trash Tech Startup. If you do, search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and install it. Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: "Don't worry. If this one fails, we can start a new one tomorrow."

08021.Title: Hacktivist Meeting
08021.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. As an additional cost to rez non-ice cards, the Corp must randomly trash a card from HQ.

08022.Title: Off-Campus Apartment
08022.Text: Off-Campus Apartment can host any number of connections. Whenever you install a connection on Off-Campus Apartment, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: Usually crashing with friends means sleeping on the couch. This time, it meant sleeping on a server farm.

08023.Title: Career Fair
08023.Text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.

Details.flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."

08024.Title: Dorm Computer
08024.Text: Place 4 power counters on Dorm Computer when you install it. [click], hosted power counter: Make a run. Avoid all tags for the remainder of the run.

08025.Title: Hayley Kaplan: Universal Scholar
08025.Text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install another card of the same type from your grip (paying its install cost).

08026.Title: Game Day
08026.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
If you have fewer cards in your grip than your maximum hand size, draw cards until you have cards in your grip equal to your maximum hand size.

08027.Title: Comet
08027.Text: +1[mu] The first time you play an event each turn, you may play another event (without spending a click) after the first one resolves. Limit 1 console per player.

08028.Title: Study Guide
08028.Text: Study Guide has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: Place 1 power counter on Study Guide.

Details.flavor: "Once you download the lecture source files, this program does a statistical analysis and distills the most important concepts." -Hayley Kaplan

08029.Title: London Library
08029.Text: Trash all programs hosted on London Library when your turn ends. [click]: Install a non-virus program from your grip on London Library, ignoring the install cost. [click]: Add a program on London Library to your grip.

08030.Title: Tyson Observatory
08030.Text: [click], [click]: Search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: "There are whole generations of people who never move out of a megalopolis center. You should see the look on their face the first time they see the stars." -Professor Darren Fin, Astronomy

08031.Title: Beach Party
08031.Text:
When your turn begins, lose [click].
Your maximum hand size is increased by 5.

Details.flavor: "So much to do. So little time."

08032.Title: Research Grant
08032.Text: When you score Research Grant, you may score another copy of Research Grant that is installed.

Details.flavor: "My research could make your corporation billions. And save lives, of course."

08033.Title: Turing
08033.Text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. [subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click][click].

Details.flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.

08034.Title: Crick
08034.Text:
Crick has +3 strength while protecting Archives.
[subroutine] Install a card from Archives (paying its install cost).

Details.flavor: Crick and his colleagues ushered in modern genetics by mapping the structure of DNA.

08035.Title: Recruiting Trip
08035.Text: Search R&D for up to X different sysops (by title), reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: "My script can perform the Kobayashi algorithm in .12 seconds."

08036.Title: Blacklist
08036.Text: Cards cannot leave the Runner's heap for any reason.

Details.flavor: Officially, there is no blacklist. That would be illegal. Unofficially, there is a list, and being on it can ruin a career.

08037.Title: Gutenberg
08037.Text:
Gutenberg has +3 strength while protecting R&D.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 7</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: Johannes Gutenberg ignited the first Information Revolution by inventing the movable-type printing press.

08038.Title: Student Loans
08038.Text: As an additional cost to play an event that there is a copy of in his or her heap, the Runner must pay 2[credit].

Details.flavor: The cost of an education is sometimes felt sharpest in the stomach.

08039.Title: Meru Mati
08039.Text:
Meru Mati has +3 strength while protecting HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Meru Mati pushed the limits of physics by engineering the first buckyweave structure, a thousand-foot long wall.

08040.Title: Breaker Bay Grid
08040.Text: The rez cost of cards in this server is lowered by 5. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: After the Big One, real estate value changed sharply. Some found that they had become owners of beachfront property. Others were underwater.

08041.Title: Immolation Script
08041.Text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing a piece of ice in Archives, trash a rezzed copy of that ice.

Details.flavor: The most potent scripts are indistinguishable from magic to the sysop on the other side.

08042.Title: Skulljack
08042.Text:
When you install Skulljack, suffer 1 brain damage.
The trash cost of all cards is lowered by 1.

Details.flavor: The implanted brain-machine interface, or "skulljack," is the single most common cybernetic enhancement that isn't a medical necessity.

08043.Title: Turntable
08043.Text: +1[mu] Whenever you steal an agenda, you may swap that agenda with an agenda in the Corp's score area. Limit 1 console per player.

08044.Title: Chrome Parlor
08044.Text: Prevent all meat damage and brain damage from installing cybernetics.

Details.flavor: Picking a chopper might be the last decision you make. If you find a good one, stick with her for life.

08045.Title: Titanium Ribs
08045.Text:
When you install Titanium Ribs, suffer 2 meat damage.
You choose the card(s) from your grip to trash whenever you take damage (including the damage taken by installing Titanium Ribs).

08046.Title: Crowbar
08046.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Crowbar is 0, even if it is not installed. Crowbar has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines.

08047.Title: Net-Ready Eyes
08047.Text: When you install Net-Ready Eyes, suffer 2 meat damage. Whenever you initiate a run, choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.

08048.Title: Analog Dreamers
08048.Text: [click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may choose an unrezzed non-ice card with no advancement tokens on it. The Corp shuffles that card into R&D.

Details.flavor: Sometimes progress means returning to the past.

08049.Title: Brain Cage
08049.Text:
When you install Brain Cage, suffer 1 brain damage.
Your maximum hand size is increased by 3.

Details.flavor: The skull is not one bone, but 22. The surgery is even more complex than it sounds.

08050.Title: Cybernetics Division: Humanity Upgraded
08050.Text: Each player's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.

Details.flavor: Define Yourself.

08051.Title: Self-Destruct Chips
08051.Text: The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.

Details.flavor: Cyber enhancements can be dangerous in the wrong hands.

08052.Title: Lab Dog
08052.Text: [subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed piece of hardware. Trash Lab Dog.

Details.flavor: "Remember those FCC regulations about not creating harmful interference? No? Ah, before your time, I guess." -Cailan Heinrich, Senior Programmer

08053.Title: Oaktown Grid
08053.Text: The trash cost of cards installed in this server is increased by 3. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: Built Oaktown tough.

08054.Title: Ryon Knight
08054.Text: [trash]: Do 1 brain damage. Use this ability only during a run on this server and only if the Runner has no unspent clicks.

Details.flavor: "Bioroids recognize consciousness in others, but not in themselves."

08055.Title: Clairvoyant Monitor
08055.Text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 advancement token on an installed card and end the run.

08056.Title: Lockdown
08056.Text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot draw cards for the remainder of this turn.

Details.flavor: "When your communications are disrupted, you are isolated from your resources. An attack will surely follow." -The Playbook

08057.Title: Little Engine
08057.Text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] The Runner gains 5[credit].

Details.flavor: "A sysop is not just a cog in the corporate machine. They have dreams-and nightmares-just like the rest of us." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

08058.Title: Oaktown Renovation
08058.Text:
Install Oaktown Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Oaktown Renovation, gain 2[credit] (or 3[credit] if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on Oaktown Renovation).

08059.Title: Corporate Town
08059.Text:
As an additional cost to rez Corporate Town, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
When your turn begins, you may trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).

Details.flavor: If you can't buy the city council, create a new city.

08060.Title: Quicksand
08060.Text:
When the Runner encounters Quicksand, place 1 power counter on Quicksand.
Quicksand has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[subroutine] End the run.

08061.Title: Faust
08061.Text: Trash a card from your grip: Break ice subroutine. Trash a card from your grip: +2 strength.

Details.flavor: The server was quiet that night. I closed my eyes, the low-hum of the datastream lulling me into a trance. When I opened them, the construct stood before me in the shape of a man, clad in light of many colors. His stature was impressive, and his saccharine voice wormed its way into my very soul.

08062.Title: Street Peddler
08062.Text:
When you install Street Peddler, host the top 3 cards of your stack facedown on Street Peddler (you may look at these cards at any time).
[trash]: Install 1 card hosted on Street Peddler, lowering its install cost by 1.

Details.flavor: "Whaddya buyin'?"

08063.Title: Armand "Geist" Walker: Tech Lord
08063.Text: Whenever you use a [trash] ability, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: "Everything has a price."

08064.Title: Drive By
08064.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Expose 1 card installed in a remote server. Trash that card at no cost if it is an asset or upgrade.

08065.Title: Forger
08065.Text: +1[link] [trash]: Avoid or remove 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: Using the exact same rig as a million other people is just another form of security through anonymity.

08066.Title: Shiv
08066.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Shiv is 0, even if it is not installed. Shiv has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 sentry subroutines.

08067.Title: Gang Sign
08067.Text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, access 1 card from HQ.

Details.flavor: Muertos has no fear of the law. Muertos is the law.

08068.Title: Muertos Gang Member
08068.Text:
When you install Muertos Gang Member, the Corp must derez a card.
When Muertos Gang Member is uninstalled, the Corp may rez a card, ignoring the rez cost.
[trash]: Draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: La Señora de las Sombras giveth and taketh away.

08069.Title: Chameleon
08069.Text: When you install Chameleon, name sentry, code gate or barrier. Add Chameleon to your grip when your turn ends. 1[credit]: Break a subroutine of the named subtype.

08070.Title: Hyperdriver
08070.Text: When your turn begins, you may remove Hyperdriver from the game and gain [click][click][click].

Details.flavor: "It doesn't actually bend time. It just feels like it. That's relativity." -Hayley Kaplan

08071.Title: Test Ground
08071.Text:
Test Ground can be advanced.
[trash]: Derez 1 card for each advancement token on Test Ground.

Details.flavor:
"Isn't this wrong?"
"Not legally. They didn't read the fine print."

08072.Title: Defective Brainchips
08072.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner takes brain damage each turn, he or she takes 1 additional brain damage.

08073.Title: Allele Repression
08073.Text:
Allele Repression can be advanced.
[trash]: Swap 1 card in HQ with 1 card in Archives for each advancement token on Allele Repression.

08074.Title: Marcus Batty
08074.Text: [trash]: You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, resolve 1 subroutine on a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server. Use this ability only during a run on this server.

08075.Title: Exposé
08075.Text:
Exposé can be advanced.
[trash]: Remove 1 bad publicity for each advancement token on Exposé.

Details.flavor: "Is your neighbor secretly a violent criminal? The answer to this chilling question and more, right after the break." -Shannon Claire, SSN 5

08076.Title: Pachinko
08076.Text:
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.

Details.flavor: Pa-pa-pa-chinko!

08077.Title: Underway Renovation
08077.Text:
Install Underway Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Underway Renovation, trash the top card of the Runner's stack (or top 2 cards instead if there are 4 or more advancement tokens on Underway Renovation).

08078.Title: Contract Killer
08078.Text: Contract Killer can be advanced. If there are at least 2 advancement tokens on Contract Killer, it gains: "[click], [trash]: Trash a connection or do 2 meat damage."

Details.flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"

08079.Title: Spiderweb
08079.Text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." -g00ru

08080.Title: Underway Grid
08080.Text: Ice protecting this server cannot be bypassed. Cards in and protecting this server cannot be exposed. Limit 1 region per server.

08081.Title: Trope
08081.Text: When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on Trope. [click], remove Trope from the game: Shuffle 1 card from your heap into your stack for each power counter on Trope.

Details.flavor: "Did you ever notice how everything goes in cycles? The stuff that's cool now was cool before. That's why I keep copy of everything!" -Princess Space Kitten

08082.Title: Spoilers
08082.Text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, he or she trashes the top card of R&D.

Details.flavor: Don't you hate it when you know everything before it's even out?

08083.Title: Drug Dealer
08083.Text:
When your turn begins, lose 1[credit].
When the Corp's turn begins, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: "Just a bunch of knockoffs for the touristos. The real designer stuff isn't sold on the street."

08084.Title: Rolodex
08084.Text:
When you install Rolodex, look at the top 5 cards of your stack and arrange them in any order.
When Rolodex is trashed, trash the top 3 cards of your stack.

Details.flavor: "I told you to lose my number!"

08085.Title: Fan Site
08085.Text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, add Fan Site to your score area as an agenda worth 0 agenda points.

Details.flavor: Your life is not your own, once you become famous on the Net.

08086.Title: Film Critic
08086.Text:
Film Critic can host a single agenda.
Whenever you access an agenda, you may host that agenda on Film Critic (the agenda is no longer being accessed and is uninstalled).
[click],[click]: Add an agenda hosted on Film Critic to your score area.

Details.flavor: "My gerbil could write a better screenplay."

08087.Title: Paparazzi
08087.Text:
You are tagged.
Prevent all meat damage.

Details.flavor: "Yeah, we know right where she is. Just pull up Sizzler!"

08088.Title: Ronald Five
08088.Text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Ronald Five), he or she loses [click].

Details.flavor: "It's our most pirated property ever. Great work, everyone."

08089.Title: Enforcer 1.0
08089.Text: As an additional cost to rez Enforcer 1.0, the Corp must forfeit an agenda. The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Enforcer 1.0. [subroutine] Trash 1 program. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trash 1 console. [subroutine] Trash all virtual resources.

08090.Title: It's a Trap!
08090.Text:
Whenever It's a Trap! is exposed, do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards. Trash It's a Trap!.

Details.flavor: I warned you.

08091.Title: An Offer You Can't Refuse
08091.Text: Choose a central server. The runner may initiate a run on that server during which he or she cannot jack out. Otherwise, add An Offer You Can't Refuse to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

08092.Title: Haarpsichord Studios: Entertainment Unleashed
08092.Text: The Runner cannot steal more than one agenda each turn.

Details.flavor: Home of Your Imagination.

08093.Title: Award Bait
08093.Text:
If Award Bait is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Award Bait, you may place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

08094.Title: Explode-a-palooza
08094.Text:
If Explode-a-palooza is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Explode-a-palooza, you may gain 5[credit].

Details.flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.

08095.Title: Early Premiere
08095.Text: When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit]. If you do, place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced in a server.

08096.Title: Casting Call
08096.Text: Install an agenda from HQ faceup and install Casting Call on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with text "Whenever the Runner accesses this agenda, he or she takes 2 tags."

08097.Title: Old Hollywood Grid
08097.Text: Agendas accessed from this server cannot be stolen unless the Runner already has a copy of that agenda in his or her score area. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Old Hollywood Grid. Limit 1 region per server.

08098.Title: Hollywood Renovation
08098.Text:
Install Hollywood Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Hollywood Renovation, you may place 1 advancement token on another card that can be advanced (or 2 advancement tokens instead if there are 6 or more advancement tokens on Hollywood Renovation).

08099.Title: Back Channels
08099.Text: Trash a card installed in a server and gain 3[credit] for each advancement token on that card.

Details.flavor: Sometimes corps have to bury projects, but that doesn't mean they can't make a profit on them.

EXT. KANSAS - DAY
DOROTHY (Miranda) gazes out at the horizon. A sudden gust of wind catches her hair. Above the windblasted prairie loom ominous STORM CLOUDS.
DOROTHY: If only I wasn't in Kansas anymore.
She begins to hum a haunting melody.

08101.Title: Power to the People
08101.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
The first time you access an agenda this turn, gain 7[credit].

Details.flavor: As the sun sank towards the horizon, the glittering lights of the expo remained dark. But the shanty city bloomed to life.

08102.Title: Surfer
08102.Text: 2[credit]: Swap a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered with a piece of ice directly before or after it. The run continues from this new position. You are still encountering that ice.

Details.flavor: Cowabunga, dude!

08103.Title: DDoS
08103.Text: [trash]: The Corp cannot rez the outermost piece of ice during a run on any server this turn.

Details.flavor: "First, you get a horde of zombies. Then you do whatever you want, 'cuz you have a horde of zombies." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

08104.Title: Laramy Fisk: Savvy Investor
08104.Text: The first time you make a successful run on a central server each turn, you may force the Corp to draw 1 card.

08105.Title: Fisk Investment Seminar
08105.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
Each player draws 3 cards.

Details.flavor: "The secret to investing is networking." -Laramy Fisk

08106.Title: Bookmark
08106.Text:
[click]: Host up to 3 cards from your grip facedown on Bookmark (you may look at these cards at any time).
[click] or [trash]: Add all cards on Bookmark to your grip.

08107.Title: DaVinci
08107.Text:
Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 power counter on DaVinci.
[trash]: Install a card from your grip with an install cost equal to or less than the number of power counters on DaVinci, ignoring the install cost.

Details.flavor: "Our life is made by the death of others." -Leonardo Da Vinci

08108.Title: Wireless Net Pavilion
08108.Text:
As an additional cost to spend [click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability), the Corp must pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>

Details.flavor: Almost a zettabyte of data flows each minute through one of the many net pavilions scattered around the expo.

08109.Title: Cybernetics Court
08109.Text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 4.

Details.flavor: The Cybernetics Court has seven floors of attractions. The plasteel used to construct it was even more expensive than the thousands of cybernetic implants displayed inside.

08110.Title: Team Sponsorship
08110.Text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.

Details.flavor: The SanSan Outlaws have a close relationship with Haas-Bioroid's sports engineering division, SHIFT.

08111.Title: Chronos Protocol: Selective Mind-mapping
08111.Text: For the first net damage the Runner suffers each turn, you may look at the Runner's grip and select the card that is trashed.

08112.Title: Ancestral Imager
08112.Text: Whenever the Runner jacks out, do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: The more people submit their DNA and family history to the program, the more accurate it becomes.

08113.Title: Genetics Pavilion
08113.Text: The Runner cannot draw more than 2 cards during his or her turn.

Details.flavor: The Genetics Pavilion was designed by renowned architect Meru Mati II. It was built without the aid of bioroids, instead relying on human and clone labor.

08114.Title: Franchise City
08114.Text: When the Runner accesses an agenda, add Franchise City to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

Details.flavor: There are over 20,000 brands represented in Franchise City, all of them owned by fewer than 100 corps.

08115.Title: Product Placement
08115.Text:
If the Runner accesses Product Placement from R&D, he or she must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Product Placement, the Corp gains 2[credit]. Ignore this effect if Product Placement is accessed from Archives.

08116.Title: Worlds Plaza
08116.Text:
Worlds Plaza can host up to 3 assets.
[click]: Install an asset from HQ on Worlds Plaza and rez it, lowering its rez cost by 2, if able.

Details.flavor: The holosculpture depicts the three inhabited worlds. The square can hold almost 1% of their total population.

08117.Title: Public Support
08117.Text:
Place 3 power counters on Public Support when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Public Support, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Public Support.

08118.Title: Tour Guide
08118.Text: Tour Guide gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed asset you have.

Details.flavor: "Hello, and welcome to the Universe of Tomorrow! You could live for five-hundred years and not see all of the attractions I can tell you about."

08119.Title: Expo Grid
08119.Text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if there is a rezzed asset installed in this server. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: The expo was built in the East California desert: a temporary city constructed for the advancement of humanity.

08120.Title: The Future is Now
08120.Text: When you score The Future is Now, search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

09001.Title: SYNC: Everything, Everywhere
09001.Text:
[click]: Flip this identity.
The Runner pays 1[credit] more when spending a [click] to remove a tag (not through a card ability).
Flip side:
[click]: Flip this identity.
You may pay 2[credit] fewer when spending a [click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability).

09002.Title: New Angeles Sol: Your News
09002.Text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may play 1 current from HQ or Archives (paying its play cost).

Details.flavor: Nothing but the Truth.

09003.Title: Spark Agency: Worldswide Reach
09003.Text: The first time each turn you rez an advertisement, the Runner loses 1[credit].

Details.flavor: We're ready to start the fire.

09004.Title: 15 Minutes
09004.Text:
[click]: Shuffle 15 Minutes into R&D. The Corp can trigger this ability while 15 Minutes is in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 per deck.

Details.flavor: You had your shot, and you blew it.

09005.Title: Improved Tracers
09005.Text: All tracer ice have +1 strength. The base trace strength of each subroutine is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: "The trick isn't software, it's hardware. Cyberspace is a collection of physical machines. If we control the machines, we control it all." -KR Kane, "Our Future"
"Nobody ever lost a dollar by underestimating the taste of the public." -Phineas Taylor Barnum

09007.Title: Quantum Predictive Model
09007.Text:
If Quantum Predictive Model is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If the Runner is tagged when Quantum Predictive Model is accessed, add it to your score area.

Details.flavor: "Yes and No."

09008.Title: Lily Lockwell
09008.Text: When you rez Lily Lockwell, draw 3 cards. [click], remove 1 tag: Search R&D for an operation, reveal it, and shuffle the rest of R&D. Add the operation to the top of R&D.

Details.flavor: "Live from New Angeles, this is Lily Lockwell."

09009.Title: News Team
09009.Text:
If News Team is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses News Team, he or she must either take 2 tags or add News Team to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point.

09010.Title: Shannon Claire
09010.Text:
[click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of R&D.
[trash]: Search R&D or Archives for an agenda and reveal it. Shuffle the rest of R&D if you searched it. Add the agenda to the bottom of R&D.

Details.flavor: No one can bury a story better.

09011.Title: Victoria Jenkins
09011.Text:
The Runner has 1 fewer [click] to spend during his or her turn.
If Victoria Jenkins is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

09012.Title: Reality Threedee
09012.Text:
When you rez Reality Threedee, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] (or 2[credit] if the Runner is tagged).

Details.flavor: "They're gonna try and make you a star. Whether you want it or not." -MaxX

09013.Title: Archangel
09013.Text:
If Archangel is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Archangel, he or she immediately encounters it. Ignore this ability if Archangel is accessed from Archives.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, add 1 installed Runner card to his or her grip.

09014.Title: News Hound
09014.Text: If a current is active, News Hound gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "Most reporting these days can be done by AI. We just need the talent for the name recognition."

09015.Title: Resistor
09015.Text:
Resistor has +1 strength for each tag the Runner has.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, end the run.

Details.flavor: "In the Olden Times, a 'resistor" was a vital component of practically all electronic equipment. You know, back when dinosaurs roamed the Earth." -Chaos Theory

09016.Title: Special Offer
09016.Text: [subroutine] The Corp gains 5[credit]. Trash Special Offer.

Details.flavor: "If I didn't know better, I'd say they got the better end of that deal." -John Masanori

09017.Title: TL;DR
09017.Text: [subroutine] When the Runner encounters the next piece of ice during this run, that ice gains a second copy of each subroutine on it (after the original subroutine) for the remainder of the encounter.

Details.flavor: //tl;dr duplicate the subs on the next piece of ice

09018.Title: Turnpike
09018.Text:
When the Runner encounters Turnpike, he or she loses 1[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "Stay out of the fast lanes! If speed's your only concern, you're already tagged and halfway to fragged." -g00ru

09019.Title: 24/7 News Cycle
09019.Text:
As an additional cost to play 24/7 News Cycle, forfeit an agenda.
Resolve the "when scored" ability on an agenda in your score area.

Details.flavor: The only thing worse than bad news...

09020.Title: Ad Blitz
09020.Text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Install and rez (paying all costs) X advertisements from Archives and/or HQ, if able.

09021.Title: Media Blitz
09021.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Choose an agenda in the Runner's score area. Media Blitz gains the text of that agenda.

09022.Title: The All-Seeing I
09022.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash all resources. The Runner can remove 1 bad publicity to prevent this.

Details.flavor: "Only with perfect information can we develop the perfect strategy." -The Playbook

09023.Title: Surveillance Sweep
09023.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner must spend credits first for each trace attempt during a run.

09024.Title: Keegan Lane
09024.Text: [trash], remove 1 tag: Trash 1 program. Use this ability only during a run on this server.

Details.flavor: "We use ice on our servers. More runners should ice their own rigs."

09025.Title: Rutherford Grid
09025.Text: The base trace strength of each trace during a run on this server is increased by 2. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: To the worlds sitting on the couch and watching threedee, Rutherford District might as well be all of New Angeles.

09026.Title: Global Food Initiative
09026.Text: Global Food Initiative is worth 1 fewer agenda point while in the Runner's score area.

Details.flavor: "Corporations are made up of people. It's ridiculous to think they'd be either all good or all bad." -Sunny Lebeau

09027.Title: Launch Campaign
09027.Text:
Place 6[credit] from the bank on Launch Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Launch Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from Launch Campaign.

09028.Title: Assassin
09028.Text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do 3 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: Bounce rate is a well-understood measure of ice strength. But it is not the only measure.

09029.Title: Apex: Invasive Predator
09029.Text: You cannot install non-virtual resources. When your turn begins, you may install 1 card from your grip facedown.

09030.Title: Apocalypse
09030.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ, R&D and Archives this turn.
Trash all installed Corp cards. Turn all installed Runner cards facedown.

09031.Title: Prey
09031.Text: Make a run. Once during this run, when you pass a piece of ice, you may trash a number of your installed cards equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, trash that ice.

09032.Title: Heartbeat
09032.Text: +1[mu] Trash an installed card: Prevent 1 damage. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant." -Edgar Allan Poe

09033.Title: Endless Hunger
09033.Text: Trash an installed card: Break "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine.

Details.flavor: "I've been monitoring the anomaly's activity across the New Angeles Pacifica and Andea trunk lines and associated nodes. I have yet to detect a predictable pattern or even to formulate a theory as to the anomaly's nature." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst

09034.Title: Harbinger
09034.Text: When Harbinger is trashed, install it facedown instead of adding it to your heap.

09035.Title: Hunting Grounds
09035.Text:
Once per turn, prevent a "when encountered" ability on a piece of ice.
[trash]: Install the top 3 cards of your stack facedown.

Details.flavor: "There's parts of the Network now that are different from how they used to be. I can't put my finger on it; just something twitching at my ganglion through my BMI." -Reeve

09036.Title: Wasteland
09036.Text: The first time each turn you trash 1 of your installed cards, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Data goes in. Nothing comes out.

09037.Title: Adam: Compulsive Hacker
09037.Text: You start the game with 3 different directive cards installed (these cards are not considered part of your deck).

09038.Title: Independent Thinking
09038.Text: Trash up to 5 of your installed cards. Draw 1 card for each card trashed (or 2 cards for each card trashed if you trashed at least 1 directive).

Details.flavor: Adam raised the hammer. He was free.

09039.Title: Brain Chip
09039.Text: +X[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by X. X is equal to the number of agenda points you have. Limit 1 console per player.

09040.Title: Multithreader
09040.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for using programs.

Details.flavor: Bioroids have two brains running in parallel, each capable of running sophisticated programming. There are certain advantages to the setup.

09041.Title: Always Be Running
09041.Text: Your first [click] each turn must be spent to make a run or a play a run event. Once per turn, you can spend [click][click] to break a subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered.

Details.flavor: The Second Directive requires a bioroid to complete its primary function above all other considerations, save the First Directive.

09042.Title: Dr. Lovegood
09042.Text: When your turn begins, choose one of your installed cards. The text box of that card is blank for the remainder of the turn.

Details.flavor: "You look tore up, kid. Have a seat, I'll fire up the arc welder."

09043.Title: Neutralize All Threats
09043.Text:
The first time each turn you access a card with a trash cost, you must trash it by paying its trash cost, if able.
Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card.

Details.flavor: The Third Directive requires a bioroid to preserve its ability to function and report frequently to Haas-Bioroid for repairs and updates.

09044.Title: Safety First
09044.Text:
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
When your turn ends, draw 1 card if you do not have cards in your grip equal to or greater than your maximum hand size.

Details.flavor: The First Directive forbids a bioroid from harming, or through inaction allowing harm to befall, a human being.
"Mommy will be home soon, sweetie. She has to kick some ass first."

09046.Title: Security Chip
09046.Text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker (or any number of cloud icebreakers). Each chosen icebreaker has +1 strength for each [link] you have for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.

Details.flavor: Fortunately, Globalsec buys them by the case.

09047.Title: Security Nexus
09047.Text: +1[mu] +1[link] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may force the Corp to "trace 5 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run. If unsuccessful, the Runner bypasses the currently encountered ice." Limit 1 console per player.

09048.Title: GS Striker M1
09048.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Striker M1 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of code gate subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.

Details.flavor: Bigger.

09049.Title: GS Shrike M2
09049.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Shrike M2 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.

Details.flavor: Badder.

09050.Title: GS Sherman M3
09050.Text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Sherman M3 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.

Details.flavor: Boom.

09051.Title: Globalsec Security Clearance
09051.Text:
Install only if you have at least 2[link].
When your turn begins, you may lose [click]. If you do, look at the top card of R&D.

Details.flavor: She approached the server, flashed her credentials, and passed straight through. She wondered what it said about her that doing things the legal way felt like cheating.

09052.Title: Jak Sinclair
09052.Text:
Reduce the cost to install Jak Sinclair by 1 for each [link] you have.
When your turn begins, you may make a run. You cannot use programs during this run.

Details.flavor: "I got an early start today...or maybe I forgot to go home last night."

09053.Title: Employee Strike
09053.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's identity text box is blank.

Details.flavor: "Are you crazy? We can't send in prisec until the media gets bored and goes home."

09054.Title: Windfall
09054.Text: Shuffle your stack. Trash the top card of your stack. Gain X[credit] where X is equal to the install cost of that card.

Details.flavor: She tried to remember who he was. Not that it mattered anymore.

09055.Title: Technical Writer
09055.Text:
Whenever you install a piece of hardware or a program, place 1[credit] from the bank on Technical Writer.
[click],[trash]: Take all credits from Technical Writer.

Details.flavor: Technically correct: the best kind of correct.

10001.Title: Run Amok
10001.Text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.

Details.flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy

10002.Title: Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI
10002.Text:
[trash]: Prevent up to X net or brain damage. Trash cards from the top of your stack equal to the amount of damage prevented. X is the number of copies of Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI installed (including the one just trashed).
Limit 6 per deck.

10003.Title: Street Magic
10003.Text: Unbroken subroutines resolve in the order of your choice.

Details.flavor: The greatest trick is not the trick itself, but in making someone believe that it is no trick at all. To your average sysop, it's magic. To your average runner, it's a closely held trade secret.

10004.Title: High-Stakes Job
10004.Text: Make a run on a server with at least 1 piece of unrezzed ice. When the run ends, gain 12[credit] if it was successful.

10005.Title: Mongoose
10005.Text: You cannot use Mongoose to break subroutines on more than one ice per run. 1[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +2 strength.

Details.flavor: It is the hardest thing in the world to frighten a mongoose, because he is eaten up from nose to tail with curiosity. The motto of all the mongoose family is "Run and find out". -Rudyard Kipling, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi

10006.Title: Jesminder Sareen: Girl Behind the Curtain
10006.Text: Avoid the first tag during each run.

Details.flavor: "Mirrormode on."

10007.Title: Maya
10007.Text: +2[mu] Once per turn, immediately after you access a card from R&D, you may add that card to the bottom of R&D. If you do, take 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.

10008.Title: Panchatantra
10008.Text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may have it gain 1 subtype of your choice that is not sentry, code gate, or barrier for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: "The basics should be like the stories you learned as a child - unconscious, never forgotten, and suddenly relevant at the most random times." -g00ru

10009.Title: Artist Colony
10009.Text: Forfeit an agenda: Search your stack for a card and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: "We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely." -Oscar Wilde

10010.Title: Chatterjee University
10010.Text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on Chatterjee University.
[click]: Install a program from your grip, lowering the install cost by 1 for each power counter on Chatterjee University. Remove 1 hosted power counter.

Details.flavor: Legions of software engineers have been manufactured within its halls.

10011.Title: Advanced Concept Hopper
10011.Text: The first time the Runner initiates  a run each turn, you may draw 1 card or gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "I don't want a hopper. I've never even owned one. But every time I jack in, that same damn ad loads." -2xTiger

10012.Title: Vikram 1.0
10012.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Vikram 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot use programs for the remainder of this run.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.

10013.Title: Heritage Committee
10013.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Draw 3 cards. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.

Details.flavor: It is only by respecting the past that we can build a better future.

10014.Title: Mumbad City Grid
10014.Text: Whenever the Runner passes a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice protecting this server. Limit 1 region per server.

10015.Title: Kala Ghoda Real TV
10015.Text:
When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of the Runner's stack.
[trash]: The Runner trashes the top card of his or her stack.

Details.flavor: "A new property has two, maybe three hours. If it doesn't sell, cut it and move on."

10016.Title: Interrupt 0
10016.Text: [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine. [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine.

10017.Title: Dedication Ceremony
10017.Text: Place 3 advancement tokens on a faceup card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.

Details.flavor: "Never cut the ribbon until you have something to show off." -Eta Shah, VP Global Expansion

10018.Title: Mumba Temple
10018.Text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 15 or fewer ice in your deck.
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez cards.

Details.flavor: Those who are the wisest know the least.

10019.Title: Museum of History
10019.Text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 50 or more cards in your deck.
When your turn begins, you may shuffle 1 card from Archives into R&D.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>

Details.flavor: "And here we see the Polar Bear, once the largest land carnivore on Earth."

10020.Title: EMP Device
10020.Text: [trash]: The Corp cannot rez more than 1 piece of ice for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.

Details.flavor: "No! Don't set that off HERE!"

10021.Title: Diwan
10021.Text:
When Diwan is installed, choose a server. As an additional cost to install a card in or protecting that server, the Corp must pay 1[credit].
Trash Diwan if the Corp purges virus counters.

10022.Title: CBI Raid
10022.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, the Corp adds all cards in HQ to the top of R&D in the order of his or her choice.

Details.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2013 World Champion Jens Erickson</champion>

10023.Title: Tech Trader
10023.Text: Whenever you use a [trash] ability, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "Why would you dispose of perfectly good evidence when you can sell it?"

10024.Title: NetChip
10024.Text:
NetChip can host a program with a memory cost less than or equal to the number of copies of NetChip installed. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
Limit 6 per deck.

10025.Title: Corporate Scandal
10025.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp has 1 additional bad publicity (even if they have 0).

Details.flavor: "We may be outraged, but we're not surprised." -Sunder

10026.Title: Populist Rally
10026.Text: Play only if you have at least 1 seedy card installed. The Corp has 1 fewer [click] to spend on his or her next turn.

Details.flavor: "The corporations may be stronger than any of us, but they are not stronger than all of us." -Akshara Sareen

10027.Title: Advanced Assembly Lines
10027.Text:
When you rez Advanced Assembly Lines, gain 3[credit].
[trash]: Install a non-agenda card from HQ (paying the install cost). You cannot use this ability during a run.

10028.Title: Lakshmi Smartfabrics
10028.Text: Whenever you rez a card, place 1 power counter on Lakshmi Smartfabrics. X hosted power counters: Reveal an agenda worth X points from HQ. The Runner cannot steal copies of that agenda for the remainder of this turn.

10029.Title: Product Recall
10029.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. Trash a rezzed asset or upgrade. If you do, gain credits equal to its trash cost.

10030.Title: Pālanā Foods: Sustainable Growth
10030.Text: The first time each turn the Runner draws a card, gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: We Are What We Eat.

10031.Title: Pālanā Agroplex
10031.Text: When your turn begins, each player draws 1 card.

Details.flavor: Expensive to build but dramatically more efficient than traditional farming, agroplexes are emblems of the inevitable corporatization of the food industry.

10032.Title: Harvester
10032.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
[subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.

Details.flavor: "We can help others, yet also help ourselves." -Soraiya Suresh, VP Public Programs

10033.Title: Remote Data Farm
10033.Text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.

Details.flavor: Data, not food, is one of the biggest exports from the Gujarat district of Mumbad.

10034.Title: Disposable HQ
10034.Text:
If Disposable HQ is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Disposable HQ, you may add any number of cards from HQ to the bottom of R&D.

10035.Title: New Construction
10035.Text:
Install New Construction faceup.
Whenever you advance New Construction, you may install a card from HQ in a new server (and rez that card ignoring all costs if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on New Construction).

10036.Title: Mumbad Construction Co.
10036.Text:
When your turn begins, place 1 advancement token on Mumbad Construction Co.
2[credit]: Move 1 advancement token from Mumbad Construction Co. to a faceup card.

10037.Title: Corporate Sales Team
10037.Text:
When you score Corporate Sales Team, place 10[credit] on it.
When each player's turn begins, take 1[credit] from Corporate Sales Team.

Details.flavor: "You got it. We sell it. They buy it. Everyone wins."

10038.Title: PAD Factory
10038.Text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 3 PAD Campaigns in your deck.
[click]: Place 1 advancement token on a card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.

10039.Title: Political Graffiti
10039.Text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards, add Political Graffiti to an agenda in the Corp's score area as a hosted condition counter with the text "This agenda is worth -1 agenda points. Trash Political Graffiti if the Corp purges virus counters."

10040.Title: Nero Severn: Information Broker
10040.Text: Once per turn, you may jack out when you encounter a sentry.

Details.flavor: "Credits spend anywhere in the worlds, but there are other forms of currency."

10041.Title: Reflection
10041.Text: +1[mu] +1[link] Whenever you jack out, the Corp reveals 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "I'm on a need-to-know basis. I need to know everything." -Nero Severn

10042.Title: Spy Camera
10042.Text:
[click]: Look at the top X cards of your stack and arrange them in any order. X is the number of copies of Spy Camera installed.
[trash]: Look at the top card of R&D.
Limit 6 per deck.

10043.Title: Political Operative
10043.Text: Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. [trash], pay the trash cost of a rezzed card: Trash that card.

Details.flavor: Leverage, secrets, access, and influence are currency as valuable as credits. But credits work, too.

10044.Title: Sadyojata
10044.Text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 3 or more subtypes. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Sadyojata with a deva program from your grip.

Details.flavor: The Creator.

10045.Title: "Freedom Through Equality"
10045.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. When you steal an agenda, add "Freedom Through Equality" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

10046.Title: Akshara Sareen
10046.Text: Each player has 1 additional [click] to spend during his or her turn.

Details.flavor: "Our shared humanity is our greatest strength. And as we share more broadly, our strength grows, not dwindles."

10047.Title: Councilman
10047.Text: Whenever the Corp rezzes an asset or upgrade, you may pay credits equal to its rez cost and trash Councilman. If you do, derez that asset or upgrade. The Corp cannot rez it for the remainder of this turn.

Details.flavor: "Bureaucracy and red tape have been weaponized." -Fake-ir

10048.Title: Voting Machine Initiative
10048.Text:
Place 3 agenda counters on Voting Machine Initiative when you score it.
When the Runner's turn begins, you may spend 1 hosted agenda counter. If you do, the Runner loses [click], if able.

10049.Title: Clone Suffrage Movement
10049.Text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 operation from Archives to HQ if there is no ice protecting this server.

Details.flavor: "Our research says the public views clones as more human than bioroids. Historically, this has been a liability. Let's make it a strength."

10050.Title: Bio-Ethics Association
10050.Text: When your turn begins, do 1 net damage if there is no ice protecting this server.

Details.flavor: "There's no conflict of interest here. These are complex issues with highly technical minutiae. It's only natural that the experts should lay down the guidelines."

10051.Title: Political Dealings
10051.Text: Whenever you draw an agenda, you may reveal and install it.

Details.flavor: "Politics is a dirty business. But so is business." -Krishnan Sareen

10052.Title: "Clones are not People"
10052.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When you score an agenda, add "Clones are not People" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

10053.Title: Sensie Actors Union
10053.Text: When your turn begins, you may draw 3 cards if there is no ice protecting this server. If you do, add 1 card from HQ to the bottom of R&D.

Details.flavor: Being a Mumbad sensie star means a glamorous life, though it is lived in constant fear of blackmail-or worse-from orgcrime.

10054.Title: Commercial Bankers Group
10054.Text: When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if there is no ice protecting this server.

Details.flavor: "Money is speech and I am listening intently." -Krishnan Sareen

10055.Title: Mumbad City Hall
10055.Text: [click]: Search R&D for an alliance card, reveal it, and play or install it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: Mumbad's public city corporation is tightly connected to all the other corporations.

10056.Title: Bailiff
10056.Text:
Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Bailiff, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Efficiency means profiting from things everyone was doing anyway.

10057.Title: Surat City Grid
10057.Text: Whenever you rez a card in or protecting this server (not including Surat City Grid), you may rez another card, lowering the rez cost by 2. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: The political centre of Mumbad.

10058.Title: Making an Entrance
10058.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
Look at the top 6 cards of your stack. You may trash any of those cards and arrange the rest in any order.

Details.flavor: Sometimes in an instant you realize who your friends really are.

10059.Title: Salsette Slums
10059.Text:
Once per turn, you may pay the trash cost of a card you access that is not in Archives to remove that card from the game.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

Details.flavor: "Underestimate those people at your own peril." -Akshara Sareen

10060.Title: Exclusive Party
10060.Text:
Draw 1 card. Gain 1[credit] for each copy of Exclusive Party in your heap.
Limit 6 per deck.

Details.flavor: The more parties she attended, the more they trusted her. The more they trusted her, the more entertaining her scams became.

10061.Title: Vamadeva
10061.Text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with exactly 1 subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Vamadeva with a deva program from your grip.

Details.flavor: The Preserver.

10062.Title: Brahman
10062.Text: 1[credit]: Break up to 2 ice subroutines. 2[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Brahman to break a subroutine ends, add 1 installed non-virus program to the top of your stack.

10063.Title: Patron
10063.Text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server.
The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, draw 2 cards.

Details.flavor: "Check out my new ride." -2xTiger

10065.Title: Bazaar
10065.Text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware from your grip, you may install another copy of that hardware from your grip (paying all costs).

Details.flavor: In these days of digital full-sim browsing and widely available nano-assembly, it takes a special kind of crazy person to go shopping in meatspace. There are millions of them.

10066.Title: Personality Profiles
10066.Text: Whenever the Runner searches his or her stack or installs a card from his or her heap, he or she must trash a card from his or her grip at random.

10067.Title: Jeeves Model Bioroids
10067.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. The first time you spend 3[click] on the same action each turn, gain [click].

Details.flavor: "Very good, sir."

10068.Title: Raman Rai
10068.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Once per turn, you may lose [click] when you draw a card. If you do, reveal that card and a card in Archives of the same type, then swap those cards.

10069.Title: Upayoga
10069.Text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, the Runner loses 2[credit]. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on a piece of rezzed psi ice.

Details.flavor: "Connect two truths. Connect two programs. All is one."

10070.Title: Aryabhata Tech
10070.Text: Whenever there is a successful trace, gain 1[credit] and the Runner loses 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "As the world shrinks, communications becomes the most essential technology." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy

10071.Title: Salem's Hospitality
10071.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. Name a card. The Runner reveals his or her grip and trashes all copies of the named card from his or her grip.

10072.Title: Executive Search Firm
10072.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [weyland-consortium] cards in your deck. [click]: Search R&D for an executive, sysop, or character, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

10073.Title: Indian Union Stock Exchange
10073.Text: Whenever you rez or play an out-of-faction card (including Indian Union Stock Exchange), gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "Wealth wisely invested is wealth earned." -The New Gospel of Wealth
The naja naja is the king of all serpents.

10075.Title: Localized Product Line
10075.Text: Search R&D for any number of copies of a card, reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

Details.flavor: It's the exact same coffee, but the price sure is different.

10076.Title: Mumbad Virtual Tour
10076.Text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 7 or more assets in your deck.
If the Runner accesses Mumbad Virtual Tour while it is installed, he or she must trash it, if able.

10077.Title: The Noble Path
10077.Text: Trash your grip. Make a run. Prevent all damage during this run.

10078.Title: Emptied Mind
10078.Text: When your turn begins, gain [click] if you have no cards in your grip.

10079.Title: Information Sifting
10079.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, the Corp separates all cards in HQ into 2 facedown piles. Access all of the cards in one of the piles; you cannot access any cards in the other pile this run.

10080.Title: Out of the Ashes
10080.Text:
Make a run.
When your turn begins, if Out of the Ashes is in your heap, you may remove it from the game to make a run.
Limit 6 per deck.

10081.Title: Liberated Chela
10081.Text: [click],[click],[click],[click],[click], forfeit an agenda: Add Liberated Chela to your score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points. The Corp may forfeit an agenda to prevent this. If he or she does, remove Liberated Chela from the game.

10082.Title: Temple of the Liberated Mind
10082.Text: [click]: Place 1 power counter on Temple of the Liberated Mind. Hosted power counter: Gain [click]. Use this ability only on your turn and only once per turn.

10083.Title: Rebirth
10083.Text:
Switch your identity with another identity from the same faction. Remove Rebirth from the game instead of trashing it.
Limit 1 per deck.

10084.Title: Guru Davinder
10084.Text:
Prevent all net and meat damage.
Whenever Guru Davinder prevents at least 1 net or meat damage, trash him unless you pay 4[credit].

10085.Title: The Turning Wheel
10085.Text: Whenever a run on HQ or R&D ends, place 1 power counter on The Turning Wheel if you stole no agendas during the run. 2 hosted power counters: For the remainder of this run, access 1 additional card from HQ or R&D.

10086.Title: Brainstorm
10086.Text: When the Runner encounters Brainstorm, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.

10087.Title: Ravana 1.0
10087.Text: The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ravana 1.0. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice.

10088.Title: Dedicated Neural Net
10088.Text: The first time there is a successful run on HQ each turn, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you choose which cards the Runner accesses from HQ for the remainder of this run.

10089.Title: Chetana
10089.Text:
[subroutine] Each player gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.

10090.Title: Puppet Master
10090.Text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.

10091.Title: Waiver
10091.Text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, the Runner reveals his or her grip. Trash each of those cards with a play or install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.

10092.Title: Exchange of Information
10092.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Swap an agenda in your score area with an agenda in the Runner's score area.

10093.Title: Red Tape
10093.Text: [subroutine] All ice has +3 strength for the remainder of this run.

10094.Title: Consulting Visit
10094.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [weyland-consortium] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Search R&D for an operation and play it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.

10096.Title: Fear the Masses
10096.Text:
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D. You may reveal X copies of Fear the Masses from your grip to force the Corp to trash X additional cards.
Limit 6 per deck.

10097.Title: Aghora
10097.Text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a rez cost of 5 or greater. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Aghora with a deva program from your grip.

Details.flavor: The Destroyer.

10098.Title: Bhagat
10098.Text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D.

Details.flavor: "They don't want to listen, so we'll just have to crank up the volume."

10099.Title: The Black File
10099.Text:
The Corp cannot win the game unless the Runner is flatlined.
When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on The Black File. When there are 3 or more power counters on The Black File, remove it from the game.
Limit 1 per deck.

10100.Title: The Price of Freedom
10100.Text: As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed connection. The Corp cannot advance cards during his or her next turn. Remove The Price of Freedom from the game instead of trashing it.

10101.Title: Ankusa
10101.Text: If you use Ankusa to break all subroutines on a barrier during a single encounter, add that barrier to HQ. 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

10102.Title: Rigged Results
10102.Text: Secretly spend up to 2[credit]. The Corp guesses how much you spent. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, make a run and choose a piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Bypass that ice when you encounter it.

10103.Title: Magnet
10103.Text:
When you rez Magnet, host a program on it that is hosted on an installed piece of ice.
The text box of each program hosted on Magnet is blank.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "When the enemy has mastered the battlefield, change the battlefield." -The Playbook

10104.Title: Lateral Growth
10104.Text: Gain 4[credit]. You may install 1 card (paying the install cost).

Details.flavor: "Practical effects are expensive, but worth it. I had to smash seventeen stunt bioroids to get this shot." -Parvati Kapoor, director

10105.Title: Improved Protein Source
10105.Text: When Improved Protein Source is scored or stolen, the Runner gains 4[credit].

Details.flavor: They eat us, we eat them, the cycle goes on and on. -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"

10106.Title: Voter Intimidation
10106.Text:
Play only if there is an agenda in the Runner's score area.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, trash 1 resource.

10107.Title: Harishchandra Ent.: Where You're the Star
10107.Text: If the Runner is tagged, he or she plays with his or her grip revealed.

Details.flavor: We Know What You Want.

10108.Title: Full Immersion RecStudio
10108.Text:
Full Immersion RecStudio can host up to 2 assets and/or agendas.
The trash cost of Full Immersion RecStudio is increased by 3 for each card hosted on it.

Details.flavor: The costumes aren't strictly necessary, but they improve the performances of the vactors and sensie stars.

10109.Title: Ibrahim Salem
10109.Text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to rez Ibrahim Salem, forfeit an agenda. When your turn begins, name a card type. Look at the Runner's grip and trash 1 card in it of the named type.

10110.Title: Navi Mumbai City Grid
10110.Text: During a run on this server, the Runner cannot use paid abilities on non-icebreaker cards. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: The entertainment capital of Mumbad.

10111.Title: Zealous Judge
10111.Text:
Zealous Judge can only be rezzed if the Runner is tagged.
[click], 1[credit]: Give the Runner 1 tag.

10112.Title: Election Day
10112.Text: Trash all cards in HQ (minimum of 1). Draw 5 cards.

Details.flavor: "A new administration means we have to start greasing the wheels all over again. Let's get to work."

10113.Title: Subcontract
10113.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Play up to 2 operations from HQ (paying all costs), resolving them one at a time.

Details.flavor: Judicious use of freelancers can increase efficiency and protect the company from legal repercussions. It's what they call a "win-win".

10114.Title: Merger
10114.Text: Merger is worth 1 additional agenda point while in the Runner's score area.

Details.flavor: Survival of the fittest' is so outdated; in finance it's 'survival of the fattest.' -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"

11001.Title: System Outage
11001.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. Whenever the Corp draws 1 or more cards, he or she loses 1[credit] if it is not the first time he or she has drawn cards this turn.

11002.Title: Null: Whistleblower
11002.Text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may trash 1 card from your grip. If you do, that ice has -2 strength for the remainder of this run.

11003.Title: GPI Net Tap
11003.Text: Whenever you approach a piece of ice, you may expose it. You may then trash GPI Net Tap to jack out.

Details.flavor: Sometimes the itsy-bitsy data is most important.

11004.Title: Hernando Cortez
11004.Text: If the Corp has at least 10[credit], as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, the Corp must spend credits equal to the number of subroutines on that ice.

Details.flavor: "Take it from me, there is a point where you have so much money you stop caring. That's usually right before it all comes tumbling down."

11005.Title: Mirror
11005.Text: +2[mu] Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may replace 1 spent recurring credit. Limit 1 console per player.

11006.Title: Dai V
11006.Text: 2[credit]: Break all subroutines. Use this ability only by spending credits from stealth cards. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: In running, as in reality, all elements are connected.

11007.Title: Another Day, Another Paycheck
11007.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. Whenever you steal an agenda, force the Corp to "Trace 0 If unsuccessful, the Runner gains credits equal to the number of agenda points in both players' score areas."

11008.Title: Deuces Wild
11008.Text:
Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Gain 3[credit].
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Remove 1 tag.
  • Expose 1 piece of ice, then make a run.

Details.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2014 World Champion Dan D'Argenio</champion>

11009.Title: Injection Attack
11009.Text: Make a run and choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: They call it "running" because jacking in is mentally and physically exhausting.

11010.Title: Fairchild 1.0
11010.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Fairchild 1.0.
[subroutine]The Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine]The Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.

Details.flavor: I foresee the end of all things...

11011.Title: Sherlock 2.0
11011.Text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Sherlock 2.0.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the bottom of the Runner's stack.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the bottom of the Runner's stack.
[subroutine]Give the Runner 1 tag.

11012.Title: Hyoubu Research Facility
11012.Text: The first time each turn you reveal secretly spent credits, gain that many credits.

Details.flavor: "I'm telling you, free up the emergency accounts. Something's coming; I haven't seen a reaction like that since the tsunami. My god, the screaming..."

11013.Title: Chrysalis
11013.Text:
If Chrysalis is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Chrysalis, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Chrysalis from Archives.
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.

11014.Title: Georgia Emelyov
11014.Text:
Whenever the Runner makes an unsuccessful run on this server, do 1 net damage.
2[credit]: Move Georgia Emelyov to another server.

Details.flavor: "Your mistake is thinking that it's just business, when really it's a war."

11015.Title: Watchdog
11015.Text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice you rez each turn is lowered by 1 for each tag the Runner has.

Details.flavor: "Person of interest. Noun. Someone who is about to get ****ed by a corp." - Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting

11016.Title: Hard-Hitting News
11016.Text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 4 tags.

11017.Title: NBN: Controlling the Message
11017.Text: The first time the Runner trashes an installed Corp card each turn, you may <trace>trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag (cannot be avoided).

11018.Title: Crisis Management
11018.Text: If the Runner is tagged, Crisis Management gains "When your turn begins, do 1 meat damage."

Details.flavor: "For the duration of the emergency" is code for "this is the way things are now."

11019.Title: Stock Buy-Back
11019.Text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 3[credit] for each agenda in the Runner's score area.

Details.flavor: A stock dropping sharply is bad for shareholders, but not neccessarily bad for the company.

11020.Title: Sandburg
11020.Text: If you have at least 10[credit], each piece of ice has +1 strength for every 5[credit] in your credit pool.

Details.flavor: Money is power.

11021.Title: Credit Crash
11021.Text: Make a run. Trash the first non-agenda card you access during this run at no cost. The Corp can spend credits equal to the rez or play cost of the accessed card to prevent this trash.

11022.Title: Rumor Mill
11022.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The text box of each unique non-region asset and upgrade is blank.

Details.flavor: "You can have a lot of fun in 23 seconds." -Princess Space Kitten

11023.Title: Nfr
11023.Text: When an encounter in which you used Nfr to break all subroutines on that piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Nfr. Nfr has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine.

Details.flavor: Balance out the equation.

11024.Title: Paperclip
11024.Text: Whenever you encounter a barrier, you may install Paperclip from your heap (paying its install cost). X[credit]: +X strength. Break up to X barrier subroutines, if able.

Details.flavor: "It is not wise to call someone crazy until you fully understand what they're trying to say." -Omar Keung

11025.Title: Golden
11025.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. 2[credit], return Golden to your grip: Derez a sentry. Use this ability only after using Golden to break all the subroutines on that sentry during a single encounter.

Details.flavor: The program was as close to a hunting raptor as she could afford...for now.

11026.Title: Temüjin Contract
11026.Text:
Choose a server and place 20[credit] from the bank on Temüjin Contract when you install it. When there are no credits left on Temüjin Contract, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on the chosen server, take 4[credit] from Temüjin Contract.

Details.flavor: "The best part is, it's legal!" -Khan

11027.Title: Khan: Savvy Skiptracer
11027.Text: The first time you pass a piece of ice each turn, you may install an icebreaker from your hand, lowering the install cost by 1.

11028.Title: Data Breach
11028.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, you may make another run on R&D when this run ends.

Details.flavor: Once a security flaw is identified, there's only a limited window to exploit it before it's patched. Runners call this period "open season."

11029.Title: Algo Trading
11029.Text:
When your turn begins, you may move up to 3[credit] from your credit pool to Algo Trading.
When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on Algo Trading from the bank if there are at least 6[credit] on it.
[click],[trash]: Take all credits from Algo Trading.

11030.Title: Beth Kilrain-Chang
11030.Text:
If the Corp has 5-9[credit] when your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
If the Corp has 10-14[credit] when your turn begins, draw 1 card.
If the Corp has at least 15[credit] when your turn begins, gain [click].

Details.flavor: "Coming to you live from the front lines, for now, unless they kill me..."

11031.Title: Fairchild 2.0
11031.Text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Fairchild 2.0.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: To threaten my treasures is to incur my wrath.

11032.Title: Aiki
11032.Text:
[subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, the Runner draws 2 cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: First, blend with the attacker. Then, control the attack.

11033.Title: Enforcing Loyalty
11033.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, trash an installed card that does not match the faction of the Runner's identity.

Details.flavor: "Eiko here. It's done."

11034.Title: Hatchet Job
11034.Text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Trace 5 If successful, add an installed non-virtual card to the Runner's grip.

Details.flavor: "SELL!! Buy platinum, but GET OUT OF THE TT CREDIT! It is TOXIC!"

11035.Title: Special Report
11035.Text: Shuffle any number of cards from HQ into R&D. Draw that number of cards.
