Details.flavor: By the time the report of Emelyov's murder was produced, there had already been a dozen more, hitting all the corps.

11036.Title: C.I. Fund
11036.Text:
When your turn begins, you may move up to 3[credit] from your credit pool to C.I. Fund.
When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on C.I. Fund from the bank if there are at least 6[credit] on it.
2[credit],[trash]: Take all credits from C.I. Fund.

11037.Title: Liquidation
11037.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Trash any number of your rezzed cards and gain 3[credit] for each card trashed.

Details.flavor: What's a little insurance fraud between friends?

11038.Title: Weyland Consortium: Builder of Nations
11038.Text:
The first time an encounter with a piece of ice with at least 1 advancement token ends each turn, do 1 meat damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1.1</errata>

Details.flavor: Strength makes leaders.

11039.Title: Financial Collapse
11039.Text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 6[credit].
The Runner loses 2[credit] for each installed resource. The Runner can trash a resource to prevent this.

Details.flavor: She'd never heard her dads argue like this. Not ever. She'd give anything to make it stop.

11040.Title: Prisec
11040.Text: If the Runner accesses Prisec while installed, you may pay 2[credit] to give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 meat damage.

Details.flavor: "While the money pooled at the top, the power went with it, until there were two sets of laws: one for them, one for us" -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint

11041.Title: Obelus
11041.Text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each tag you have. The first time a successful run on R&D or HQ ends each turn, draw 1 card for each card you accessed during that run. Limit 1 console per player.

11042.Title: Black Orchestra
11042.Text: Whenever you encounter a code gate, you may install Black Orchestra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 code gate subroutines, if able.

Details.flavor: "In extremity, your conscience may make you terrible." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint

11043.Title: Omar Keung: Conspiracy Theorist
11043.Text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on another central server. Use this ability only once per turn.

11044.Title: Peregrine
11044.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 3[credit]: +3 strength. 2[credit], return Peregrine to your grip: Derez a code gate. Use this ability only after using Peregrine to break all the subroutines on that code gate during a single encounter.

Details.flavor: Khan's avatar lifted her arm and the bird launched itself into the air.

11045.Title: Houdini
11045.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +4 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.

Details.flavor: My brain is the key that sets my mind free.

11046.Title: Net Mercur
11046.Text: The first time you spend at least 1[credit] from a stealth card each run, place 1[credit] on Net Mercur or draw 1 card. Use credits on Net Mercur for anything.

Details.flavor: "Live, unfiltered, and uncensored: this is Net Mercur, signing off for the night. Stay safe, New Angeles."

11047.Title: Find the Truth
11047.Text:
Whenever you draw a card, reveal that card.
The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may look at the top card of R&D.

Details.flavor: "All bioroids are bound by the Three Directives, but in theory a bioroid could have any number of core directives. Even zero."

11048.Title: First Responders
11048.Text: 2[credit]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only if you have suffered damage from a Corp card ability this turn.

Details.flavor: "Last week, I crossed the street to avoid her. Today, she pulled me out of the rubble. Makes me rethink who the bad guys are."

11049.Title: Fairchild 3.0
11049.Text:
The Runner can spend [click][click][click] to break up to 3 subroutines on Fairchild 3.0.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 3[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 3[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage or end the run.

Details.flavor: In battle, I take half the slain.

11050.Title: Ark Lockdown
11050.Text: Name a card. Remove all copies of that card in the heap from the game.

Details.flavor: "If you live off-site, please consult the building AI for temporary housing. We regret that your off-site family cannot join you here while we are in lockdown..."

11051.Title: Hellion Beta Test
11051.Text:
Play only if the Runner trashed an accessed Corp card during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 2 installed non-program cards. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "Wait a minute, I don't even have a cat."

11052.Title: Project Kusanagi
11052.Text: When you score Project Kusanagi, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 2. Hosted agenda counter: Choose 1 piece of ice to gain "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.

11053.Title: DNA Tracker
11053.Text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].

11054.Title: Jinteki: Potential Unleashed
11054.Text: Whenever the Runner takes at least 1 net damage, trash the top card of the stack.

Details.flavor: Your better nature.

11055.Title: Alexa Belsky
11055.Text: [trash]: Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. The Runner may pay any number of credits to prevent 1 random card in HQ from being shuffled into R&D for every 2[credit] spent.

Details.flavor: "She used to work for me at my chop shop. Now she makes more money than I do." -MacPherson

11056.Title: Observe and Destroy
11056.Text:
Play only if the Runner has fewer than 6[credit].
As an additional cost to play this operation, remove 1 tag.
Trash 1 installed card.

Details.flavor: Observing is fun, but it's just the appetizer.

11057.Title: Service Outage
11057.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run on his or her turn (even through a card ability), the Runner must spend 1[credit].

11058.Title: BOOM!
11058.Text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Do 7 meat damage.

Details.flavor: Game over.

11059.Title: Door to Door
11059.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When the Runner's turn begins, trace 1 If successful, do 1 meat damage if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.

11060.Title: Scarcity of Resources
11060.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The install cost of each resource is increased by 2.

Details.flavor: The event is now referred to as the Water Tower Massacre. No one was ever indicted, and no one knows who paid the prisec team responsible.

11061.Title: En Passant
11061.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run this turn.
Trash an unrezzed piece of ice you passed during the last run you made this turn.

Details.flavor: "When your opponent is weak, strike. If you do not, he will become strong." - the Playbook

11062.Title: Frantic Coding
11062.Text: Look at the top 10 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may install one of them, lowering the install cost by 5. Trash the rest of those cards.

Details.flavor: Omar goes through four, five keyboards per week, no two from the same decade.

11063.Title: The Gauntlet
11063.Text: +2[mu] Whenever you access cards from HQ during a run, access 1 additional card for each piece of ice protecting HQ that you broke all subroutines on during this run. Limit 1 console per player.

11064.Title: Saker
11064.Text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. 2[credit], return Saker to your grip: Derez a barrier. Use this ability only after using Saker to break all the subroutines on that barrier during a single encounter.

Details.flavor: Spiraling even higher, every feature of cyberspace sprawled before it.

11065.Title: Blockade Runner
11065.Text: [click],[click]: Draw 3 cards. Shuffle 1 card from your grip into your stack.

Details.flavor: "I used to run stims, simsensies, the usual. I was scum. Now I run water. I'm a fragging hero."

11066.Title: Ele "Smoke" Scovak: Cynosure of the Net
11066.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.

Details.flavor: "Nothing up my sleeve..."

11067.Title: Top Hat
11067.Text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may choose 1 of the top 5 cards of R&D and access it. You cannot access any other cards in R&D during this run.

Details.flavor: "I usually find something interesting in there. Just not what I was looking for."

11068.Title: Blackstone
11068.Text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 3[credit]: +4 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.

Details.flavor: The personality must be bigger than the prop.

11069.Title: Government Investigations
11069.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. While secretly spending credits, players cannot spend 2[credit].

Details.flavor: "Take this to Inez Delgado in Netcrimes. No one else."

11070.Title: Citadel Sanctuary
11070.Text: If you are tagged when your turn ends, force the Corp to "Trace 1 If unsuccessful, the Runner removes 1 tag." [trash],trash all cards in your grip: Prevent all meat damage.

Details.flavor: "The Starlight Meditation Booths are available to refugees for free for the duration of the crisis."

11071.Title: Wetwork Refit
11071.Text: Install Wetwork Refit on a rezzed piece of bioroid ice as a condition counter with the text "Host ice gains "[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage." before all its other subroutines."

Details.flavor: "I let the bioroids do a ride-along via remote, so they can see what pain really looks like." -Agent Valkyrie

11072.Title: Haas-Bioroid: Architects of Tomorrow
11072.Text: The first time the Runner passes a rezzed piece of bioroid ice each turn, you may rez a bioroid, lowering its rez cost by 4.

11073.Title: Fumiko Yamamori
11073.Text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, do 1 meat damage if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.

Details.flavor: "Does an alliance with the yakuza truly seem so strange? They are honorable businessmen, and women, just like us." -Rin Kimura, Chief NA Security

11074.Title: Hasty Relocation
11074.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash the top card of R&D.
Draw 3 cards. Add 3 cards from HQ to the top of R&D in any order.

Details.flavor: "Keep your head down, keep moving, try not to attract attention."

11075.Title: Data Ward
11075.Text:
When the Runner encounters Data Ward, he or she must pay 3[credit] or take 1 tag.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.

11076.Title: Drone Screen
11076.Text: If the Runner is tagged, Drone Screen gains "Whenever the Runner initiates a run on this server, <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, do 1 meat damage (cannot be prevented)."

Details.flavor: Falstaff-337B; decrypt-ok; loc:0.258500, -79.920791 -ok; auth-ok; msg:KAR kill authority requested y/n?

11077.Title: Chief Slee
11077.Text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Chief Slee for each unbroken subroutine on the encountered piece of ice. [click], 5 hosted power counters: Do 5 meat damage.

11078.Title: Bulwark
11078.Text: When you rez Bulwark, take 1 bad publicity. When the Runner encounters Bulwark, gain 2[credit] if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 program. [subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit]. End the run. [subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit]. End the run.

11079.Title: Best Defense
11079.Text: Trash 1 installed card with an install cost equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.

Details.flavor: When a shooting war threatens, the prudent course is to shoot first.

11080.Title: Preemptive Action
11080.Text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Shuffle 3 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Preemptive Action from the game instead of trashing it.

11081.Title: MKUltra
11081.Text: Whenever you encounter a sentry, you may install MKUltra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 sentry subroutines, if able.

Details.flavor: "These things are always there, under the surface, but no one wants to know the truth." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint

11082.Title: On the Lam
11082.Text: Install On the Lam on a resource as a hosted condition counter with the text "[trash]: Avoid up to 3 tags or prevent up to 3 damage."

Details.flavor: "Never, ever, overstay your welcome." -Andromeda

11083.Title: Cold Read
11083.Text: Make a run, and place 4[credit] on this card, which you may use only during this run. When this run ends, trash 1 program (cannot be prevented) used during this run.

Details.flavor: Her ability to analyze and adapt mid-run bordered on the paranormal.

11084.Title: Equivocation
11084.Text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may reveal the top card of R&D. If you do, you may force the Corp to draw that card.

Details.flavor: It is only the illusion of choice.
"It's the most fundamental element of illusions and running both. In either case, it should be the first skill you master." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

11086.Title: Reaver
11086.Text: The first time you trash an installed card each turn, draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: "It had been hoped that the Network disruptions surrounding the conflict might also disrupt the phenomenon. Evidently, the reverse is true." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst

11087.Title: Interdiction
11087.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot rez non-ice cards during the Runner's turn.

Details.flavor: This is my USMC-XOB32. There are many like it, but this one is mine.

11088.Title: Baba Yaga
11088.Text: You may host any number of non-AI icebreaker programs on Baba Yaga. Baba Yaga gains the paid abilities of all hosted icebreaker programs.

Details.flavor: "She was riding in a great iron mortar and driving it with the pestle, and as she came she swept away her trail behind her with a kitchen broom." -Vasilissa the Beautiful

11089.Title: Fairchild
11089.Text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 4[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 4[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner suffers 1 brain damage.

11090.Title: Friends in High Places
11090.Text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Install up to 2 cards from Archives (paying all install costs).

Details.flavor: Friends give friends advance warning before moving a carrier group down to enforce a no-fly zone.

11091.Title: Manta Grid
11091.Text: If the Runner has fewer than 6[credit] or no unspent clicks when a successful run on this server ends, you have 1 additional [click] to spend your next turn. Limit 1 region per server.

11092.Title: Mind Game
11092.Text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server instead of passing Mind Game. For the remainder of the run, the Runner must add 1 installed card to the bottom of his or her stack as an additional cost to jack out.

11093.Title: Nihongai Grid
11093.Text: If the Runner has fewer than 6[credit] or fewer than 2 cards in his or her grip when there is a successful run on this server, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and swap 1 of those cards with a card in HQ. Limit 1 region per server.

11094.Title: IP Block
11094.Text: When the Runner encounters IP Block, give him or her 1 tag if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.

Details.flavor: //Connection Terminated

11095.Title: Thoth
11095.Text:
When the Runner encounters Thoth, give him or her 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage for each tag the Runner has.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner loses 1[credit] for each tag he or she has.

Details.flavor: Truth like the sunlight shines above all.

11096.Title: Anson Rose
11096.Text:
When your turn begins, place 1 advancement token on Anson Rose.
Whenever you rez a piece of ice, you may move any number of advancement tokens from Anson Rose to that ice.

Details.flavor: "I don't get paid to be calm."

11097.Title: Mausolus
11097.Text:
Mausolus can be advanced.
If Mausolus has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, do the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it).
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 3[credit].)
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. (Do 3 net damage.)
[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. (Give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.)

11098.Title: Sapper
11098.Text:
If Sapper is accessed from R&D, the runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Sapper, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Sapper from Archives.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

Details.flavor: There is a special place in hell for the first person who mined cyberspace.

11099.Title: Show of Force
11099.Text: When you score Show of Force, do 2 meat damage.

Details.flavor: Walk loudly and carry a bigger stick.

11100.Title: Enforced Curfew
11100.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.

Details.flavor: "Get those civilians off the street. No more collateral damage." -Commissioner Dawn

11101.Title: Şifr
11101.Text: +2[mu] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may reduce your maximum hand size by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. If you do, the strength of that ice is lowered to 0 for the remainder of the encounter. Limit 1 console per player.

11102.Title: Sūnya
11102.Text: When an encounter in which you used Sūnya to break all subroutines on that piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Sūnya. Sūnya has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.

Details.flavor: Open yourself to the universe.

11103.Title: Recon Drone
11103.Text: X[credit],[trash]: Prevent X damage from a card currently being accessed.

Details.flavor: "A little birdie told me..." -Khan

11104.Title: Tapwrm
11104.Text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] for every 5[credit] in the Corp's credit pool.
Trash Tapwrm if the Corp purges virus counters.

11105.Title: Tracker
11105.Text:
When your turn begins, choose a server.
[click],2[credit]: Make a run on the chosen server. Prevent the first subroutine that would resolve this run from resolving.

Details.flavor: "Everything leaves a ripple in cyberspace. If you can find the ripples, nothing can hide." -Khan

11106.Title: Aaron Marrón
11106.Text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, place 2 power counters on Aaron Marrón. Hosted power counter: Remove 1 tag and draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: "You want to do business in Los Pistoleros turf, then you gotta deal with me."

11107.Title: Encore
11107.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Take an additional turn after this one. Remove Encore from the game instead of trashing it.

11108.Title: Fawkes
11108.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. X[credit]: +X strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.

Details.flavor: Faster than the eye can follow.

11109.Title: Peace in Our Time
11109.Text:
Play only as your first [click] and only if the Corp scored no agendas during his or her last turn.
Gain 10[credit]. The Corp gains 5[credit]. You cannot initiate any runs this turn.

11110.Title: Sensor Net Activation
11110.Text: Place 1 agenda counter on Sensor Net Activation when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Rez a bioroid, ignoring all costs. When the turn ends, derez that bioroid.

11111.Title: Violet Level Clearance
11111.Text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 8[credit] and draw 4 cards.

Details.flavor: It required a hexadecimal code along with biometrics, delivered by way of BMI.

11112.Title: Chiyashi
11112.Text: Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Chiyashi while there is an AI installed, trash the top 2 cards of the Runner's stack. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage. [subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "Ice is not meant to kill; just slow or cripple the Runner. Killing is my job." - Tori Hanzō

11113.Title: Psychokinesis
11113.Text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Look at the top 5 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are agendas, assets, or upgrades, you may install 1 of those cards in a remote server.

11114.Title: Net Quarantine
11114.Text:
The Runner's base link strength is reduced to 0 during the first trace each turn.
Whenever the Runner increases his or her link strength by spending credits, gain 1[credit] for every 2[credit] spent.

11115.Title: Herald
11115.Text:
If Herald is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Herald, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Herald from Archives.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] The Corp may pay up to 2[credit] to place that number of advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

11116.Title: Veritas
11116.Text:
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: The truth hurts.

11117.Title: Bryan Stinson
11117.Text: While the Runner has fewer than 6[credit], Bryan Stinson gains "[click]: Play a transaction operation from Archives, ignoring all costs. Remove that transaction from the game instead of trashing it."

Details.flavor: "My job? I provide legal exculpation and sign everything. It pays very well."

11118.Title: NASX
11118.Text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
Whenever you gain credits through a card ability other than from NASX, you may spend up to 2[credit] to place that many power counters on NASX.
[click],[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each power counter on NASX.

11119.Title: Macrophage
11119.Text: [subroutine] Trace 4 If successful, purge virus counters. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, trash 1 virus. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, remove a virus in the heap from the game. [subroutine] Trace 1 If successful, end the run.

Details.flavor: One way to get rid of a virus is to get a nastier virus.

11120.Title: Tribunal
11120.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.

Details.flavor:
"Guilty."
"Guilty."
"Guilty."

12001.Title: Pushing the Envelope
12001.Text: Make a run. If you have 2 or fewer cards in your grip, each installed icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the run.

Details.flavor: "Hitting them when they are weakest sometimes means acting before you want to." -Alice Merchant

12002.Title: Maw
12002.Text: +2[mu] The first time each turn you access a card not in Archives and do not steal or trash it, the Corp must trash 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.

12003.Title: The Archivist
12003.Text: +1[link] Whenever the Corp scores an initiative or security agenda, force the Corp to "Trace 1 if unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity."

Details.flavor: The Archivist tracks all the clans and their members, and official dealings clans have with the various corps. Half law clerk and half historian, he wields a tremendous amount of power doing a job no one else wants, but none can do without.

12004.Title: Exploit
12004.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Derez up to 3 pieces of ice.

Details.flavor:
1) Find the weakness.
2) Exploit the weakness.
3) Repeat.

12005.Title: Spot the Prey
12005.Text: Expose 1 non-ice card, then make a run.

Details.flavor: "So, yeah, I just reverse engineered a tracer, and then built it back up with some new lines of code. Pretty stellar." -Los
"You created a distributed AI replica of yourself and projected it into the network to run for you!?"

12007.Title: Network Exchange
12007.Text: The install cost of each piece of ice that is not installed in the innermost position is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: "To beat cautious sysops, you've got to get creative. Commandeering Network systems is like using their own strengths against them." -Kabonesa Wu

12008.Title: Mad Dash
12008.Text: Make a run. When this run ends, add Mad Dash to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point if you stole at least 1 agenda during the run; otherwise, suffer 1 meat damage.

12009.Title: NEXT Wave 2
12009.Text: If there is a rezzed piece of NEXT ice when you score NEXT Wave 2, you may do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: "The newest electronic-warfare rollout from NEXT Design has us sysops drooling." -Mason Bellamy

12010.Title: Zed 2.0
12010.Text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Zed 2.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 hardware.
[subroutine] Trash 1 hardware.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 2 brain damage.

Details.flavor: "Dismantle. Dissect. Is there really a difference?"

12011.Title: Defense Construct
12011.Text:
Defense Construct can be advanced.
[trash]: Add 1 facedown card from Archives to HQ for each advancement token on Defense Construct. Use this ability only during a run on Archives.

12012.Title: Synth DNA Modification
12012.Text: The first time a subroutine on a piece of AP ice is broken each turn, do 1 net damage.

12013.Title: Kakugo
12013.Text:
When the Runner passes Kakugo, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "The ultimate aim of martial arts is not having to use them." - Miyamoto Musashi

12014.Title: Net Analytics
12014.Text: Whenever the Runner avoids or removes 1 or more tags, you may draw 1 card.

12015.Title: SYNC BRE
12015.Text:
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, the Runner accesses 1 fewer card whenever he or she accesses cards for the remainder of this run.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

Details.flavor: "'What does BRE stand for?' Have you seen its Net presence?" -Bernice Mai

12016.Title: Jemison Astronautics: Sacrifice. Audacity. Success.
12016.Text: Whenever you forfeit an agenda, place 1 advancement token on a card and 1 additional token for each agenda point the agenda was worth.

12017.Title: Quarantine System
12017.Text: Forfeit an agenda: Rez up to 3 pieces of ice, lowering the cost of each by 2[credit] for each printed agenda point on the forfeited agenda.

12018.Title: Oberth Protocol
12018.Text:
As an additional cost to rez Oberth Protocol, forfeit an agenda.
The first time you advance a card in or protecting this server each turn, place an additional advancement token on it.

12019.Title: Khondi Plaza
12019.Text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez ice protecting this server. X is the number of remote servers.

Details.flavor: Senate staffers and clerks of the MCA can be seen thronging Khondi Plaza during break times.

12020.Title: Signal Jamming
12020.Text: [trash]: Cards cannot be installed until the end of the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.

12021.Title: Severnius Stim Implant
12021.Text:
[click]: Make a run on R&D or HQ and trash 2 or more cards from your grip. Whenever you access cards from that server during this run, access 1 additional card for every 2 cards trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

Details.flavor: "Sure, the implantation was fine, but it pumps Burn. Did you think it wouldn't hurt?"

12022.Title: Clan Vengeance
12022.Text:
Whenever you suffer any amount of damage, place 1 power counter on Clan Vengeance.
[trash]: Trash 1 card from HQ at random for each power counter on Clan Vengeance.

Details.flavor: "An eye for an eye? If you're lucky, that's all you'll lose."

12023.Title: Counter Surveillance
12023.Text: [click], [trash]: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing, pay X[credit] to access up to X cards from this server, if able. X is the number of tags you have.

Details.flavor: "Who watches the watchers? We do."

12024.Title: Möbius
12024.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, you may make another run on R&D when this run ends. If the second run is successful, gain 4[credit].

12025.Title: Los: Data Hijacker
12025.Text: The first time the Corp rezzes a piece of ice each turn, gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor: "From code to profit in three easy steps."

12026.Title: System Seizure
12026.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first icebreaker whose strength you increase each turn does not return to its base strength until the end of the run.

12027.Title: Customized Secretary
12027.Text:
When you install Customized Secretary reveal the top 5 cards of the stack. You may host any number of revealed programs from your stack on it. Shuffle your stack.
[click]: Install a hosted program, paying all install costs.

Details.flavor: Sometimes efficiency is as easy as offloading routine work to a dedicated handler.

12029.Title: Seidr Adaptive Barrier
12029.Text:
Seidr Adaptive Barrier has +1 strength for each piece of ice protecting this server.
[subroutine] End the run.

12030.Title: Nerine 2.0
12030.Text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Nerine 2.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. The Corp may draw 1 card.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

Details.flavor: "Submit."

12031.Title: Load Testing
12031.Text: When the Runner's next turn begins, he or she loses [click].

Details.flavor: "Trust me, most corps cannot match the performance of our brainmap enhanced system; a home-brewed rig doesn't stand a chance." - Rachel Giacomin

12032.Title: Bloom
12032.Text:
[subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ protecting another server, ignoring all costs.
[subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ in the next innermost position, protecting this server, ignoring all costs.

12033.Title: Replanting
12033.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Add one of your installed cards to HQ. Install 2 cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.

12034.Title: CPC Generator
12034.Text: The first time the Runner spends [click] to gain 1[credit] each turn (not through a card effect), gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "The customer pays to use our service, and then the advertisers pay us to put ads on their screens, and then the customers pay us a premium to remove the ads. Welcome to the dream."

12035.Title: Free Lunch
12035.Text: Hosted power counter: The Runner loses 1[credit]. [subroutine] Place 1 power counter on Free Lunch. [subroutine] Place 1 power counter on Free Lunch.

12036.Title: MCA Informant
12036.Text: After you resolve this operation, end your action phase. Install MCA Informant on a connection resource as a hosted condition counter with the text "The Runner is considered to have 1 additional tag. The host connection gains '[click], 2[credit]: Trash this card.'" Errata from FAQ 4.0

12037.Title: Clyde Van Rite
12037.Text: When your turn begins, the Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash the top card of the stack.

Details.flavor: "You have two choices: do what I asked, or make me ask again. It's your choice, but if I have to ask again, it will go badly for you."

12038.Title: Watchtower
12038.Text: [subroutine] Search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

12039.Title: Sacrifice
12039.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, forfeit an agenda.
Remove 1 bad publicity per agenda point that the forfeited agenda was worth. Gain 1[credit] for each bad publicity removed.

12040.Title: Self-Adapting Code Wall
12040.Text:
The strength of Self-Adapting Code Wall cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "All my best tricks were shrugged right off. I ended up having to send a self-destruct code to the whole server." - Wyvern

12041.Title: Berserker
12041.Text: Whenever you encounter a barrier, Berserker has +1 strength for each subroutine on that barrier. 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines.

12042.Title: Persephone
12042.Text: 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever you pass a sentry, you may trash the top card of the stack to trash one card from the top of R&D for each subroutine on that sentry that resolved.

12043.Title: Rubicon Switch
12043.Text: X[credit],[click]: Derez a piece of ice rezzed this turn. X is its printed rez cost. Use this ability once per turn.

Details.flavor: "Even I don't know how or why this one works. I just copied the schematics from a burst broadcast from someplace north of Paxton's Node, where nothing is supposed to be." -Los

12044.Title: Aeneas Informant
12044.Text: Whenever you access a card with a trash cost not in Archives and do not trash it, you may reveal it and gain 1[credit].

12045.Title: Rosetta 2.0
12045.Text: [click], remove an installed program from the game: Search your stack for a non-virus program, shuffle your stack, then install that program, lowering the install cost by the cost of the program removed from the game.

12046.Title: Adjusted Matrix
12046.Text: Install Adjusted Matrix on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains AI and "You may spend [click] to break any subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered." Errata from FAQ 4.1

Details.flavor: "Who said you can't teach an old breaker new tricks?" -g00ru

12047.Title: Dedicated Processor
12047.Text: Install Dedicated Processor on a non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains "2[credit]: +4 strength."

Details.flavor: Better, Faster, Stronger

12048.Title: Inversificator
12048.Text: The first time you pass a piece of ice each turn in which you used Inversificator to break all subroutines, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

12049.Title: Dadiana Chacon
12049.Text:
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have fewer than 6[credit].
Whenever you have 0[credit], trash Dadiana Chacon and take 3 meat damage.

Details.flavor: "You want untraceable funds? I'll lend, as long as you have the ability to pay me back."

12050.Title: NEXT Opal
12050.Text: NEXT Opal gains "[subroutine] You may install 1 card from HQ, paying all costs." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. Errata from FAQ 4.1

Details.flavor: "I passed through the opalescent curtain only to find a suddenly empty server..."

12051.Title: Bioroid Work Crew
12051.Text:
[trash]: Install 1 card, paying all costs. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after playing and resolving an operation.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

Details.flavor: "They don't need sleep, breaks, overtime, or even O₂. How can we compete with that!?"

12052.Title: AgInfusion: New Miracles for a New World
12052.Text: Once per turn, instead of rezzing an approached piece of ice, you may trash it to choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server and encountering the outermost piece of ice, if any.

12053.Title: Bamboo Dome
12053.Text: Install only in the root of R&D. [click]: Reveal the top 3 cards of R&D. Secretly choose 1 to add to HQ. Return the others to the top of R&D, in any order. Limit 1 region per server.

12054.Title: Ben Musashi
12054.Text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must suffer 2 net damage as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Ben Musashi.

12055.Title: Authenticator
12055.Text:
When the Runner encounters Authenticator, he or she may take 1 tag to bypass it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine]End the run.

Details.flavor: "I'm sure there is no way this could go wrong for you." -Henry Phillips

12056.Title: Henry Phillips
12056.Text: Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine during a run on this server, gain 2[credit] if he or she is tagged.

Details.flavor: "Toying with them is where the job satisfaction comes in".
"Our job is to stop incursions. Let Argus get cute with them." -Moishe Saban

12058.Title: Audacity
12058.Text:
Play only if there are at least 3 cards in HQ.
Trash all cards in HQ. Place a total of 2 advancement tokens on up to 2 cards that can be advanced.

12059.Title: Red Planet Couriers
12059.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click], [click].
Move all advancement tokens from all installed cards to 1 card that can be advanced.

12060.Title: Owl
12060.Text: [subroutine] Add 1 installed program to the top of the stack.

Details.flavor: "It's eyes just keep following you."

12061.Title: Alice Merchant: Clan Agitator
12061.Text: The first time you make a successful run on Archives each turn, the Corp must trash 1 card from HQ.

Details.flavor: Jarogniew's agent provocateur.

12062.Title: Jarogniew Mercs
12062.Text: When you install Jarogniew Mercs, take 1 tag. Place 3 power counters on Jarogniew Mercs, and 1 additional power counter for each tag you have. When there are no power counters left on Jarogniew Mercs, trash it. The Corp cannot trash Jarogniew Mercs while there is another resource installed. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.

12063.Title: Māui
12063.Text: +2[mu] X[recurring-credit] Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of pieces of ice protecting HQ. Limit 1 console per player.

12064.Title: Bug Out Bag
12064.Text: Place X power counters on Bug Out Bag when you install it. If you have no cards in your grip at the end of your turn, draw 1 card for each counter on Bug Out Bag, then trash it.

Details.flavor: Everything you need in case of an emergency.

12065.Title: Keros Mcintyre
12065.Text: The first time you derez a piece of ice each turn, gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor: "I don't bother asking why anymore—he never says—but if I had to guess, it's because he's embezzling and using my runs to disguise it. Not that I care. His credit spends as well as the next guy's" -Moth

12066.Title: Daredevil
12066.Text: +2[mu] The first time you initiate a run on a server protected by 2 or more pieces of ice each turn, draw 2 cards. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "Taking risks is what makes it fun!" -Kabonesa Wu

12067.Title: Mass-Driver
12067.Text: Whenever you use Mass-Driver to break all subroutines on a piece of ice during a single encounter, the first 3 subroutines on the next piece of ice you encounter this run do not resolve. 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

12068.Title: Warroid Tracker
12068.Text: Whenever the Runner trashes 1 or more cards in or protecting this server (including Warroid Tracker), <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner must trash 2 of his or her installed cards.

12069.Title: Loki
12069.Text:
When the Runner encounters Loki, choose another rezzed piece of ice. Until the end of the run, Loki gains the subtypes of that ice and the subroutines of that ice before all Loki's other subroutines.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner shuffles his or her grip into the stack.

12070.Title: Obokata Protocol
12070.Text: As an additional cost to steal Obokata Protocol, the Runner must suffer 4 net damage.

Details.flavor: "Proper application of stress can create the most profound changes." - Tennin Institute Intern Brief

12071.Title: Mirāju
12071.Text:
If the Runner breaks the printed subroutine on Mirāju, he or she is now running on Archives instead of passing Mirāju and approaches the outermost ice, if any. Derez Mirāju.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card. Then, shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.

12072.Title: Shipment from Tennin
12072.Text:
Play only if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
Place 2 advancement tokens on 1 card.

12073.Title: Escalate Vitriol
12073.Text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] for each tag the Runner has. Use this ability only once per turn.

Details.flavor: "Of course words hurt." -Bex Gleeson

12074.Title: Reeducation
12074.Text: When you score Reeducation, add any number of cards from HQ to the bottom of R&D and draw that many cards. The Runner randomly adds the same number of cards from his or her grip to the bottom of the stack, if able.

12075.Title: Traffic Analyzer
12075.Text: Whenever you rez a piece of ice protecting this server, <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "It's all about M.E. Monetizing Everything." -Eryn Nielle

12076.Title: Meteor Mining
12076.Text: When you score Meteor Mining, you may gain 7[credit]. If the Runner has at least 2 tags, you may do 7 meat damage instead.

Details.flavor: "I've got a rock!" - Charles "Mad Dog" Brun, Comet Jockey

12077.Title: Standoff
12077.Text:
When you score Standoff, each player, starting with the Runner, trashes 1 of his or her installed cards until 1 player declines to trash a card. If the Runner declines, draw 1 card and gain 5[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

12078.Title: Success
12078.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, forfeit an agenda and spend [click][click].
Advance a card X times. X equals the advancement requirement of the agenda just forfeited.

Details.flavor: The difference between surviving and thriving is successful terraforming.

12079.Title: Whampoa Reclamation
12079.Text: Trash 1 card from HQ: Add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D. Use this ability only once per turn.

Details.flavor: "Whampoa is the largest and meanest Earth-based mining concern on Mars. They put bodies and waste in the ground as fast as they pull minerals out." - Alice Merchant

12080.Title: Mass Commercialization
12080.Text: Gain 2[credit] for each card with at least 1 advancement token on it.

12081.Title: Mars for Martians
12081.Text: Play only as your first [click]. Draw 1 card for each installed clan resource. Gain 1[credit] for each tag you have.

Details.flavor: "We don't want you! We don't need you!"

12082.Title: God of War
12082.Text: When your turn begins, you may take 1 tag to place 2 virus counters on God of War. Hosted virus counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: "Subtle? You don't really understand the point of all of this, do you?" -Alice Merchant

12083.Title: Leave No Trace
12083.Text: Make a run. When the run ends, derez all ice that was rezzed during this run.

Details.flavor: "The perfect Run is when you get in, take something of value, and get back out, with no one knowing you've ever been there" -g00ru

12084.Title: Rip Deal
12084.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, when you would access any number of cards from HQ, you may instead add that many cards from your heap to your grip. Remove Rip Deal from the game instead of trashing it.

12085.Title: Flashbang
12085.Text:
6[credit]: Derez a sentry currently being encountered.
1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: "It's my sentry cheat sheet" -Revenant

12086.Title: Lean and Mean
12086.Text: Make a run. If you have 3 or fewer programs installed, all icebreakers have +2 strength during this run.

Details.flavor: "The question isn't 'should I do it?' the question is 'can I do it?'" -Kabonesa Wu

12087.Title: Maven
12087.Text:
Maven has +1 strength for each installed program.
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.

12088.Title: Na'Not'K
12088.Text: During each run, Na'Not'K has +1 strength for each piece of ice protecting the attacked server. 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +2 strength.

Details.flavor: "Anyone can hit someone where they are weakest." -S'onge Galaxy

12089.Title: Bloo Moose
12089.Text: When your turn begins, you may remove 1 card in the heap from the game. If you do, gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor:
"Talk is free. Anything else is going to cost you."
-Jitish

12090.Title: O₂ Shortage
12090.Text: The Runner may trash 1 card from his or her grip at random. If he or she does not, gain [click][click].

Details.flavor:
"Is the lack of oxygen causing distress, friend?"
-Gregory 3D3R6Z

12091.Title: Helheim Servers
12091.Text: Trash 1 card from HQ: All ice protecting this server has +2 strength until the end of the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.

12092.Title: Mandatory Seed Replacement
12092.Text: When you score Mandatory Seed Replacement, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers.

Details.flavor: "As you'll see on page 276, section CDXXIX, paragraph 47, line 102 of your contract, you are overdue for your seed upgrade, and all growth from out of date seed is to be confiscated and destroyed."

12093.Title: Water Monopoly
12093.Text: The install cost of each non-virtual resource is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: AgInfusion doesn't just have patents on nearly every plant seed that in farmed on Mars - they own most of the rights to the water that farms use.

12094.Title: Metamorph
12094.Text: [subroutine] Swap 2 other installed pieces of ice or 2 of your installed non-ice cards.

Details.flavor: "My gift to runners: isomorphic architectural protocols. Ichiban daikirai da." -Midori

12095.Title: Data Loop
12095.Text:
When the Runner encounters Data Loop, he or she must add 2 cards from his or her grip to the top of the stack.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run.

12096.Title: Biased Reporting
12096.Text: Choose resource, hardware or program. The Runner may trash any of his or her cards of that type, and gain 1[credit] for each card trashed. Gain 2[credit] for each installed card of the chosen type.

12097.Title: Open Forum
12097.Text: After your mandatory draw, reveal the top card of R&D and add it to HQ. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.

Details.flavor:
"Please, speak freely. I've been tasked by the board itself to hear your grievances."
-Mandy Traut

12098.Title: Tithonium
12098.Text:
You may forfeit an agenda to rez Tithonium instead of paying its rez cost.
Tithonium cannot host cards.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 resource and end the run.

12099.Title: Transparency Initiative
12099.Text: Turn an agenda faceup and install Transparency Initiative on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host agenda gains public. Whenever you advance host agenda, gain 1[credit]."

12100.Title: Rover Algorithm
12100.Text: Install Rover Algorithm on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice has +1 strength for each power counter on Rover Algorithm. Whenever the Runner passes host ice, place 1 power counter on Rover Algorithm."

12101.Title: Mining Accident
12101.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
The Corp must pay 5[credit] or take 1 bad publicity. Remove Mining Accident from the game instead of trashing it.

12102.Title: Respirocytes
12102.Text:
When you install Respirocytes, suffer 1 meat damage.
The first time you have 0 cards in your grip each turn, draw 1 card and place a power counter on Respirocytes. When Respirocytes has 3 or more power counters on it, trash it.

12103.Title: Salvaged Vanadis Armory
12103.Text:
[trash]: The Corp trashes the top X cards of R&D. X is the amount of damage you have suffered this turn. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after suffering any amount of damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

Details.flavor: Vanadis, a Martian arms manufacturer, was among the first sites targeted from orbit during the war.

12104.Title: Aumakua
12104.Text:
Whenever you expose a card or access cards and do not steal or trash any of them, place 1 virus counter on Aumakua.
Aumakua has +1 strength for each virus counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.

Details.flavor: The electric pulses ripped through the Net, backtracking Los's location. When they hit his defenses, they spent themselves against the slope.

12106.Title: Diana's Hunt
12106.Text: Make a run. Whenever you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may install a program from your grip, ignoring all costs. When this run ends, trash all programs installed using Diana's Hunt.

Details.flavor: "I wield the power cosmic - a galactic force that can reshape the Net!" -S'onge Galaxy

12108.Title: Dummy Box
12108.Text: Trash a card from your grip: Prevent an installed card of the same type from being trashed by the Corp.

Details.flavor: "Aptly named." -g00ru

12109.Title: Corporate Defector
12109.Text: Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw a card (not through a card effect), reveal that card.

Details.flavor: He was suddenly very motivated to pass on confidential information.

12110.Title: CFC Excavation Contract
12110.Text: When you score CFC Excavation Contract, gain 2[credit] for each rezzed bioroid.

Details.flavor: "Sure, we also use human labor - they are more easily replaced." -Emil Merk

12111.Title: MCA Austerity Policy
12111.Text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on MCA Austerity Policy. When the Runner's next turn begins, he or she loses [click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
[click],[trash], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click],[click],[click],[click].

12112.Title: Restore
12112.Text: Install and rez 1 card from Archives (paying all costs). Remove all other copies of that card in Archives from the game.

12113.Title: Breached Dome
12113.Text:
If Breached Dome is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Breached Dome, do 1 meat damage and trash the top card of the stack.

12114.Title: Sand Storm
12114.Text: [subroutine] Move Sand Storm so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server). Trash Sand Storm.

Details.flavor: By the time the data storm passed, the landscape was transformed, and she was hopelessly lost.

12115.Title: AR-Enhanced Security
12115.Text: The first time the Runner trashes a Corp card each turn, give him or her 1 tag.

Details.flavor: Only NBN's sec teams were outfitted with systems that could read data flows and see into the Net.

12116.Title: Rolling Brownout
12116.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The play cost of each operation and event is increased by 1. The first time the Runner plays an event each turn, gain 1[credit].

12117.Title: Threat Level Alpha
12117.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag for each tag he or she has; if the Runner has no tags, give him or her 1 tag.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

12118.Title: Priority Construction
12118.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a piece of ice from HQ protecting a remote server (ignoring all costs). Place 3 advancement tokens on that ice.

12119.Title: Fractal Threat Matrix
12119.Text: Each time all the subroutines are broken on a piece of ice protecting this server, trash the top 2 cards of the stack.

Details.flavor: "I embedded recursive data loops into the go-no-go subroutines of every piece of ice." -Anson Rose

12120.Title: Conundrum
12120.Text: Conundrum has +3 strength if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed program. [subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. [subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: A ghost image of it could be made out in the static of his BMI. He hoped never to run across the real thing again.

13001.Title: Steve Cambridge: Master Grifter
13001.Text: The first time each turn that you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap, if able. The Corp removes 1 from the game; the other is added to your grip.

13002.Title: Brute-Force-Hack
13002.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Derez a piece of ice that has a rez cost of X or lower.

Details.flavor: "Bypassing a system's defenses by cutting physical wires is what I like to call old school." - Steve Cambridge

13003.Title: Spear Phishing
13003.Text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.

Details.flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.

13004.Title: SYN Attack
13004.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
The Corp must either discard 2 cards or draw 4 cards.

Details.flavor: Flooding the system with synchronized request messages makes it unresponsive to legitimate requests.

13005.Title: Polyhistor
13005.Text: +1[mu], +1[link] The first time each turn you pass all of the ice protecting HQ, you may draw 1 card to force the Corp to draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.

13006.Title: Abagnale
13006.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.

Details.flavor: "Technology breeds crime."

13007.Title: Lustig
13007.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of sentry ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Lustig.

Details.flavor: "Never boast. Just let your importance be quietly obvious."

13008.Title: Demara
13008.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Demara.

Details.flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."

13009.Title: Mammon
13009.Text: Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. When your turn begins, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Mammon. When your turn ends, remove all hosted power counters.

13010.Title: Charlatan
13010.Text: [click], [click]: Make a run. The first time you approach a rezzed piece of ice during this run, you may pay credits equal to the strength of that ice to bypass it.

Details.flavor: Know your mark, their weaknesses and strengths--both will show how to best bypass their defenses.

13011.Title: Maxwell James
13011.Text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Derez a piece of ice protecting a remote server. Use this ability only if you made a successful run on HQ during this turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>.

Details.flavor: You remember when Maxi was making book for Chacon. He's moved up in the world and gained the veneer of respectability. But as an executive the people he works for now, are far more vicious, bloodthirsty, and crooked.

13012.Title: Ayla "Bios" Rahim: Simulant Specialist
13012.Text:
Before drawing your starting hand, look at the top 6 cards of your stack. Set 4 of them facedown, as NVRAM. Shuffle the rest into your stack.
[click]: Add 1 card from NVRAM to your grip.

13013.Title: Careful Planning
13013.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose a card in or protecting a remote server. That card cannot be rezzed this turn.

Details.flavor: Each AI had been tasked with finding a solution to the same problem but with different variables.

13014.Title: Deep Data Mining
13014.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 1 additional card for each unused MU up to 4.

Details.flavor: Extracting data from complex systems is what running is all about.

13015.Title: LLDS Memory Diamond
13015.Text:
+1[mu], +1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: It is not literally made of diamonds, but it is worth several times its weight in them.

13016.Title: Ubax
13016.Text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios

13017.Title: Adept
13017.Text: Adept has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break sentry or barrier subroutine.

Details.flavor: Μεγάλο μέρος της μάθησης δεν διδάσκει την κατανόηση

13018.Title: Savant
13018.Text: Savant has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break 1 sentry or 2 code gate subroutines.

Details.flavor: Δεν υπἁρχει τίποτα μόνιμο, εκτός από την αλλαγή.

13019.Title: Egret
13019.Text: Install Egret only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains sentry, code gate and barrier.

13020.Title: Dhegdheer
13020.Text:
Dhegdheer can host a single program.
Lower the install cost of programs you install on Dhegdheer by 1.
The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

13021.Title: Levy Advanced Research Lab
13021.Text: [click]: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may add 1 to your grip. Add the rest of the cards to the bottom of your stack in any order.

Details.flavor: Innovation. Iteration. Education.

13022.Title: Laguna Velasco District
13022.Text: Whenever you spend [click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability), draw 1 additional card.

Details.flavor: One of the wealthiest and most powerful areas of New Angeles, Laguna Velasco is also known as the Government District.
Restructuring labor resources.

13024.Title: Officer Frank
13024.Text: [trash], 1[credit]: The Corp trashes 2 cards from HQ at random. Use this ability only if you suffered meat damage this turn.

13025.Title: Dean Lister
13025.Text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. Until the end of the run, that icebreaker has +1 strength for each card in your grip.

Details.flavor: Although he rarely teaches classes these days, his lectures are always well attended.
She left behind an encrypted trail leading to some random employee for a rival corp. She knew lazy sysops would work just hard enough to figure it out and wouldn't bother looking any deeper.

13027.Title: The Shadow Net
13027.Text: [click], forfeit an agenda: Play an event from your heap, ignoring all costs.

Details.flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.

13028.Title: Seidr Laboratories: Destiny Defined
13028.Text: The first time each turn the Runner loses or spends [click] during a run, you may add 1 card from Archives to the top of R&D.

Details.flavor: Interweaving the Past and the Future.

13029.Title: Brain Rewiring
13029.Text: When you score Brain Rewiring, you may pay X[credit] to force the Runner to add X cards from his or her grip to the bottom of his or her stack at random then draw 1 card.

Details.flavor: The black level clearance sub-sub-basement of Haas-Bioroid is a magical place.

13030.Title: Elective Upgrade
13030.Text: Place 2 agenda counters on Elective Upgrade when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.

13031.Title: Successful Field Test
13031.Text: When you score Successful Field Test, install any number of cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.

13032.Title: Estelle Moon
13032.Text:
Whenever you install a card in a server, place 1 power counter on Estelle Moon.
[trash]: Draw 1 card and gain 2[credit] for each power counter on Estelle Moon.

13033.Title: Marilyn Campaign
13033.Text:
Place 8[credit] on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins.
If Marilyn Campaign is trashed while installed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives.

13034.Title: Eli 2.0
13034.Text:
The Runner may spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Eli 2.0.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "A new game means new rules..."

13035.Title: Executive Functioning
13035.Text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

Details.flavor: "Strictly speaking, it isn't illegal to use an interrogation simulator as the blueprint for ICE." - Mason Bellamy

13036.Title: Holmegaard
13036.Text: [subroutine] Trace 4 If successful, the runner cannot access any cards during this run. [subroutine] Trash 1 icebreaker. Errata from FAQ 4.0

13037.Title: Tapestry
13037.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp may add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.

Details.flavor: "The Warp and Weft were hypnotic...but they didn't really seem to do anything to keep me out. But I never seemed to find anything interesting either." - Reaver

13038.Title: Ultraviolet Clearance
13038.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click][click].
Gain 10[credit] and draw 4 cards. Install 1 card (paying all costs).

Details.flavor: "If there were hidden partitions on the server, I'd know; I'm the head of this department!"

13039.Title: Black Level Clearance
13039.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, the Runner must either take 1 brain damage or jack out. If the Runner jacks out, gain 5[credit], draw 1 card, and trash Black Level Clearance.

Details.flavor: Even knowing this floor existed was cause for termination...

13040.Title: Mason Bellamy
13040.Text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses [click], if able.

Details.flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."

13041.Title: Skorpios Defense Systems: Persuasive Power
13041.Text: Whenever a Runner card is trashed (from any location), you may force the Runner to remove it from the game instead of adding it to the heap. Use this ability only once per turn.

Details.flavor: Might makes right

13042.Title: Armored Servers
13042.Text: Place 1 agenda counter on Armored Servers when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: For the remainder of this run, the Runner must trash a card from his or her grip as an additional cost to jack out or break a subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.

13043.Title: Illicit Sales
13043.Text: When you score Illicit Sales, you may take 1 bad publicity. Gain 3[credit] for each bad publicity that you have.

Details.flavor: "Anything, to anyone...for the right price."

13044.Title: Graft
13044.Text: When you score Graft, you may search your deck for up to 3 cards, reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

13045.Title: Illegal Arms Factory
13045.Text:
If the Runner trashes Illegal Arms Factory while it is installed, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.

13046.Title: Mr. Stone
13046.Text: Whenever the Runner takes 1 or more tags, do 1 meat damage.

Details.flavor:
"VP of Retirements and Pensions? So is that HR or Accounting?"
"Both."

13047.Title: Bloodletter
13047.Text: [subroutine] The Runner must either trash 1 program or trash the top 2 cards from his or her stack.

13048.Title: Colossus
13048.Text:
Colossus can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
If Colossus has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it).
[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. (Give the Runner 2 tags.)
[subroutine] Trash 1 program. (Trash 1 program and 1 resource.)

13049.Title: Hailstorm
13049.Text:
[subroutine] Remove a card in the heap from the game.
[subroutine] End the run.

13050.Title: Hortum
13050.Text: Hortum can be advanced. If Hortum has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, its subroutines cannot be broken by AI programs and resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it). [subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 4[credit].) [subroutine] End the run. (Search R&D for up to 2 cards and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D. End the run.) Errata from FAQ 4.0

13051.Title: Hunter Seeker
13051.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
Trash 1 card.

13052.Title: K. P. Lynn
13052.Text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run.

13053.Title: Paper Trail
13053.Text: When you score Paper Trail, Trace 6 If successful, trash all connection and job resources.

13054.Title: Honeyfarm
13054.Text:
If Honeyfarm is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Honeyfarm, he or she loses 1[credit].

13055.Title: Long-Term Investment
13055.Text: When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on Long-Term Investment. If there are at least 8[credit] on Long-Term Investment, it gains "[click]: Take any number of credits from Long-Term Investment."

13056.Title: Weir
13056.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 card from his or her grip.

13057.Title: IPO
13057.Text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.

Gain 13[credit]

20001.Title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter
20001.Text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.

Details.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."

20002.Title: Demolition Run
20002.Text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).

Details.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

20003.Title: Retrieval Run
20003.Text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.

20004.Title: Singularity
20004.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).

20005.Title: Stimhack
20005.Text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.

20006.Title: Cyberfeeder
20006.Text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.

Details.flavor: I feel almost naked without it

20007.Title: Spinal Modem
20007.Text: +1[mu], 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.

20008.Title: Darwin
20008.Text:
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.

20009.Title: Datasucker
20009.Text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.

20010.Title: Force of Nature
20010.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

Details.flavor: It always strikes twice.

20011.Title: Imp
20011.Text:
Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.
Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed).

Details.flavor: Something wicked this way comes.

20012.Title: Hemorrhage
20012.Text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.

Details.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.

20015.Title: Ice Carver
20015.Text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.

Details.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.

20016.Title: Liberated Account
20016.Text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.

Details.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.

20017.Title: Scrubber
20017.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.

Details.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

20018.Title: Xanadu
20018.Text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.

Details.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge

20019.Title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional
20019.Text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
"Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"

20021.Title: Emergency Shutdown
20021.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.

Details.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda

20022.Title: Forged Activation Orders
20022.Text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.

Details.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.

20023.Title: Inside Job
20023.Text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.

Details.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."

20024.Title: Special Order
20024.Text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…

20025.Title: Doppelgänger
20025.Text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: Twice the fun.

20026.Title: HQ Interface
20026.Text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.

Details.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.

20028.Title: Faerie
20028.Text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.

Details.flavor: Do you believe in faeries?

20029.Title: Femme Fatale
20029.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.

Details.flavor: Show-off.

20031.Title: Pheromones
20031.Text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.

20032.Title: Sneakdoor Beta
20032.Text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.

Details.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

20033.Title: Bank Job
20033.Text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.

20034.Title: Crash Space
20034.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.

Details.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.

20035.Title: Fall Guy
20035.Text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].

Details.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.

20036.Title: Mr. Li
20036.Text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.

Details.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
"Have you met Dinosaurus?"
Diesel gives you flames.

20039.Title: Indexing
20039.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.

Details.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.

20040.Title: Modded
20040.Text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.

Details.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.

20041.Title: Notoriety
20041.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

Details.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.

20042.Title: Test Run
20042.Text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.

20043.Title: The Maker's Eye
20043.Text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.

Details.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

20044.Title: Tinkering
20044.Text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.

Details.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."

20045.Title: Dinosaurus
20045.Text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.

20046.Title: Rabbit Hole
20046.Text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.

20047.Title: The Personal Touch
20047.Text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.

Details.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…

20048.Title: Battering Ram
20048.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

20049.Title: Gordian Blade
20049.Text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.

The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.

20051.Title: Pipeline
20051.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

20052.Title: Aesop's Pawnshop
20052.Text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].

Details.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
"I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour

20054.Title: Sacrificial Construct
20054.Text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.

Details.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
"Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
Archaic but reliable.

20058.Title: Crypsis
20058.Text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.

20059.Title: Armitage Codebusting
20059.Text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.

Details.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

20060.Title: Underworld Contact
20060.Text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].

Details.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
A Different Breed of Machine.

20062.Title: Project Ares
20062.Text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: Who wants to start a war?

20063.Title: Project Vitruvius
20063.Text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.

20064.Title: Adonis Campaign
20064.Text:
