Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.

20065.Title: Aggressive Secretary
20065.Text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.

20066.Title: Heimdall 1.0
20066.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.

20067.Title: Hudson 1.0
20067.Text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.

Details.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.

20068.Title: Ichi 1.0
20068.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
Whrrrrr!

20070.Title: Viktor 1.0
20070.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?

20071.Title: Archived Memories
20071.Text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.

Details.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"

"Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.

20074.Title: Shipment from MirrorMorph
20074.Text: Install up to 3 cards from HQ (one at a time and paying all install costs).

Details.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

20075.Title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY
20075.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.

Details.flavor: "Eyes forward please."

20076.Title: Strongbox
20076.Text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.

20077.Title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
20077.Text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.

Details.flavor: Moving Upwards.

20078.Title: Hostile Takeover
20078.Text: When you score Hostile Takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

20079.Title: Project Atlas
20079.Text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

20080.Title: The Cleaners
20080.Text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.

Details.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."

20081.Title: Dedicated Response Team
20081.Text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."

Details.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing

20082.Title: Elizabeth Mills
20082.Text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."

20083.Title: GRNDL Refinery
20083.Text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.

Details.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.

20084.Title: Archer
20084.Text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

20085.Title: Caduceus
20085.Text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, end the run.

Details.flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.

20086.Title: Hadrian's Wall
20086.Text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though." -g00ru

20087.Title: Hive
20087.Text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

20088.Title: Ice Wall
20088.Text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

20089.Title: Shadow
20089.Text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti

The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.

20091.Title: Punitive Counterstrike
20091.Text:
<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>

Details.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

20092.Title: Shipment from Kaguya
20092.Text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.

Details.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."

20093.Title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution
20093.Text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

20094.Title: Braintrust
20094.Text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.

20095.Title: Nisei MK II
20095.Text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.

20096.Title: Project Junebug
20096.Text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.

20097.Title: Ronin
20097.Text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."

Details.flavor: I will serve you…for a time.

20098.Title: Snare!
20098.Text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.

20099.Title: Himitsu-Bako
20099.Text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.

Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.

20101.Title: Swordsman
20101.Text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.

20102.Title: Wall of Thorns
20102.Text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.

20103.Title: Whirlpool
20103.Text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.

Details.flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru

20104.Title: Yagura
20104.Text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

20105.Title: Celebrity Gift
20105.Text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.

Details.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.

20106.Title: Neural EMP
20106.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.

Details.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.

20107.Title: Trick of Light
20107.Text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.

Details.flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.

20108.Title: Hokusai Grid
20108.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.

20109.Title: NBN: Making News
20109.Text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.

Details.flavor: Someone is Always Watching.

20110.Title: Project Beale
20110.Text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.

20111.Title: TGTBT
20111.Text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."

20112.Title: Ghost Branch
20112.Text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.

20113.Title: Data Raven
20113.Text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.

20114.Title: Flare
20114.Text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.

Details.flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.

20115.Title: Pop-up Window
20115.Text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory

20116.Title: Tollbooth
20116.Text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."

20117.Title: Wraparound
20117.Text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
"Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

20119.Title: Closed Accounts
20119.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.

20120.Title: Psychographics
20120.Text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

Details.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

20121.Title: SEA Source
20121.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

20122.Title: Red Herrings
20122.Text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.

20123.Title: Bernice Mai
20123.Text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 5</trace> if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.

Details.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.

20124.Title: False Lead
20124.Text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [click][click], if able.

Details.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.

20125.Title: Priority Requisition
20125.Text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.

Details.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"

20126.Title: Private Security Force
20126.Text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."

Details.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."

"The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
It is like the one you just bought, only better.

20129.Title: Enigma
20129.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."

20130.Title: Hunter
20130.Text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
"There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

21001.Title: By Any Means
21001.Text:
Play only as your first [click].
Until the turn ends, whenever you access a card not in Archives, trash it at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and suffer 1 meat damage.

21002.Title: Yusuf
21002.Text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may place 1 virus counter on Yusuf. Virus counter from any installed card: Break barrier subroutine. Virus counter from any installed card: +1 strength.

21003.Title: Zamba
21003.Text: +2[mu] Whenever a Corp card is exposed, you may gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.

Details.flavor: Mounted holistic lenses download, recompile, and broadcast data faster than a corporate cover-up.

21004.Title: Puffer
21004.Text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. [click]: Place 1 power counter on Puffer or remove 1 power counter from Puffer. Puffer's strength and memory cost are increased by 1 for each power counter on it.

21005.Title: Lewi Guilherme
21005.Text:
When your turn begins, either lose 1[credit] or trash Lewi Guilherme.
The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.

Details.flavor: Brought up in the slums of Jinja, Lewi made his fortune through back alley deals, well-placed bets, and savvy showmanship.

21006.Title: Cyberdelia
21006.Text:
+1[mu]
The first time you break all subroutines on a piece of ice each turn, you may gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Optical computig still has its uses. But it's hard to explain them to people whose eyes glaze over when you bring up the double-slit experiment.

21007.Title: Upya
21007.Text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may place 1 power counter on Upya. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.

Details.flavor: New life through new understanding.

21008.Title: Assimilator
21008.Text: [click],[click]: Turn one of your facedown installed cards faceup. If that card is an event, trash it.

Details.flavor:
"Its only function seems to be repurposing code."
"Can you kill it?" she asked.
"I can try," he said. Guiding his program dead center of the mass, he plunged, piercing the shell before an eruption sent his screen into static. He jacked out, his eyes wide. "I... I think it absorbed my breaker. And everything else."

21009.Title: Asa Group: Security Through Vigilance
21009.Text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install an additional non-agenda card from HQ in or protecting that server (paying all costs).

21010.Title: Ikawah Project
21010.Text: As an additional cost to steal Ikawah Project, the Runner must spend [click] and 2[credit].

Details.flavor: "The average citizen of Nairobi speaks six languages. Every culture, language, and ethnicity of the east of Africa collides here, collapses together. What happens slowly by nature can happen quickly in our lab. We will bring peace." - Dr. Muchina, Project Lead

21011.Title: Najja 1.0
21011.Text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Najja 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.

[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Earth and Sun, together as one.

21012.Title: Gene Splicer
21012.Text: Gene Splicer can be advanced. When the runner accesses Gene Splicer, do 1 net damage for each advancement token on Gene Splicer. [click], 3 advancement tokens: Add Gene Splicer to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

21013.Title: Mganga
21013.Text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spend a different number of credits, do 2 net damage; otherwise do 1 net damage. Trash Mganga.

Details.flavor: Thin enough to pierce netspace. Deadly enough to pierce your mind.

21014.Title: Genotyping
21014.Text: Trash the top 2 cards of R&D, then shuffle up to 4 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Genotyping from the game instead of trashing it.

Details.flavor: Sometimes you have to break a few eggs to sequence a genome.

21015.Title: Echo Chamber
21015.Text: [click], [click], [click]: Add Echo Chamber to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

Details.flavor: "Capitalism runs on two things: amplified arrogance and censored dissent. With those, a corp can create any environment it wants." - Freedom Khumalo

21016.Title: Self-Growth Program
21016.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Add 2 installed Runner cards to the grip.

Details.flavor: Our patented ClearMind™ technology pacifies the trial and tribulations of everyday life.

21017.Title: Calibration Testing
21017.Text:
Install only in a remote server.
[trash]: Place 1 advancement token on a card in this server.

Details.flavor: "Once every week, we perform a drill. Except, I'm the only one who knows it's a drill."

21018.Title: Urban Renewal
21018.Text:
Place 3 power counters on Urban Renewal when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Urban Renewal, trash it and do 4 meat damage.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Urban Renewal.

21019.Title: Wake Up Call
21019.Text: Play only if the Runner trashed at least 1 Corp card during his or her last turn. Choose an installed piece of hardware or non-virtual resource. The Runner must either trash that card or suffer 4 meat damage. Remove Wake Up Call from the game instead of trashing it.

21020.Title: Reconstruction Contract
21020.Text:
Whenever the Runner suffers any amount of meat damage, you may place 1 advancement token on Reconstruction Contract.
[trash]: Move any number of advancement tokens from Reconstruction Contract to a card that can be advanced.

21021.Title: Acacia
21021.Text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, you may gain 1[credit] for each virus counter removed and trash Acacia.

Details.flavor: The system is so deeply rooted, who knows how far the cables run?

21022.Title: Plague
21022.Text:
When you install Plague, choose a server.
Whenever you make a successful run on the chosen server, you may place 2 virus counters on Plague.

Details.flavor: Embedded in the mainframe, it proliferates and devours with each agitation.

21023.Title: Credit Kiting
21023.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Install a card from your grip, lowering its install cost by 8[credit], and take 1 tag.

Details.flavor: The gap of 0.19 seconds was all he needed.

21024.Title: Wari
21024.Text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may trash Wari to name sentry, code gate or barrier. Expose a piece of ice, then add it to HQ if it has the named subtype.

Details.flavor: "He's probably the best pet I've ever had but I'd still trade him for something better." - 419

21025.Title: Kabonesa Wu: Netspace Thrillseeker
21025.Text: [click]: Search your stack for a non-virus program and install it, lowering its install cost by 1[credit], then shuffle your stack. If that program is still installed when your turn ends, remove it from the game.

21026.Title: Takobi
21026.Text: Whenever you break all subroutines on a piece of ice during a single encounter, you may place 1 power counter on Takobi. 2 hosted power counters: Choose a non-AI icebreaker. That icebreaker has +3 strength until the end of the current encounter.

Details.flavor: When standard breaking just doesn't cut it.

21027.Title: Kongamato
21027.Text: [trash]: Break the first subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.

Details.flavor: A winged terror, the Kongamato dives from above, rending its prey in one ferocious bite.

21028.Title: Emergent Creativity
21028.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Trash any number of programs or pieces of hardware from your grip. Search your stack for a program or piece of hardware and install it, lowering its install cost by the total install cost of the trashed cards. Shuffle your stack.

21029.Title: RNG Key
21029.Text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ or R&D each turn, you may name a number. If you do, reveal the next card that you access this run. If it has a rez cost, play cost, or advancement requirement equal to the named number, either gain 3[credit] or draw 2 cards.

Details.flavor: Between nothing and infinity.

21030.Title: Nightdancer
21030.Text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. You have an additional [click] to spend during your next turn.
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. You have an additional [click] to spend during your next turn.

Details.flavor: Witchcraft to the nescient; beauty to the wise.

21031.Title: Jinja City Grid
21031.Text: Whenever you draw a piece of ice, you may reveal it and install it protecting this server, lowering the install cost by 4[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.

Details.flavor: "The site of the world's second beanstalk, or I'll die trying." - Mirja Byanyima, Director of VSEP

21032.Title: Aimor
21032.Text: [subroutine] Trash the top 3 cards of the stack. Trash Aimor.

Details.flavor: "Starving, dehydrated, delirious, I picked a direction and ran, ran for days, maybe even weeks. I ran until my legs couldn't carry me. Then I crawled. When I was finally out, finally free of the shroud, I checked the time, the date. How long had I been gone, trapped in the all-encompassing blackness? Turns out, 3 minutes."

21033.Title: Bacterial Programming
21033.Text: When Bacterial Programming is scored or stolen, you may look at the top 7 cards of R&D, add any number of them to HQ, trash any number of them, and arrange the rest in any order.

21034.Title: Jua
21034.Text:
When the Runner encounters Jua, he or she cannot install cards for the remainder of the turn.
[subroutine] Choose 2 installed Runner cards, if able. The Runner must add 1 of those cards to the top of the stack.

Details.flavor: "It wasn't until the spots cleared that I realized half of my rig was gone." - Kabonesa Wu

21035.Title: Threat Assessment
21035.Text:
Play only if the Runner trashed at least 1 Corp card during his or her last turn.
Choose an installed Runner card. The Runner must either add that card to the top of the stack or take 2 tags. Remove Threat Assessment from the game instead of trashing it.

21036.Title: Economic Warfare
21036.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
The Runner loses 4[credit], if able.

Details.flavor: He found it odd that three frozen yogurt shops, all less than a block from his, opened within the same week.

21037.Title: Forced Connection
21037.Text:
If Forced Connection is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Forced Connection, <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 2 tags. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Forced Connection from Archives.

21038.Title: SSL Endorsement
21038.Text:
When SSL Endorsement is scored or stolen, place 9[credit] from the bank on it.
When the Corp's turn begins, he or she may take 3[credit] from SSL Endorsement. This ability is active even while SSL Endorsement is in the Runner's score area.

21039.Title: NGO Front
21039.Text: NGO Front can be advanced. [trash],1 hosted advancement token: Gain 5[credit]. [trash],2 hosted advancement tokens: Gain 8[credit].

Details.flavor: "Who knew non-profits could be so profitable?"

21040.Title: Distract the Masses
21040.Text: The Runner gains 2[credit]. Trash up to 2 cards from HQ, then shuffle up to 2 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Distract the Masses from the game instead of trashing it.

Details.flavor: "Food. Drinks. Entertainment. It doesn't take much to gratify the bourgeoisie."

21041.Title: eXer
21041.Text:
Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card.
Trash eXer if the Corp purges virus counters.

Details.flavor:
"Amateurs feign it as 'random packet loss'. They do this for safety. They do this out of fear. But why should we cower? We will collapse the Corporatocracy, piece by piece! They are not the ones to fear. We are."
- Freedom Khumalo

21042.Title: Friday Chip
21042.Text: Whenever you trash a Corp card, you may place 1 virus counter on Friday Chip. When your turn begins, you may move 1 hosted virus counter to a virus program.

Details.flavor:
"It makes every bad thing that you do so much better."
- g00ru

21043.Title: Crypt
21043.Text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, you may place 1 virus counter on Crypt. [click], [trash], 3 hosted virus counters: Search your stack for a virus program and install it (paying its install cost), then shuffle your stack.

Details.flavor: The smell of rot strengthens with each step.

21044.Title: Corporate "Grant"
21044.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first time you install a card each turn, the Corp loses 1[credit].

Details.flavor: You'd think someone would have noticed a program entitled "Career Opportunities in Hacking" earlier.

21045.Title: No One Home
21045.Text: The first time you would take any number of tags or suffer any amount of net damage each turn, you may trash No One Home to force the Corp to "<trace>trace 0</trace> If unsuccessful, the Runner avoids any number of tags or prevents any amount of net damage."

Details.flavor: "Go away! I'm not here!"

21046.Title: Marathon
21046.Text: Make a run on a remote server. When the run ends, gain [click] and add Marathon to your grip instead of trashing it if the run was successful. You may not make another run on that server for the remainder of this turn.

21047.Title: Gbahali
21047.Text: [trash]: Break the last subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.

Details.flavor: Ripples are all the prey sees before Gbahali swallows it whole.

21048.Title: White Hat
21048.Text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Force the Corp to "<trace>trace 3</trace> If unsuccessful, reveal all cards in HQ. The Runner may choose up to 2 of the revealed cards. Shuffle those cards into R&D."

21049.Title: Kuwinda K4H1U3
21049.Text:
When your turn begins, you may <trace>trace X</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage and trash Kuwinda K4H1U3. If unsuccessful, place 1 power counter on Kuwinda K4H1U3.
X is the number of power counters on Kuwinda K4H1U3.

21050.Title: NEXT Sapphire
21050.Text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [subroutine] Draw up to X cards. [subroutine] Add up to X cards from Archives to HQ. [subroutine] Shuffle up to X cards from HQ into R&D.

Details.flavor: Every level of protection for all of your security needs.

21051.Title: Anansi
21051.Text:
Whenever an encounter with Anansi ends, do 3 net damage unless the Runner broke all subroutines on it.
[subroutine] Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] You may draw 1 card. The Runner may pay 2[credit] to draw 1 card.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

21052.Title: Code Replicator
21052.Text: When the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you may trash Code Replicator to force the Runner to approach that piece of ice again.

Details.flavor: for (;;)

21053.Title: Reverse Infection
21053.Text:
Choose one:
  • Purge virus counters. Trash 1 card from the top of the stack for every 3 virus counters removed.
  • Gain 2[credit].

21054.Title: Azmari EdTech: Shaping the Future
21054.Text: When your turn ends, you may name a card type. Gain 2[credit] the first time each turn the Runner plays or installs a card that has the type you last named this way.

21055.Title: Degree Mill
21055.Text: As an additional cost to steal Degree Mill, the Runner must shuffle 2 installed Runner cards into the stack.

Details.flavor:
Master any subject in 30 minutes or less!*
*Azmari EdTech is not responsible for altered memories or reduced temporal lobe functionality. Level of mastery may vary.

21056.Title: Personalized Portal
21056.Text: When your turn begins, the Runner draws 1 card, then you may gain 1[credit] for every 2 cards in the grip.

Details.flavor: "Welcome to Azmari Mail! You have 4,196 unread messages."

21057.Title: Armed Intimidation
21057.Text: When you score Armed Intimidation, the Runner must either suffer 5 meat damage or take 2 tags.

Details.flavor: "The way I see it, you've got two options: die here or die running. I'll enjoy both."

21058.Title: Death and Taxes
21058.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Whenever the Runner installs a card or trashes an installed card, you may gain 1[credit].

Details.flavor: The only certainties.

21059.Title: Trojan Horse
21059.Text:
Play only if the Runner accessed at least 1 card during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, trash 1 installed program with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.

21060.Title: TechnoCo
21060.Text: The install cost of each program, piece of hardware, and virtual resource is increased by 1. Whenever the Runner installs a program, piece of hardware, or virtual resource, you may gain 1[credit].

21061.Title: Glut Cipher
21061.Text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to choose 5 cards from Archives and add them to HQ, if able, then trash that many cards from HQ at random.

Details.flavor: "Ever watch a server vomit?"

21062.Title: Knobkierie
21062.Text: +3[mu] Use the MU on Knobkierie only for virus programs. The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may place 1 virus counter on an installed virus program. Limit 1 console per player.

21063.Title: 419: Amoral Scammer
21063.Text: The first time the Corp installs a card each turn, you may expose that card unless the Corp pays 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "Is there anything better than free money?"

21064.Title: Falsified Credentials
21064.Text: Name a card type. Expose a card in a remote server, then gain 5[credit] if the exposed card has the named card type.

Details.flavor:
"I'm sorry, sir, we weren't expecting you! You look different than I remember..."
"Haircut."

21065.Title: Rogue Trading
21065.Text:
Place 18[credit] from the bank on Rogue Trading when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Rogue Trading, trash it.
[click], [click]: Take 6[credit] from Rogue Trading and take 1 tag.

21066.Title: Because I Can
21066.Text: Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may force the Corp to shuffle all cards in that server into R&D.

Details.flavor: At least this time around, the graphic was family-friendly.

21067.Title: Nyashia
21067.Text:
Place 3 power counters on Nyashia when it is installed.
Whenever you access cards from R&D, you may remove 1 hosted power counter to access 1 additional card from R&D.

Details.flavor: Speed gets you in, intuition gets you out.

21068.Title: Consume
21068.Text:
Whenever you trash a Corp card, you may place 1 virus counter on Consume
[click]: Gain 2[credit] for each hosted virus counter, then remove all virus counters from Consume.

Details.flavor:
"It 'ate' the vertex grid?! What does that even mean?"
- Nkiru Qiū, Asa Group sysop

21069.Title: Malia Z0L0K4
21069.Text: When you rez Malia Z0L0K4, choose an installed non-virtual resource. The text box of that resource is blank.

Details.flavor: A Model G21V Tracker, Malia Z0L0K4 excels at locating assignments and subduing them.

21070.Title: Kill Switch
21070.Text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Whenever an agenda is accessed or scored, trace 3 If successful, do 1 brain damage.

Details.flavor: "Don't worry, he won't feel a thing! Probably."

21071.Title: Tempus
21071.Text:
If Tempus is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Tempus, <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, the Runner must lose [click][click] or suffer 1 brain damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Tempus from Archives.

21072.Title: Bio Vault
21072.Text: Install only in a remote server. Bio Vault can be advanced. [trash], 2 hosted advancement tokens: End the run.

Details.flavor: Many things go in. Nothing comes out.

21073.Title: Sadaka
21073.Text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and either arrange them in any order or shuffle R&D. You may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] You may trash 1 card in HQ. If you do, trash 1 resource. Trash Sadaka.

21074.Title: Endless EULA
21074.Text:
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].

Details.flavor: "Has anyone ever actually read one of these things?" - 419

21075.Title: Sandman
21075.Text:
[subroutine]Add an installed Runner card to the grip.
[subroutine]Add an installed Runner card to the grip.

Details.flavor: Your first dog, your favorite food, your own mother's name. Your love, your hate, your fear. Hopes and dreams, pain and sorrow. All of it, everything, slips away.

21076.Title: Amani Senai
21076.Text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may <trace>trace X</trace> If successful, add an installed Runner card to the grip. X is the advancement requirement of the scored or stolen agenda.

Details.flavor: Azmari EdTech's most popular instructor, Amani Senai regularly broadcasts to millions of students.

21077.Title: SSO Industries: Fueling Innovation
21077.Text: When your turn ends, you may choose a piece of ice with no advancement tokens on it. If you do, place 1 advancement token on that piece of ice for each agenda point on all installed faceup agendas.

21078.Title: City Works Project
21078.Text:
Install City Works Project faceup.
When the Runner accesses City Works Project while it is installed, do 2 meat damage and 1 additional meat damage for each advancement token on it.

21079.Title: Oduduwa
21079.Text:
When the Runner encounters Oduduwa, place 1 advancement token on it. You may place X advancement tokens on another piece of ice. X is the number of advancement tokens on Oduduwa.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: Might given form.

21080.Title: Rashida Jaheem
21080.Text: When your turn begins, you may trash Rashida Jaheem to gain 3[credit] and draw 3 cards.

Details.flavor: She gets the job done. And then some.

21081.Title: Freedom Khumalo: Crypto-Anarchist
21081.Text: Once per turn, you may remove X virus counters from your installed cards to trash a card that you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed). X is that card's rez or play cost.

21082.Title: Trypano
21082.Text:
Install Trypano only on a piece of ice.
When Trypano has 5 or more virus counters on it, trash host ice.
When your turn begins, you may place 1 virus counter on Trypano.

Details.flavor: Twisting, writhing, ripping into all that it touches.

21083.Title: Contaminate
21083.Text: Place 3 virus counters on an installed Runner card with no hosted virus counters.

Details.flavor: "What kind of maniac infects their own rig?!"

21084.Title: Embezzle
21084.Text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, name asset, ice, operation or upgrade, then reveal 2 cards from HQ at random. Trash each revealed card that has the named type, then gain 4[credit] for each card trashed this way.

21085.Title: Slipstream
21085.Text: Whenever you pass a rezzed piece of ice, you may trash Slipstream. If you do, choose a piece of ice protecting a central server in the same position as the passed ice. You are now approaching that ice.

Details.flavor: Filaments occasionally flare from the Network, manifesting ephemeral threads between random domains.

21086.Title: Laamb
21086.Text: When you encounter a piece of ice, you may pay 2[credit] to have it gain barrier until the end of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn. 2[credit]: break any number of barrier subroutines. 3[credit]: +6 strength.

21087.Title: Gebrselassie
21087.Text: [click]: Host Gebrselassie on an installed non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker returns to its base strength at the end of each turn rather than each encounter.

Details.flavor: Go for distance.

21088.Title: Compile
21088.Text: Make a run. The first time you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may search your stack or heap for a program and install it, ignoring all costs. When the run ends, add that program to the bottom of your stack if it is still installed.

21089.Title: Logic Bomb
21089.Text: [trash]: Bypass a piece of ice you are currently encountering. Lose any remaining clicks.

Details.flavor: "Could God create a stone so heavy, He could not lift it?"

21090.Title: Jackpot!
21090.Text:
When your turn begins, you may place 1[credit] on Jackpot!.
Whenever an agenda is added to your score area, you may take any number of credits from Jackpot!. If you do, trash Jackpot!.

Details.flavor: "Jackpot!"

21091.Title: Remote Enforcement
21091.Text: When you score Remote Enforcement, you may search R&D for a piece of ice, install it protecting a remote server (paying its install cost), and rez it, ignoring its rez cost, then shuffle R&D.

21092.Title: Kamali 1.0
21092.Text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Kamali 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed resource.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed piece of hardware.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed program.

21093.Title: Warden Fatuma
21093.Text: Each piece of rezzed bioroid ice gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able." before all of its other subroutines.

Details.flavor: "It's neither cruel nor unusual. Merely efficient."

21094.Title: Viral Weaponization
21094.Text: When the turn on which you scored Viral Weaponization ends, do 1 net damage for each card in the grip.

Details.flavor: Quicker and deadlier than ever imagined, the trial was an outstanding success.

21095.Title: Envelope
21095.Text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

Details.flavor: "On one hand, I knew I shouldn't touch it. On the other, it was really shiny." - Kabonesa Wu

21096.Title: Mwanza City Grid
21096.Text: Install only in the root of HQ or R&D. Whenever the Runner accesses cards from this server, he or she accesses 3 additional cards. After accessing, gain 2[credit] for each card accessed. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Mwanza City Grid. Limit 1 region per server.

21097.Title: Standard Procedure
21097.Text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run on his or her last turn.
Name a card type, then reveal the grip. Gain 2[credit] for each card in the grip that has the named type.

21098.Title: Intake
21098.Text: If Intake is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses Intake, trace 4 If successful, add an installed program or virtual resource to the grip. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Intake from Archives.

21099.Title: Masvingo
21099.Text:
Masvingo can be advanced.
When you rez Masvingo, place 1 advancement token on it.
Masvingo gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.

Details.flavor: No matter which direcion ze climbed, the blocks reshuffled, zipping in from left to right, bottom to top. It was going to be a long hike.

21100.Title: Overseer Matrix
21100.Text: Whenever the Runner trashes a card in this server, you may pay 1[credit] to give the Runner 1 tag. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Overseer Matrix.

Details.flavor: The blast doesn't hurt, but what comes after does.

21101.Title: Zer0
21101.Text: [click], suffer 1 net damage: Gain 1[credit] and draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn.

Details.flavor: Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Code. Sleep. Code. Code. Code. Eat. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code.

21102.Title: Musaazi
21102.Text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may place 1 virus counter on Musaazi. Virus counter from any installed card: Break sentry subroutine. Virus counter from any installed card: +1 strength.

21103.Title: Hippo
21103.Text: The first time you break all subroutines on the outermost piece of ice during a run each turn, you may remove Hippo from the game to trash that piece of ice.

Details.flavor: Getting it up the stairs was enough for him to know that if he ever moved, it was staying.

21104.Title: Amina
21104.Text: 2[credit]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. The first time each turn an encounter ends in which you used Amina to break all subroutines on a piece of ice, the Corp loses 1[credit].

Details.flavor: Her gallop, thunder; her blade, lightning.

21105.Title: Diversion of Funds
21105.Text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may force the corp to lose up to 5[credit], then you may gain 1[credit] for each credit lost.

21106.Title: PAD Tap
21106.Text:
The first time the Corp gains credits through a card ability each turn, you may gain 1[credit].
[click], 3[credit]: Trash PAD Tap. Only the Corp can use this ability.

Details.flavor:
"You called me, sir?"
"Why does my PAD keep flashing 'Sensitive Information Transfer'?!"
"Hmm, that's strange. Mine only does that on Tuesdays."

21107.Title: Reclaim
21107.Text: [click], [trash], trash a card from your grip: Install a program, piece of hardware, or virtual resource from your heap, paying its install cost.

Details.flavor: It was a deal, to be sure. She just didn't know for which party.

21108.Title: Engolo
21108.Text: When you encounter a piece of ice, you may pay 2[credit] to have it gain code gate until the end of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +4 strength.

21109.Title: Flame-out
21109.Text:
Flame-out can host a single program.
When you install Flame-out, place 9[credit] on it. Use these credits to pay for using hosted program.
When a turn ends in which you used credits on Flame-out, trash hosted program.

21110.Title: Black Hat
21110.Text: Force the Corp to "<trace>Trace 4</trace> If unsuccessful, the Runner accesses 2 additional cards whenever he or she accesses cards from HQ or R&D for the remainder of this turn.

Details.flavor: "The way I see it, I'm teaching them a lesson in the importance of basic security." - Sunny Lebeau

21111.Title: Kasi String
21111.Text:
The first time a successful run on a remote server ends each turn, you may place 1 power counter on Kasi String if you accessed cards and stole no agendas.
When Kasi String has 4 or more power counters on it, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

21112.Title: NEXT Diamond
21112.Text: The rez cost of NEXT Diamond is lowered by 1 for each other rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed Runner card.

Details.flavor: Defenses that last forever.

21113.Title: Riot Suppression
21113.Text:
Play only if the Runner trashed at least 1 Corp card during his or her last turn.
The Runner has 3 fewer [click] to spend during his or her next turn. The Runner may immediately suffer 1 brain damage to prevent this. Remove Riot Suppression from the game instead of trashing it.

21114.Title: Mti Mwekundu: Life Improved
21114.Text: Once per turn, when the Runner approaches a server, you may install a piece of ice protecting that server in the innermost position, ignoring all costs. The Runner is now approaching that ice.

21115.Title: Mlinzi
21115.Text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner trashes the top 2 cards of the stack.
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage unless the Runner trashes the top 3 cards of the stack.
[subroutine] Do 3 net damage unless the Runner trashes the top 4 cards of the stack.

21116.Title: Better Citizen Program
21116.Text: The first time the Runner plays a run event or installs an icebreaker program each turn, you may give the Runner 1 tag.

Details.flavor: "Deep down, everyone wants to be good. We ensure that desire is met." - Taavi Gyula

21117.Title: Market Forces
21117.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses 3[credit] for each tag he or she has, then you gain 1[credit] for each credit lost.

Details.flavor: "Once we have enough data, we can make the Invisible Hand more like an Invisible Fist."

21118.Title: Surveyor
21118.Text:
X is twice the number of ice protecting this server.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, give the Runner 2 tags.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, end the run.

Details.flavor:
INTRUDER ALERT!
INTRUDER ALERT!
INTRUDER NEUTRALIZED!

21119.Title: High-Profile Target
21119.Text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Do 2 meat damage for each tag the Runner has.

Details.flavor: "You can't do thi..."

21120.Title: False Flag
21120.Text: False Flag can be advanced. When the Runner accesses False Flag, give the Runner 1 tag for every 2 advancement tokens on False Flag. [click], 7 hosted advancement tokens: add False Flag to your score area as an agenda worth 3 agenda points.

22001.Title: Nathaniel "Gnat" Hall: One-of-a-Kind
22001.Text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have 2 or fewer cards in your grip.

Details.flavor: "Damn, I'm good."
"Worth it."

22004.Title: Patchwork
22004.Text: +1[mu] Once per turn, when you would play or install a card, you may trash 1 card from your grip to lower the play or install cost by 2. Limit 1 console per player.

22006.Title: Cradle
22006.Text: Cradle has -1 strength for each card in your grip. 2[credit]: Break any number of code gate subroutines.

Details.flavor: ... clack... clack... clack...

22015.Title: Akiko Nisei: Head Case
22015.Text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, you and the Corp secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Corp spent the same number of credits, access 1 additional card from R&D.

22017.Title: Mind's Eye
22017.Text: +1[mu] Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may place 1 power counter on Mind's Eye. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Access the top card of R&D. Limit 1 console per player.

22021.Title: Psych Mike
22021.Text: The first time a successful run on R&D ends each turn, you may gain 1[credit] for each card you accessed from R&D.

Details.flavor:
"Breathe, girl. Breathe." Mike flickered into focus as she brushed Akiko's tears away. "What did you see?"
"I..." Akiko hesitated. "Everything."

22025.Title: DJ Fenris
22025.Text: Host a g-mod identity that does not match the faction of your identity on DJ Fenris when he is installed. Remove hosted identity from the game if DJ Fenris is trashed. DJ Fenris gains the text of the hosted identity.

22034.Title: Saraswati Mnemonics: Endless Exploration
22034.Text: [click], 1[credit]: Install a card from HQ in a remote server, then place 1 advancement token on it. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.

22035.Title: Jumon
22035.Text: When your turn ends, place 2 advancement tokens on a card installed in a server.

Details.flavor: "Jumon, all too Jumon..."

22036.Title: API-S Keeper Isobel
22036.Text: When your turn begins, you may remove an advancement token from an installed card to gain 3[credit].

Details.flavor: "Supersedure is all part of our scheduled maintenance."

22040.Title: Hangeki
22040.Text:
Play only if the Runner trashed a Corp card during his or her last turn.
Choose an installed Corp card. The Runner may access that card. If he or she does, remove Hangeki from the game instead of trashing it; otherwise, add Hangeki to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point.

22042.Title: Acme Consulting: The Truth You Need
22042.Text: The Runner is considered to have 1 additional tag (even if they have 0) during encounters with the outermost piece of ice protecting any server.

22046.Title: Hydra
22046.Text:
[subroutine] Do 3 net damage if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] Gain 5[credit] if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.

22047.Title: Eavesdrop
22047.Text: Install Eavesdrop on a piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Whenever the Runner encounters host ice, <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag."

Details.flavor: "No, the audio is fine. It just never seems to turn off."

22050.Title: The Outfit: Family Owned and Operated
22050.Text: Gain 3[credit] whenever you take at least 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor: We do things our way

22056.Title: Too Big to Fail
22056.Text:
Play only if you have fewer than 10[credit].
Gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.

Details.flavor:
"This is blackmail!"
"No, this extortion."
